There are many other buildings to enthuse over least not the Sagrada Familia.
Love the roof views. I enjoyed the roof views more than the actually house. House didn't impress me that much. It was a decent but nothing special. I enjoyed casa Batllo much more than this house.
Super!. amazing! Gaudi really was a master! the only bad thing was the over crowded the apartment was ! the terrace was my favorite part

Take the night tour. There's a night tour. It is magical and absent of crowds. You get to see everything in silence. Such a unique history. People still live here@ rent controlled. At the end of the tour is,champagne. It is dreamy on the room all lit up.

One of the most emblematic buildings of Catalan Modernism. This Antoni Gaudi's so strange and so curved building doesn't have walls who support it's weight, it's suspended by columns and beams only. Their asymmetrical lines, their hundreds of arcs in shape of catenary and their significant wrought iron balconies makes this construction one of the most visited places in Barcelona.This relevant catalan architect, who designed la Sagrada Familia as well, was aware to follow all the nature trends and behaviors like the mentioned catenaries, the hexagonal bee hives or the fractal rules.It's really not expensive (about 20€ with audio-guides included) to visit this world unique construction.

Iconic building. Once considered a pariah by fellow architects, Gaudi proves that ingenuity is timeless. La Pedredera audio tour is one the easiest way to get inside the mind of this brilliant catalonian figure. A self-defined atheist whose biggest proyect (yet to be finished) was financed by the catholic church sounds like pure madness but this is just one intriguing facet that defines Antoni Gaudí. This attraction is easily accesible by public transportation. Despite the fact this is a tourist attraction please keep in mind that this still a residential building (nit a museum) so bear that in mind when visiting La Pedrera.

Fantastic insight into Gaudi's work. I would call it one of the more 'authentic' type conglomeration of things & works that Gaudi performed during his career. The audio guide is very nicely prepared to make the user/visitor understand, apart from well placed models of for example, how he visualized the curves & arches he designed. Must visit for architects & structural engineers!
Love Gaudi's work.. The house was fascinating and well worth the visit. I love Barcelona and the Gaudi houses give it such an original appearance.
Stunning city. Thought a week might be too long. Didn't get to see everything we wanted to so we will just have to go back. Loved Barcelona

Cool place. The visit is less "luxurious" than your Casa Batllo. The price is therefore cheaper, and worse quality headphones and accessories for the audio guide. It is 3 mins walk away from Casa Batllo, 5 mins away from the nearest Metro stop, Passeig de Gracia. The visit starts with an exhausting trundle up stairs all the way to the roof but you are rewarded with an amazing sight. The roof is fairly big, and frequent winds make you feel less oven-baked. Afterwards, you go down through the insides and out. The whole visit takes roughly 2 hours max. Nearby are also high-end stores, e.g. Luis Vuitton, Dior, Longchamp... IF YOU HAVE THE MONEY OF COURSE!!! It is not far from La Rambla, Barcelona's famous shopping spree avenue. ENJOY UR VISIT, REMEMBER TO BOOK ONLINE :)
Night visit. I enjoyed it thoroughly, just wish it included a peek to one of the apartments which is available with the daytime tour.Gave insight and appreciation to Gaudi.
The rooftop is the best. We didn't buy on line and queued for about 15 mins. Not bad as it is peak tourist season. I lived the roof.If you feel a bit funny about heights it is fine..not scarey.
Awesome sight. Yet another amazing building by Gaudi. Once again the detail and originality of the building is outstanding. Another must see when visiting Barcelona.

Expensive but worth it. A little on the expensive side to visit just one building - but what a building! To make it worth the admission charge, the visit is well organized and you get an audioguide that definately helps you appreciate Gaudi's thought process and work.

Another spectacular Gaudi attraction. La Pedrera (or Casa Mila) is another site that shouldn't be missed when in Barcelona. The rooftop is awesome and make sure you get the audio when purchasing the tickets otherwise you won't really understand how spectacular Guadi was as an architect. We toured this site first thing in the morning at 9am. Wasn't crowed at it. Then were able to walk a little bit down the street and visit Casa Batllo all before lunch. Purchase your tickets online in advance.

Fantastic rooftop and views. What an amazing building and architecture. We purchased tickets, the tickets are not cheap but they are worth it.We were able to visit Gaudi's apartment and a small museum. But the most amazing thing was being able to go to the rooftop. WOW!!! What a view of the city!!! The chimneys are amazing. The architecture is definitely different but outstanding. Casa Mila is a must while visiting Barcelona.

Before His Time!. Gaudí must have been an amazing, innovative man who was before his time to archetect this masterpiece. We paid the extra fee for Premium Access which was well worth it. We entered right into the place through a special Premium Access, given our audio devices, and we were swept to the front of the line for the elevator. We spent about 2 hours touring the building. Highly recommended!

Nice for roof top. Very interesting roof top, nice to visit in the night as in top up with lights snd special effect s. If you don't want surprise print your ticket before if you book on line they don't accept e tickets.

Good organization. We came to see La Pedrera on wednesday in July without ticket reservation and waited only 5 min. Ticket was 20,5 eur but it's worth to see. You also get a headphones to hear about the Gaudi, see the fameous roof and historic apartment. Organization is good.

Mesmerizingly Gaudi. It is best that you get your tickets ahead of time. The tour is really educational. The guides and staff are very competent. Be sure to wear comfy shoes as there will be a lot of stair climbing and walking. Reaching thr top, we were treated to a spectacular light and sound show unlike any other. We thoroughly enjoyed and was delighted to be treated to a cocktail party after the tour. We went back to our hotel amazed, mesmerized and in awe od Gaudi's genius as well as Barcelona's effort in keeping the place interesting to tourists and well maintained.

Beautiful Architecture. This building has very unique design and beautiful. The ticket counter is very long so make sure to purchase the tickets online or purchase the vip ticket to save time. The tickets are expensive. If you have a passion for building do not miss to visit this building or else you still ommit this from your itinerary.
Magical Place. Design and usage of everything in the building is magnificent. And also use of rooftop space and natural light is beyond thinking.
neat attraction. loved the audio tour part. you get to go at your own place. it wasn't too crowded when we went their in the early afternoon.
Like a fairy tale. You should visit this Gaudi's nice place especially the terace is so nice with a view of Barcelona.You can easily find tickets but it is your choice to give 20 euro of course

Turn of the century - Star Wars!! Gaudi ahead of his time!. Casa Mila is called the Padrera or "Quarry" because it gives the impression of undulating stone. There isn't a straight line inside or out. Built with astonishing technicality, there is a wonderful sense of space inside because there are no load-bearing walls! Gaudi is known for his curved lines & decorated chimneys & this structure is no exception. The curvy lines of the roof, above stories of twisted iron balconies, give rise to the "witch-scarer" chimneys above the roof. Gaudi is a one-of-a- kind Alice in Wonderland architect!!

Beautiful Gaudi Building. I've become such a Gaudi fan since my recent trip to Barcelona. This is now a mixed use building that Gaudi designed in his unique, detail oriented and visually sumptuous style. While the exterior is very cool, it's the interior that will fascinate and delight you. The rooftop provides one of the best panoramic views of the city as well as a mosaic masterpiece.

The look, the architecture, the use of space and natural light and the use of the roof space were all a delight.. Make this your first stop in Barcelona, book an early time to beat the crowd. Take your time and take it all in. Then go and see Sagrada Familia and Park Geull. My wife and I have never seen anything like what we saw. Antoni Guadi's work is sensational.
Rooftop saved the day!. Even though as a building itself is magnificent, I found the entrance fee a bit pricey. I think we paid 16,50 euros per person and that included student discount.

Amazing innovations of his time, spatial relationship and ergonometry. Joined the night guided tour. Some of the innovative features of Gaudi's time: big balconies, basement garage, use of rooftop space... The exhibition on the top floor was well worth. The light show on the rooftop was not impressive but the concealment of different facilities and the design were nice. Admired the furniture designed by Gaudi, too. A shame that the clients didn't appreciate it.
Star wars?. Like every Gaudi masterpiece, this aslo makes you wonder about what it is all about.. UNIQUE AND FASCINATING BUILDING..

A travel in time. This building is a great visit, you will discover an architectural masterpiece, and be able to visit an apartment with the original design and decoration, have a nice view from the roof top on the city, but the most amazing part is the fact there are still families living in the building so this is a live museum, had the chance to also visit the wood made lift which is making you feel you traveled back in time.

Gaudi rooftop views. Definitely worth a visit. Went later in the evening, the line was relatively short (15 min wait). There was a band playing on the rooftop, which was nice while we strolled through the sculptures and took in the view of the city.Coming down from the roof, the apartment inside is interesting, as is the history of this building.
A must see for architecture freaks!. Keept in a perfect state, every thing looks really like from the times of Gaudi's life. The museum inside is also showing another works of the architect.
Beautiful home - fascinating architecture. Loved visiting this home - how the architecture and the home worked well together. Was a fascinating visit.

Casa Mira is great. The tour is a bit expensive but very nice. It includes the audio with entrance which is nice. I would hit this or Casa Batllo with Sagrada Familia when you visit Barcelona. The tour of the flat, roof top and some of the models are really nice.
Rooftop makes it worth the visit. Rooftop is five star, apartment is 3 star. Didn't love audio tour. not well setup like his other residence.
Very Nice. Great building with a very nice audio tour that explains its unique qualities. You can book ticks on line soyou do not have to wait.

Gaudi art piece. It's Gaudi art who has designed this place , it's worth visiting when in Barcelona , it's very centrally located n it have one more of his art building near by , best of shops in an around now this place government is maintaining

Wow, so glad I got there.. I learnt of Casa Mila several years ago and said I would like to visit, I had a significant Birthday this year and my Daughter took me to Barcelona. It was so exciting to finally get there. It is far more spectacular than any photo's I have seen. It's worth the visit for the Passeig de Gracia alone. Then there is the crowning glory of the roof terrace, which were the original photo's I saw that sparked my interest. The staff were all warm, friendly and informative. Personally I have health issues and am slow and found it was lovely to tour at my pace and was not rushed by a more formal style tour. We also found booking tickets online the night before over drinks in the hotel was the best way to go, it cuts out the long queues and the doubt about wether you will get in or not. Well worth the visit, I loved it.
Fantastic! . We stayed for 3 and a half hours. The roof is still my favorite place. I feel like hugging the "soldiers" as I call them each time I visit it. I am a big Gaudi fan!

Enchanting . La Pedrera's rooftop is worth the ticket's price! (which is a little expensive)Feels like diving into a different dimension.The audioguide's pretty interesting and gives you a detailed analysis of Gaudí's life and works.

A Must! Well worth the time!. Barcelona and Gaudi are dang-near synonymous! We visited Palau Guell, Parc Guell, Sagrada Familia, and La Pedrera, and of the four sites, this ties with Palau at second best-Basilica Sagrada Familia by far in a class all its own (BSF!).

What a sight (outside review). La Pedrera, aka Casa Mila, is located in Passeig de Gracia which is a road with popular attractions.I didn't go inside as there was no time but the outside layout is worth passing by and photographing.

A must do.... There are various options in Barcelona to see Gaudi's work up and close, namely Parc Guell, Casa Ballito and La Pedrera (Casa Mila). A visit to La Pedrera offers an excellent overview to the architecture (the audio guided tour up in the roof excellently balance technical and historical details) and the apartment showcases the life of the middle-class (probably the newly rich in today's terms) in the early 1900s. The advance purchased premium ticket is well worth the additional money...it allows you to enter through the front gate and gives you immediate access to the lift up to the roof. The website is very well designed and informative (especially the video clips), the staff is very friendly and makes the premium ticket holders feel special. There is also an option to get a picture of yourself. The shop at the end of the tour has excellent stylish articles and not any of the tacky stuff one often find at such establishments.

La Pedrera - a visionary of Total Art by Antoni Gaudi (1906 - 1912). At the height of his career at age 54 Antoni Gaudi planned this building and it was his last civil engineering work. He was fascinated by Nature & Geometry, used his innovations that shaped the architecture of the late 19 and early 20 European centuries. But he never bowed to the rules of Modernisme (Catalan Art Nouveau). His main ideas concentrate in The Courtyards, The Roof Terrace and the 100 years of a living monument - The Pedrera Apartment which located on the fourth Floor.The building was recognized by UNESCO as World Heritage in 1984.
Wonderful. We had a short queue to get in. Wonderful to wander around the roof top and be able to go in to one of the apartments.

Wow!. Incredible to tour this Gaudi masterpiece. An architect with an imagination for the fantastic along with a mathematical mind to calculate precisely every angle. I believe I read that he called himself "a geometer." Everywhere you look, there is something beautiful or extraordinary/fantastic to catch your eye. Pricey to enter, though.
Looks great. It is easy to find and it looks pretty cool. If you are at la Rambla it takes only some minutes to go there. If you have the time you should relly take a look at it.

Great place to learn about Gaudi! . We paid for the whenever you want to come tour. Worth it. Skipped the line and got an audio guide which helped a lot. Worth every penny. Great views from the top and great audio about the house and how it was built along with other of his buildings. Worth stopping and seeing despite the high price. Took photos of the other gaudi places but didn't go in to those. Lots of stairs going down though. Still worth it.
Fun and short visit of Gaudi's work.. The visit is short and the kids loved it. We found a lot about Gaudi and his vision of design in this museum.
La pedrera. Wow what architecture, stunning views and interesting audio commentary. Book a time slot in advance to avoid crowds.
Rooftop views.. The rooftop is fantastic. Wonderful and weird. Great for taking nice photos. I didn't look at the indoor exhibitions as I wasn't really interested in that.

Visited twice in one day!. What's more can I say? We visited it twice in one day. In the morning we had the tour using audioguide. In the evening we had the guided evening visit and the light and sound show at the roof top. We all see nature in front of our eyes, but transferring it into art... That is where genius of Gaudi kicks in and we loved learning about it.

See it during the day. Don't waste money on night tour.. I went on the night tour with the rooftop light show and cava toast. I thought the light show was gimmicky and actually prevented me from being able to see the structures on the roof. Additionally, we did not get to see the interior of an apartment; this feature is only available during daytime hours. I think I would have enjoyed a day tour much more, and I think the $34 euro admission price for the night tour was way over-priced. It's a beautiful building. Definitely see it. Be sure to buy your ticket in advance.

Not sure its worth the $25. You definitely want to walk past this building to see the interesting architecture but I'm not sure it's worth the money to see the limited amount of room available to the public.

Beautiful roof. The roof is simply beautiful, full of details. Also loved the entry. However, there's a floor that show the house itself, with all the furniture, that didn't really impressed me, and it was quite expensive. Although I enjoyed, wouldn't add it in my priority list.
Outstanding to Viw. From the exterior, this is a unique residence. Elegant and charming…don't miss it. We did not have to time to tour interior…next time.

Not to be missed!. One of the famous Gaudi designed buildings in Barcelona that you cannot miss. You haven't seen Barclona completely if you miss Gaudi sites. This one, Batllo, Park Guell, and of course Sagrada Familia are absolute must sees. You must pay and go inside as well to fully appreciate. Even the roof is fascinating!

Interesting details and historical view. I enjoyed visiting La Pedrera. It was interesting to see both the unique design of the building and the roof as well as learn about Guadi's inspiration and how he worked. You first visit the main courtyard and see the wavy exterior lines, the beautiful gate and painted vestibule, then you go to the roof to experience the surreal landscape created by Gaudi, who thought that the roof should be beautiful as well as functional, then down to the attic to learn some history of both the location and the architect, and finally you wrap up with a tour of an apartment as it would have looked at the time Gaudi built it. The audio-guide provides a good amount of interesting information without dragging on. All in all recommended and interesting. I only docked a star because the entrance price is kind of steep for the length of the visit.

Gaudi at his best but very pricey. Pedrera is one of the finest Gaudi's work piece in my point of view. This is a wonderful architecture masterpiece and this is worth the visit. Unfortunately the price is now pretty high (saw it 15 years ago and today)... think that asking 10,25 euros for kids under 12 is pretty excessive. That means that for a family of 4 the price tag is now 61,50 euros...but if you are a fan of Gaudi...this is a must see.

Rooftop concert amazing!. We attended a rooftop jazz concert on the Saturday evening of our week in the city. We didn't really know what to expect but it was really magical. The roof is laid out like a series of small patios all with steps and at different levels. Everyone just sat on the steps and enjoyed the music as the sun set. Really romantic and well worth checking to see if there's one on when you're there. The whole rooftop was illuminated and looked stunning. There are amazing views of the city from up there and you even get a class of bubbly thrown in. Tips: get in first and find a good spot with a view of the stage. Treat your self to extra glasses of bubbly from the guys serving the complimentary ones on the way in.
Interesting. You have to admire the design of this building, but personally I would not say it is attractive to look at. Good view from the rooftop.

Too expensive and over rated. I am a big admirer of Gaudi and had high expectations when we booked to go. His work seems to me to show a love of life through the use of colour, shape and form via the use of the building materials - you only have to visit Sagrada Familia, Casa Batiklo or Parc Guell. All of which are great fun and a joy to visitLa Pedrera is not really in the same league as the others in my opinion which of course is a personal perspective. This is one of the most expensive places we visited while in Barcelona. It was also extremely crowded. The visit is highly organised - first the roof, which is interesting but hardly his best, then down through an exhibition of his other great works held in the 270 curved brick arches of the attic. You then proceed to an reconstructed period apartment where there is not a single straight line in sight. You have to exit through a gift shop which is unexciting. Don't get me wrong Gaudi was a genius and this is an interesting building but not his best and not worth the high entrance fee.

Another Amazing Gaudi Creation. I bought my ticket online and did not have to wait in a long lineI loved exploring La Pedrera. It was my forst Gaudi experience and I was blown away. It nice to go at my own pace and walk through all the many rooms.
Amazing!. We visited La Pedrera for a nighttime tour. Topped off by a beautiful light show on the roof. THis is a stunning example of Gaudi's work. A must see while in Barcelona.

Stepping back in time. Arriving early and booking tickets online makes visiting during peak tourist season easier.As well as being a great example of Gaudi's work, we particularly enjoyed exploring the furnished rooms. This really brought the place to life and gave a sense of the period when it was built and the art nouveau style.

Amazing at Night. Another Gaudi masterpiece and a must see when you are in Barcelona. The views from the rooftop are amazing. Go at night for the amazing light show. It is within 2 blocks of Casa Batllo, so it is convenient to see them together.

So strange. The journey up to the rooftop was by lift and you are greeted by chimney tops that look like something out of Star Wars, Gaudi was certainly a trailblazer. I don't like heights much so I tended to stick to the walls all around the outside and couldn't face looking down into the courtyard below even though I could see it was very well designed and people live here still. At night the rooftop takes on a different persona so the day/night ticket although not cheap is well worth it. Not too happy about having to leave the building via the gift shop when there was a perfectly acceptable exit beside it.

Third time a charm!. We went to Barcelona twice before this trip and both times, La Pedrera was either under construction or something and it was closed. This time, we went up early when it opened up at around 10am and spent about 30-40 minutes there and, it was very nice to see over the city in such an

Expensive . We wanted to look at the building but the queue was long and there was only one person helping everyone. We were eventually told it was the premium entrance and it would cost about 27€. Very expensive. Wish we had known that in the beginning.

Wow!! Unique building fascinating insight into how Gaudi's buildings were used. Probably our highlight of our trip to Barcelona. We hadn't booked but wanted to visit and headed there first thing in the morning. There was no queue so we started our audio tour immediately. There are essentially 4 segments to the visit. The courtyard, the roof, the attic/exhibition area and the apartment. We spent an easy 2 hours on the tour and enjoyed every aspect of it - even the roof - even though I suffer vertigo and probably wouldn't have gone if I'd realised the lift was going to transport us directly to the roof!! Once there there wasn't much I could except not look down! A real insight into Gaudi's work - the design principles and the impact his design had on the people who lived there - stunning!!

It's Barcelona.... Where else will you see Antoni Gaudi master works?. I decided to do only one of the Gaudi monuments beside the Sagrada Familia and I am so glad I chose La Pedrera. It has been beautifully restored and starting on the roof you work your way down through the attic and then the apartment which gives you a wonderful insight into how the growing middle class lived in the early part of last century. Along the way you learn about how the architect approached his work and found inspiration for many features in nature. A fascinating visit!!

The Rooftop Is Amazing. We went at the height of summer tourist season but didn't need to queue. The entry price includes a guided audio tour of this Gaudi building (be warned it's quite long!). Originally built as a residence now it doubles as a tourist attraction and apartments. The view from the roof is magnificent as is the rooftop itself- you'll see when you get there!

Summer Nights. We visited this Guadi-designed residence by night. The highlight of the evening is an interesting light show projected onto the rooftop towers followed by cava and dessert. On summer weekends, live music is offered as well.

Very good -roof the highlight. . If you go early you won't need to queue for tickets alternatively buy online first. Entry included audio guide. We found out too late there are some jazz concerts on rooftop happening over next few weeks on weekends which would be great evening - was sold out when we tried to buy. If you on budget and want to see only one example of gaudi I'd go to palace Guell.

Not what I thought. Looking at these photos, when we made it to the building I thought the map was wrong, HA. These faces are on the very top, set back, barely noticeable. Once you are there and can see the beauty in the building, worth the trip if you are close to it.
Beautiful . Is very beautiful view when you are at the roof . Very fascinating chimney structure . Worth paying to visit inside and the roof top is included .
Jeemie tulloch. Unique building, paid 27euro's to go in by quick route you could pay 20 to go slower route but we got in immediately by paying more, roof and attic the best part or visit.

Very interesting . I have always wanted to go into La Pedrera and I was not disappointed. It's incredible, the history, the apartments and most of all his talent. It's a great way to spend a few hours.

Another fabulous Gaudi experience. Visited late afternoon today. Short queues compared to Casa Batllo earlier in afternoon. Particularly enjoyed the apartment and the information provided in attic display about Gaudi designs elsewhere in area. The rooftop is otherworldly!

Beautiful Gaudi house, but tickets too expensive. Enjoyed my visit of Casa Mila or La Pedrera, but dissapointed by the high cost of tickets... I paid 20 Euros and my visit wasn't really worth that much...

A fun visit, but overpriced, hot and crowded. After visiting Park Guell but not being able to get tickets, we decided to pay the steep admission price to explore inside here. The eccentric rooftop with great views is the highlight and the indoors apartment and exhibits were both entertaining enough. But in early July, the temperatures were fierce and there were very few places to sit, so visitors should be aware that it may not be a great choice for everyone. The audio tour provided a good overview of Gaudi, but I got lost and gave up on it after some ill-fitting musical interludes and lack of signage.

Worth experiencing. La Pedrera would introduce you to architectural style that is inspired by natural shapes such as, waves, spine of a snake, leaves, etc. My best discovery is that back in the early 1900s, the late Antoni Gaudi had already designed beautiful wooden ergonomic chairs!

Interesting but probably not worth the price for admission. I can't understand why the admission prices to tour these Gaudi-designed homes are so high. While I enjoyed the tour, I did not feel like the price justified the tour of the place. This particular complex did have very interesting architecture to view, and the attraction does a good job to provide the proper historical perspective. There are many must see sights to see in Barcelona, but this is not one of them. Consider this a "day 2" or even "day 3" attraction in terms of how to priotize seeing La Pedrera over other and better attractions for the price.

A head of its time. . An amazing building. I would recommend buying tickets online to avoid the hugs queues. You get to go into the courtyard and look up at the huge building. Then you catch a lift to the roof to see the amazing sculptures. Then you go down one level to see an exhibition. The the level after that you get to see what the apartments used to look like all the time listening to an audio guide. I really enjoyed looking around this building.

Gaudi was really ahead his period!. Amazing building, history for Gaudi. Easy to enter but i bought the tickets two days before. The roof of the house is the most amazing of all. You can see the view of barcelona and take perfect photos. There is also a souvenir shop at the end before you leave the building!!!
Very worthwhile. I spent a couple of hours here. The ticket allows you to visit the roof, attic and apartments. The static displays are excellent and the audio tour top quality. Well worth a visit.

Stunning Building. La Pedrera is one of Gaudi's most famous buildings and is a must see while in Barcelona. The curving walls, interesting architecture and mosaic decor are fascinating. We avoided a long wait by having skip-the-line tickets.
Great to walk by. Garcia is a great street to walk down for just about anything. There are two fantastic Gaudi building to see and and walkthrough.
Fascinating. Really cool place, quite cheap to get into and you get so much for your moneys worth. The apartment thats been decorated in the style of when it was built is absolutely great.
Amazing Architecture. We found this place walking around. It was well worth our visit. We loved the information provided and the view both inside and out were spectacular.
Excellent. Easy to get to, an amazing building and really good museum to go with it. Less packed than some of Gaudi's other projects in Barcelona but just as interesting.

Great introduction to Gaudi!. I must have been asleep when we learned about Gaudi in school, because so much of the information in this audio tour was new!My favorite two things beyond the architecture itself: 1) the display of chains that depicted that modeled the arches upside down; and 2) the video next to the door handles that showed how ergonomically they were designed (it's a long video, so wait through the other parts to see). Buy your tickets online to save a few euro and, more importantly, avoid the lines at the door.

Night of La Pedrera- Light Show. We were back and forth whether or not to pay the 38 or so Euros each for this... But happened to be walking by as an English tour was about to start, so we decided to give it a go. We are so glad we did. The guide was informative and interesting. You can tell she is a big fan of Gaudi's work, which is a plus, (not your bored tour guide just reciting their lines). We had a long day of walking around in the heat, so getting to the top and just sitting down and watching La Pedrera's mosaics and curves, and lines redesigned with lights was awesome. I have been to La Pedrera before in the day time, doing the full indoor tour. I recommend that, but if you don't have time, you can still get to see some of the inside, learn about Gaudi, and see what they can do with his sculptures atop the building. Being that we were able to partake in this activity at about 9:30 or 10, it was great, because most other attractions are not open at that time.
Very cool a must see!. The skip the line tickets are worth it. We just went right in. La Pedrera is so unique and very cool.
Amazing. Amazing house, didn't think we would like it but thought should visit anyway - though actually loved it. Book on line to jump the queue!

Unforgettable experience. I recommend visiting Casa Milá as a first Gaudí visit (before Sagrada Familia) as the guided tour with audio gives an excellent introduction to the artist's process and techniques.
This isn't any scene from star wars. This is just the unique Gaudis house build to one of the rich Barcelona families in the 1800 something. Absolutely beautiful

Another Gaudí trashee. This is a great example of the famed architect's amazing work. Bring your camera and make your way to the roof for an amazing view of Barcelona while trying not to fall over while winding through the arches and steps and colliding with other tourists.
Very nice. A little thing to take pictures off not worth much more than a passing photograph to be honest with you
attitude architecture. We did not go into this building, but just stood outside and marveled at the style and architecture. Our terrific guide, Jordi, told us all about it's history and construction.

Another Gaudi Masterpiece. We're a bit obsessed with Gaudi & Barcelona and whilst we didn't consider this to be as good as Casa Battlo it was still an amazing feat of his ingenuity on show. It's a must visit to gain a greater understanding of just how ahead of his time Gaudi was.

"A Rooftop Wonderland". A grand entrance to the light well of this apartment building. Then take a trip to one of the apartments and from there to the rooftop which is like a park. Wave like slopes, steps and chimneys all practical but magnificently sculptural.
Beautiful!. Beautiful example of the wonderful Gaudi! Enjoyed touring the rooms with furniture from the time period.

Gaudi is ......... like nothing else. Crazy. I love to wander and just look at the architecture of a city but I've never seen anything quite like the works of Gaudi. Particularly loved the display in the roof showing where his inspirations came from. Crazy, amazing, inspired.
Beautiful place. Abuilding project by Gaudi, its amazing his creative, but the best part of the visit is the famous roof!
Great Gaudi Experience. Outside that I like this building the most of all Gaudi buildings, the tour also provides you with great background of Gaudi and his philosophies.

Fascinating example of Gaudi's work. I had been to La Pedrera a few years ago but wanted to take my teenage sons when we visited Barcelona 2 weeks ago as I thought they'd like it better than the Sagrada Familia. They liked it a lot and we spend a couple of hours looking around particularly enjoying the roof and the apartment. Cost £40 for us all with no time slot restriction by booking ahead.
Wow. What an amazing place, the view from the roof is wonderful. It's quite expensive but gives you a real taste of Gaudi's quirky architecture up close.
Very nice, visit at night. I took a night tour and was extremely pleased with my purchase. This place was wonderfully designed and built.

At least.. Enjoy the Cafe!. One of Gaudi's masterpieces, on the roof top are great shapes which inspired George Lucas to make the star wars soldiers characters.. In summer they make nice night events there.. Book in advance, unfortunately I failed to find a ticket to attend one in my visit..You think it is expensive to visit all Gaudi's houses? Or you have no time? Go to the cafe of the house, it is accessible for free, you can have a feeling of the location and see part of Gaudi's design.. You can have good coffee with croissant for 2.90 euros.. I loved it as a breakfast experience!

Another wow. Gaudi was a busy lad, with another stunning building, curves and arches coming from every corner (if there are corners, that is). Incredible that he did all this without computers but with a team of Master craftsmen.

Waste of TIme and Money. My wife and I spent nearly $50 to visit this overrated tourist sight, and I only wish I could get my time and money back! The only good thing about the experience was that there was a very short line to get in, so at least we didn't spend a bunch of time waiting to buy tickets. The self-guided tour starts in the atrium which is nothing special, then you wait in line to take the elevator up to the roof. There are some pretty cool looking sculptures on the roof, and this is pretty much the highlight of the tour, but the building is in the middle of the city and there is no real view from the roof. Then you walk down to the attic which is filled with mini-models of various Gaudy buildings and is an absolute waste of time. Then you walk down to the apartment level which is set up the way someone may have lived here decades ago -- very unimpressive. Then your tour ends in the gift shop. DONE! I would NOT recommend spending your valuable vacation time and money in this very disappointing tourist trap. There is, however, a great Torrons Vicens candy shop outside of the building which is fantastic! Look at La Pedrera from the street, take some pictures, then spend your entry fee at Torrons Vicens. YUM!!!

Interesting but .... I was interested in seeing Gaudi's creations but I should have stopped at Casa Batllo. This was an interesting site. But not too interesting enough to be worth the entrance fees. It was an ok experience. It was good that audio guides were provided. But as I had visited this spot after I have seen other Gaudi architectures, there was nothing in it that I have not already seen.

Gorgeous design and special roof terrace. It's not hard to find this attractive building, and it's not far away for the Sagrada Familia, 15-20 mins by walk. The price(about 25€ for adult) is much more higher compared to many views in France, but it was an audio tour, introducing one by one, the roof terrace is gorgeous and it is very Gaudi.
Drive By. We stopped shortly on the Hop on Hpo Off Stop. Definitely work going to see the outside. We did not go inside.

Whimsical chimneys are a signature. Another of Gaudi's buildings in Barcelona, it is interesting because it shows how his various systems of air flow, light and heat were built. It is has a fabulous roof for exploring.

A night time tour. Gaudi's work seen at night time is a whole different experience. It is more intimate, without the crowd of tourists. It is lit up so beautifully. The guides were very knowledgeable (Ana and Julia). We loved the rooftop, with storm trooper chimneys, and the view of Montjuic and Sagrada Familia. Oh, and it finishes with cava tasting.

Truly a "Quarry". If you're a student you can get the discounted rate. But it is worth it. I only did the day visit (there is a night visit as well that you can bundle), and the admission includes an audio tour. Words cannot describe Casa Mila, and therefore I shall leave you to experience it yourself. (I definitely recommend the audio tour though, it gives you a bit of an insight into Gaudi's mind)

Book Online or go Early or Late. This was one of Gaudi's designed apartment blocks. Like many of the other Gaudi buildings this gets very busy and the queues can get very length. Either book early or go early morning or early Evening (I recommend evening as the sun catches the roof architecture in an orange glow)The audio commentary is informative and is included in the entry price.

disappointed. decided to have a look at the place after seeing Palau Güell which was amazing . From the outside you think this is going to be an interesting look in how Gaudi designed this building but thats where it ends you go up to the attic and learn about other places he designed and then you see some props they suspect he got his inspiration from.followed by a light show that someone just made up so you dont feel quite so ripped off for the €34 you paid ( oh and a glass of cava) . only positives the attic does have some nice design aspects and when the lights arent going so does the roof.
fascinating. i'm a huge fan of gaudi's work so couldn't wait to explore this place. We paid a higher entry fee to skip the queues and it was worth it. Loved every second and took loads of pix.

Roof Top Jazz Concert. I had heard that concerts are performed in the summer and was amazed to find one on July 9th. The tickets were just 30 euros, slightly more than a daytime visit. I ordered the tickets online about a month before the concert. After being admitted at 8:15 for a 9 pm concert, we were shown the lobby and rode the elevator to the attic to wander the through the displays before climbing a set of circular stairs to the roof. What could be more romantic than listening to good jazz with a glass of cava in hand, watching the sun set while sitting on the steps amidst the amazing chimneys on the roof? It was an experience we will never forget!

Gaudi was/is inspiering. This building was the second one we went past, on our little Gaudi inspired trip, the first one was Casa Batlló, Casa Míla is even more special then Batlló, in the time it was build it must have been something really special, now it has a more commercial feel to it, but it is an interesting building to watch.

Buy your ticket onward and online. By my opinion best Gaudi's building. On this place it is worth to borrow headphones with guide. And dont forget take a photo of Sagrada Familia from the La Pedrera roof.
Very interesting. This house is a fine example of the work of Antonin Gaudi. Entrance is 21 euros per person. I think it was worth it. Go early to avoid the lines!
Impressive architecture. Very impressive work of Gaudi. The roof is truly breathtaking. Not to be missed. It may be better to book tickets online to skip the que and avoid disappointment.

Informative and Inspiring. To gain an appreciation of Gaudi's design genius La Pedrera is worth visiting. These apartment buildings are still in use and therefore you only view a few rooms on your visit. However you get to explore the roof spaces and roof top with its fantastic chimneys and views over Barcelona. Your visit is enhanced by the displays about Gaudi's design genius and short video clips explaining his life and his work. Make sure you book in advance online to avoid the queues.
SPAIN-2016. Awesome Place to Visit to see Up CLose Antoni Gaudi Masterpice. Lots of Stone Monuments to see up close.

Gaudi Masterpiece. This was Gaudi's masterpiece apartment building, It's distinctive on the Boulevard and shouldn't be missed. We went later in the day and the crowds had died down and it was actually pleasant to walk through without the massive crowds we experienced at Casa Batillo. However some rude tourists were still occupying the roof, more interested in taking selfies than viewing this architectural masterpiece. This is a large building and be warned this is still a building in use, so it has active offices and apartments in it.The roof is by far the most interesting feature with stunning Barcelona views and those crazy chimneys. It's iconic Barcelona!There is one apartment that was set up as in earlier days and is a bit dull and uninteresting. The details of the walls, windows and floors are the interesting part of this visit.One tip - take the elevator up and down - it's worth it! The stairs are killer!Don't miss this Gaudi masterpiece!

Casa Mila (La Pedrera) is not just a building, but a work of true modernistic art.. I visited Barcelona, Spain on Business and I was determined to see Antonio Gaudi’s works in the city, so I stayed over another day to do just that.This review is for Casa Mila, also known as La Pedrera, located at: Calle Paseo de Gracia, 92, 08008 Barcelona, Spain. My hotel was just a kilometer or so from this very special building.La Pedrera was commissioned to be built and it took about 6 years from 1906 to 1912 to be completed. This very special building is almost two different building since there are two separate courtyards that the building surrounds. Each courtyard has a very unique shape. The result of this concept was to make the building shaped like an asymmetrical number "8" with these two open courtyards. I did get a chance to enter one courtyard during my visit.The most special parts of the building are the ornate wrought iron balconies and the roof. The wrought iron balconies are twisting, convoluted shapes and sizes of iron. It appeared to me that every single balcony was uniquely different. On the roof of this nine story/level building, there are many skylights and very modernistic shapes of chimneys, almost like a sculptured work of art. I did climb the stairs to the top to see the features on his roof.Antonio Gaudi loved to design with a passion using curves, rounded corners and asymmetry, very unlike most architects that used squares, rectangles, triangles and other similar shapes in their designs. Casa Mila lives up to his passion when he produced this work of art.

amazing. It's another building designed by Gaudi. We visited on a Saturday. There wasn't a line at the entrance. The entrance fee included an audio guide. But the building was not well marked for the points of interest.
Interesting. Must see if you have the time. It costs 20.50 € adults, 16.50 € students and disabled. Expensive but worth it.

Fantastic architecture. Extremely colourful building from the outside.Did not have time to go inside, but will put it on my to do list for next time.Place was easy to get to in central Barcelona.On walk from Las Ramblas to Basilica of the Sagrada Familia, so easy to get to.Even the kids were very impressed!
Artsy house. Another Gaudi designed house, remarkable for its conception and execution in its day and to the present.

Worth a visit--before you visit La Sagrada Familia. Not only is the building itself, and especially the roof, worth the visit, as many others have said, but the museum explaining Gaudí's genius as well as the apartment decorated in the style of the times make this site well worth the entrance fee. I especially enjoyed the museum, which has models of the Pedrera that explain the unique construction techniques. There are also models that explain the construction of the arches of La Sagrada Familia, and as a result I felt I understood that building much better when I went there. Fascinating. Make reservations online, even a short time in advance, to avoid the line at the entrance.

Beautiful home. What a beautiful home this is and to be able to see it replicated like it was when it was built was awesome! Highly highly recommend. Very interesting and very different than his other work at Sagrada Familia.

Definitely worth the visit. Have visited three times and always enjoy. The rooftop experince is what it makes it worth. the exhibition below and the appartment are interesting but not really worth the visit. The queue was each time acceptable, due to the efficiency of staff and the willingness of many visitors to wal the stairs to the rooftop.

Holiday visit.. This attraction is perfect for a complete overview of Gaudi's life and work. Superb exhibition of his design techniques and products. Very good rooftop tour and the rooms are full of his designs and period furniture.

House Tour. This was the second house we visited designed by Gaudi! We loved it and it is a must see, but if you can only visit one, Casa Batlo was my favorite. You take an elevator to the top and tour your way done. Beautiful house that is decorated with the furniture of the past!

Not as impressive as the other Gaudi buildings . Saw La Pedrera during the day. The roof space was fun to explore with the different tower shapes, however compared to the other Gaudi buildings in Barcelona, felt it was not as impressive. Recommend seeing his other works before moving onto this. The place is central and easy to get to.

Great . This building is fascinating. It has a brilliant audio guide that really brings it to life. I would recommend a trip around the building to anyone regardless of how intense your itinerary is in Barcelona.

Night Time Tour recommended. We saw La Pedrera at night where they had a night time show on the balcony was was excellent. Never saw anything like this before. In the summer there is a jazz band on the balcony so check when it is available.

Amazing Roof type. the style and uniqueness of this construction built in the last century makes it a real masterpiece. The roof is something extraordinary and should inspire all the modern constructions. The roof is a museum
Architectural Masterpiece. Buy your tickets online ahead of time. We walked right in. Amazing - especially the apartments. You. Take an elevator right to the top and work your way down.
Unexpectedly wonderful. Spent a lovely couple og hours here, Incredible how well designed and enjoyable this space is - well worth a visit

Very intresting place to discover. Popular architecture and worth to visit. Each stage you discover different points. Terrace is very exciting with unusual concept. Ticket queue takes 1 hrs if you dont buy via website.

A wonderful trip to see how Gaudi came up with his ideas and functional designs. The Casa Mila is a great example of Gaudis work and tells you allot about how he came up with his nature inspired designs. The rooftop is great on a sunny day and you can make nice pictures with the Sagrada Familia as well.The audioguide is a bit confusing at first as it is hard to find out which numbers to press in the beginning. But once you are in the attic (the level below the rooftop) and work your way down it gets more self-explaining.If you try to save money and only want to see either Case Battlo or Case Mila:* Battlo is more crowded but also more colorful with better audioguide* Mila is less crowded, shows less colors but more architectural masterpieces and a large rooftop with a great view to the sagrada familia and Tibidabo

worth a visit but over priced. I think that this is worth a visit, but slightly overpriced. They offer you a photograph but when you pay 20 Euro's entrance i think the 10 Euro for 1 photo is expensive (Even if you can get a free download) the photo is take of you with a blank background then you are superimposed onto the backdrop of the building.

TOO EXPENSIVE. we loved our guide, David. But honestly for foreigners I find it very expensive...we only got to see the ground floor and the terrace. And there were groups every 20 min and it felt like we were rushing down after the light show. Also the glass of Champagne should be up in the terrace so you can chill a bit and contemplate the views...
Was OK but didn't rate it highly. Was good to see inside and the attic was good, roof ok too but didn't think it was worth the entrance fee. A bit overrated in my view.
Worth the visit and the entry fee. Loved this visit. It provides a great taste of what Gaudi's architectural talents. Allow around 2 hours for this visit..
Night light show recommended. Visit to see it at night, so you see the colorful light show with the music, it is totally worth it.

Modernist Gaudi. The day ticket includes an audio guide, and access to the museum, rooftop, and the Pedrera Apartment (an representation of a typical home of a Barcelona bourgeois family in the early 20th century). Some of the spaces in the building are used as offices now, some are still apartments. A great way to see and understand Gaudi's work.

Nature turned into a building. Another famous modernisme building on Passeig de Gràcia, la Pedrera (the Quarry) is yet another one of Gaudi's famous creations. It is, however, quite different from Casa Battló which is only a few blocks down the street, both from its facade and its interior. La Pedrera is like a giant sculpture, a poem turned into stone, a poem made from stone itself, an emsemble of organic forms, a petrified wave. La Pedrera is also known as Casa Milà, named after industrialist Pere Milà, who commissioned the building as his family home. It became a UNESCO world heritage site in 1984. The visit will take you to the courtyards and staircases and up to the roof terrace with its many chimneys and ventilations shafts, all designed in various organic and original forms. The roof terrace offers great vistas of Passeig de Gràcia and Barcelona. On the 4th floor you can visit an apartment recreating the home and lifestyle of a bourgeois family in the early 20th century, together with furniture and household items of the period. I can also recommend the museum shop (separate entrance on Passeig de Gracia), they have excellent books on Gaudi`s work in all the major languages.

Overpriced.. Look the man is a genius, so I can't give this spot anything less than four stars. The rooftop is cool (as the pics suggest) the inside was interesting - but in retrospect I don't think it was worth the $50+ bucks. If I could do it again, I'd maybe visit another one of his sites instead, due to time and price we just picked one and both walked away thinking maybe we should have picked another one.

Gaudi.. Very interesting museum featuring Gaudi designs. Gets extremely crowded not recommend on a hot day as there is no air conditioning.Should cost 18 euro with a discount vouchers which are obtained everywhere in Barcelona..

£18? For the terrace view :/. Enjoyed this visit, but thinking back now, the building is very pricey to enter with only the most exciting part is the terrace. At the top, you get to see the exciting roof top sculptures and designs. You get a nice view of Barcelona too. Then you go down the floors by stairs. A floor is has a different exhibition, from information about gaudi's life and work and theories, then just beautiful rooms and hallways, but rushed by people.

If You Only Pay For One Its This One. Our group of four wandered up to the Casa Milla to view from outside. While we were not in agreement that we actually liked it's architectural statement we all wanted to see inside and on the roof top. Long queues were off putting so we paid the extra 7 euro and took the premium access option. It is amazing and the audio tour is high quality and really informative. Take the time to wander the roof top, explore the attic displays and wander the different rooms. Inspiring - it left us in awe of the creativity of the Gaudi master. So glad we did this before our Sagrada Familia tour - we all agreed La Pedrera was much more authentic and purely Gaudi. Don't miss going inside.

Gorgeous!!. I love Gaudi's work because of La Pedrera! This isn't typically "my thing," but thankfully my sister knows her stuff and insisted we were going! I'm glad she did! Just seeing it is incredible, but the museum and detailed history highlighted there is fascinating! I highly recommend experiencing this gorgeous attraction!

An archiectural dream. We loved visiting this building as it highlighted Gaudi's technique and ability for both interior and exterior. We explored the roof and had great views over Barcelona. Really enjoyed!

Amazing outside!. This was the strangest building Ive ever seen but I loved it. I will always remeber it and the photos I took don´t do justice! I recommend only seeing the outside, the inside was a bit long and slightly boring, but the outside was amazing!

An Experience...... When visiting La Pedrera do so at night. The show starts at the bottom of the building with a very informative guide and finishes on the roof top with a fantastic dramatic light display. It is followed by a glass of cava and some tasty nibbles. A great way to see a magnificent building.

A Wonderful Place to Visit and Tour. This is an apartment complex that Gaudi designed. It is remarkable in its architecture, plan, and artistic design. Gaudi even took time to intricately design the roof and the chimneys. I thought the roof and the chimneys were wonderful. The tour excluded an audio tour which was very informative and detailed.

Another Gaudi masterwork. Although not as crowded as Casa Batllo down the street, Casa Mila, is another Gaudi creation, his attempt at an apartment complex.As with other Gaudi buildings, you can see his signature architectural genius. You can admire the views from the roof and see his signature chimneys.La Pedrera is also occupied. Here, they have set aside a fully furnished turn of the century apartment for you to visit as well.Another must see Gaudi in Barcelona

incredible building. Only saw this from the outside as queue and price put me off going into it, I am told though that it is stunning and if the front is anything to go by it will be on my list for the next time I am in Barcelona

A must see. My youngest daughter said this was not to be missed and the shape of the building and its design is out of this world. Gaudi sure knew how to be different, even down to individual door handles in brass that fitted the human hand.
Great Intro to Gaudi. Free audio tour guide provided on entry which is full of information about La Pedrera and Gaudi's other work. Very impressive building and well worth visiting!

A MOST SEE site in Barcelona!. IMPORTANT: Visit the website for your desired sightseeing options. MAKE RESERVATIONS on line BEFORE arriving at Le Pedrera!! The LA PEDRERA BY DAY PREMIUM Ticket (6.50€ more) allows you to come any date and time you want up to 6 months from the purchase date. This is a very popular site; allocated slots fill up fast!! Casa Milà, popularly known as ‘La Pedrera’ (the stone quarry) is an AMAZING experience!! DO NOT MISS THIS! The free audio guide, included in the ticket price of La Pedrera, is a nice touch and very worthwhile. Do not leave Barcelona without seeing La Pedrera!!

Jazz on the rooftop!. Amazing way to see the sunset listening to jazz music with the mountain backdrop.And of course, amont many lovely Gaudi's chimneys!!!Cannot explain more, just have to see it yourself :)

Worth a visit. If you are a person who is very much into exploring the culture and architecture of Barcelona then La Pedrera is a building you do not want to miss out on. My friend wanted to come to this apartment block, I wasn't really too bothered about it - that's until we got there! I absolutely loved it. The design and layout of the building is fascinating. You have to walk around 8 flights of stairs to get where you need to be but its worth it once you get there, there is also a lift if you need to use this instead. There is a display in the attic of the building showing all of Gaudi's designs and how he built them. And then you go up to the roof which is absolutely beautiful. The walls stopping you falling over the edge aren't very high though and there is no safety railings so be careful and look where you are going, I personally wouldn't recommend bringing small children up. And then from this you go back downstairs to an apartment set out the way it would have been designed in the era it was made for. It is really interesting to go and look and definitely worth a visit. We went during the Easter Holidays later on in the afternoon and we only qued for around 10 minutes to go in, do not know what this would be like at other times though. You can also choose to visit here when it has gone dark and they turn all the lights on the roof which reflect off all the mosaics.

Wonderful Architecture. Gaudi was obviously ahead of his time, probably a whole century ahead. If you are fascinated by Gaudi's inspiring work, the must-sees in Barcelona will include this apartment building, Don't forget to stand on the street corner and admire the exterior of the building. It is as ingenious as the rooftop sculptures. Visit this place in late afternoon could avoid a line.

My favorite Gaudi designed abode.. You will love it! From the main entrance gate to the rooftop this is Gaudi's most innovative and pleasing design of an apartment building. Buy your ticket on-line to avoid the ticket line outside the building. You will tour the entrance foyer, the roof with its decorative features, the attic with its array of catenary arches, and one of the apartments. Absolutely fascinating and beautiful. I wish I could have stayed longer. In the summer evenings there are jazz concerts on the roofs with included.

Rather expensive but memorable tour of one of Gaudi's architectural designs. The entrance fee is quite expensive, but this fee does includes an audio guide and a tour of La Pedrera is quite an experience! The tour of the building is arranged in a way that you work your way back down from the courtyard decorated with the very special roof architecture to the gift shop that you can visit without buying tickets for the tour. When you climb the building's stairs to go see the temporary museum, don't forget to look up at the lovely colours and paintings decorating the ceiling. For me La Pedrera seems to embody many moods and styles and as you walk through the museum no doubt you'll understand what I mean. There is nothing quite like La Pedrera in the rest of the world (with each of Gaudi's designs but simultaneously recognisable but individually iconic) so if you're in Barcelona, make a trip to La Pedrera as part of your plans.

Beautiful. Brilliant place, loved it! We bought tickets online and showed the download on my phone at the entrance, which enabled us to skip the line, very handy. Audioguides provided, which enrich the experience with interesting facts about the building, Gaudi and the 'Milla' family who commissioned it. A must see for any Gaudi fan.
Amazing. If you love the work of gaudi this is a must see, and if u don't it is still a must see. So ingenious, attention to all details . Well worth it
Okay. Great from the outside and views from the roof otherwise not particularly special. The history of the building and contract with Gaudi is more interesting than the actual tour.

Fascinating genius!. Fantastic architecture and interesting information about Gaudi's life and art. There is so much to see in this building including the rooftop sculptures, inside courtyard and an apartment decorated in period style.

MUST BE ON YOUR BUCKET LIST !. I have seen this work of art and it's just ... fantastic. You need to see it, hear the story and just imagine how was Gaudi able to create it. We visited on an evening that ended with jazz and champagne on the roof top.... yeah that was pretty awesome. Go, Explore and Enjoy !

Had to pay $27/per person to avoid long line. It wasn't worth it. Some interesting shapes and colors and tiles, but the outside of other Gaudi buildings are frankly more special. Being on the top really only meant jockeying for position for photos. The museum was the most interesting part.

Awesome casa mila by night. Recommend time is 1.5hr-2hrs.There is combo ticket for la pedrera day and night.Book for a time slot to avoid queuing.During night ticket its a guided tour and there will be video projections on walls of the building on the terrace.Its awesome.
One of Gaudi's finest works. A busy attraction - best to arrive early in the day. There is a museum which explains the engineering involved in the design. Brilliant in its complex simplicity!
Nice evening with good views. Gorgeous architecture! Amazing views! You can spend about 3-4 hours. The views from the top floor as well as the gallery one floor below are very interesting!

La Pederar. What a building. Before doing the tour spend some time looking at it from the street . Good to go late afternoon, less crowds, cooler .Plenty of time to wander around roof top and take fabulous photos.Tour also allows you to view a display apartment, frozen in time. You get to walk the full circular apartment. Loved the building. A masterpiece.
Masterpiece. We had an excellent time exploring Gaudi's masterpiece. The rooftop with its fantastic statues is an absolute treat in itself and also offers a beautiful view over the city.

Very hip apartment house.. Antoni does it again! Gaudi could keep watch over his ongoing work on the Sagrada Familia from the freaky roof deck here. More psychedelic architecture from the master. You get to walk through an entire furnished 1910 upper class person's apartment on this tour and it is fascinating. Get adv. tix online & skip the line. Don't miss the attic space where some of Gaudi's design tricks are revealed. There is currently an excellent photography exhibit on display in one of the lower floors.

Could be rated 5 stars but outshone by Casa Batllo & Sagrada Familia. I mused whether to visit this having already been to the other Gaudi attractions Casa Batllo and Sagrada Familia, which are both 5*. This could probably be rated as highly anywhere else but just wasn't as good as the other 2. It is still amazing; we went to an evening special effects / lighting story on the roof. Whilst I would go back to the other two, I am not sure I'd make a 2nd visit here - there are other Gaudi places I want to visit. But don't let me put you off, it is still fabulous
Modern . It is modern even by today's standards. Though we didn't go inside, looking at it from outside also enlightens one enough to appreciate the futuristic designing sense of Gaudi.
Beautiful. Gorgeous building and very forward thinking for the time it was built. If possible I would recommend visiting Casa Batllo and Palau Guell as well so to get a better idea of Gaudi's work.
Fantastical architecture. Tremendous audio tour with amazing exhibits giving a real insight in the thought process of Gaudi in his design.
Beautiful architecture. You get a fantastic view over the entire city, when you get to the top of the building. Nice just to walk around with headphones on while you get the history of the building.

Must see when in Barća. This located a couple of blocks from Gaudi's more famous Casa Batilo. This is an apartment building that is currently occupied with residents. There is one apartment that is open as a museum. The rooftop is out of this word & is futuristic in its appearance. I highly recommend this.
A different way to look at architecture. Practically everyone can work with straight lines...but creating such an exciting building with curves is fantastic! The house is a joy to behold.

No, he wasn't on drugs when he designed this!. This is one of the most remarkable buildings you will ever see. It is very hard to believe that it was designed 100 years ago. Colors, textures, use of space, and light as well as views from the room make this a must see in Barcelona. You will be better off if you buy your tickets in advance since the wait an be very long if you do not. Don't miss this place.

Nice but expensive. Gaudi made a lot of interesting buildings and for sure La Pedrera is one of them. If you like architecture it is a must. For me it was ok but comparing to its price it was not value for money. With a discount we paid around 35€ in total (2 persons)

Enjoyed this a must see in Barcelona . Went early to this site. There about a 5 minute lineup. There was free audio in English which helped enjoy the experience. The rooftop was amazing and the views were stunning. In the attic it showed the evolution of Gaudi's works and also of Barcelona. The next floor was a typical apartment back in the early 1900's. Very affluent. Recommended!

Not soo good as pictures. This was my first visit to Barcelona and as we had some waiting time for entry to Segrada Familia we decided to visit La Padrera. We went at the time of summer fiesta and whole Barcelona was buzzing with people and tourists, we had to be in the queue to get our tickets worth 20.5 EUR and then the lift took us to the rooftop. When I entered the rooftop "all my expectations were shattered" as it looked like an ordinary apartment Rooftop with a few architecture figures made out of which only 2 or 3 were good. Not at all impressing! Yes if you takes your camera shots at some angles it looks good otherwise its just ordinary.Then we come down by stairs where we can see the models of the structures made by Gaudi. If you are into arts and architecture you will like it, otherwise it will be okay, not so great!After this we went one floor down into the apartment of Gaudi where he lived and it was nothing but a rich man's personal living area and then the tour ends. Ofcourse there were similar things around but, they were all the same in way.All in all not up to the expectations. It was an okay place to go. A better place to perhaps if you really like arts and architecture.
Amazing example of Gaudi architecture. This was probably my favorite site in Barcelona. The roof was impressive and the views of the city were amazing. It was worth the rather expensive entrance fee.

Summer Nights at La Pedrera. We booked 2 tickets for 'Summer Nights at La Pedrera' which included a look around the attic followed by jazz music and a drink on the terrace. I'm a big fan of Gaudi's work but La Pedrera didn't excite me unfortunately. The music on the terrace was great and I really enjoyed the views of the city. It was quite a romantic way to spend the evening however I do think it is overpriced considering there wasn't much to see in the house.
Lovely house--but expensive. We did not go in--decided that the entry ticket was too high compared to alternatives--very cool block and area to visit--and also excellent places for food

Other Gaudi Buildings are more exciting. Compared to other Gaudi buildings we thought La Pedrera was a bit dull and colourless. If you can't afford to visit every Gaudi building we would put Palau Guell and Casa Battlo ahead of this one. Many people miss Palau Guell but it is amazing. It was one of Gaudi's formative works (high arches, colourful chimneys) that lead to his later work.

Was my first visit to Barcelona. Went to La pedrera, because was not able to enter to park Guell. not my cup of tea. you can visit one of the apartments and go to the rooftop were you can see some of Gaudi sculptures.
nice place in shopping street , good for a chill. nice place for drinks and snacks and every kind of food , I will come back next time, in - and outdoor , friendly staff

Magnificent. La Pedrera is impressive. The design inside and out is different that anything else you've seen. Gaudi was a genius that had the opportunity and the means to put in practice his modernist ideas. And the result is amazing. Barcelona should be proud and treasure its child for eternity. Visit during the day and also for the night show.
More Gaudi.. Fantastic building with amazing arquitecture, simply a masterpiece, worth visiting and if possible visit the inside.

Just see it from the outside. It is too expensive for what yo get to see, so just see from the outside and take somo pictures across the street. If you have to choose one of Gaudi's buildings, don't choose this one.

Breathtaking. This is superb. Expensive but well worth a visit. To think it was early 20th century too! Amazing architecture and decor that feels totally timeless. Definitely needs to be photographed and so many opportunities for the more artistic photographer. Recommend booking your tickets online. Surrounded by nice bars and restaurants. Lots to see on the way there too. A crown jewel of Barcelona.

A unique building well worth visiting. When you realise that this building is 100 years old it really shows how Gaudi was a genius and ahead of his time. If there is one other absolute must visit place after la Sagrada Familia, in my opinion this is it.

See it from inside. You must see it from inside, which will definitelly give you better picture of the atmosphere and architecture. I personally like this building from the inside better than Casa Batló, which is on another hand more interesting from the street.

The imagination that built this house !!. Visiting this house not only gives you an appreciation of Gaudi but helps one imagine the way of life at the time it was initiated. From the intricate design of the roof to the beautiful constructed rooms, it was a joy to visit this house.
Gaudi-licious!. See the genius of Antoni Gaudi's architecture and design up close, without the masses at Sagrada Familia. Well worth the entrance fee for sure.
Interesting but too much expensive. Barcelona owns a lot of culture and you sure want to see it, but come on, 20€ for this?!Please don't tell us at the end that we help your school or whatever
Plenty to see and learn about Gaudi. Excellent information available in the museum. Plenty to learn via the audio guides, films & exhibitions. The architecture is of course stunning.

Casa Mila also known as La Pedrera. There are a lot of 'firsts' in this building that make La Pedrera a must see for visitors to Barcelona. First indoor parking garage with a lift, first ensuite plumbing, first ecologically designed apartment block, and so on. The apartments in Casa Mila were intended to provide the owner with a reliable income, rented to other wealthy citizens of the period. Your visit to Casa Mila will take you into one of these stunning spaces where you can see how life must have been for the wealthy in that era. That is one experience you will get from your visit.You ascend immediately to the rooftop when you first enter La Pedrera. There you are immersed in Gaudi's creation of weird looking statues and uneven roof lines. Your free audio guide will keep you informed as to why and how all this comes about. Take your time. I took two hours for my tour and could easily have stayed longer, maybe in the restaurant contemplating what I had just seen.In the attic section of the tour you will learn about the how and why of Gaudi's creation. There are models and displays so sit down and pay attention if you want to get your money's worth.It is also worth paying extra for the skip-the-line option. This is a popular attraction and large groups are frequent.

Breathtaking experience of one of Gaudi's greatest accomplishments. Spent a few hours walking around this spectacular work of architecture. The roof alone is worth a visit, as there are so many small pieces of brilliance waiting to be discovered, such as the archways that perfectly frame the various other historic buildings in the nearby area. The internal building itself was relatively interesting, traversing through the various rooms listening to the ambiance music through the headphones. Overall a fantastic experience that I would recommend to anyone within the area, especially those with a love for art and architecture

Great insight into Gaudi's genius. We didn't plan to go into this place, just to walk past and see the exterior. But when we got there we were shocked to find there was NO LINE to get in (apparently unusual). So in we go and LOVED IT (even the kids loved it)! There is an excellent audio guide included in the price, and between that and the exhibits in the attic it really helps you understand how Gaudi came up with his ideas, so different from everyone else's. The tour itself was great. Such unique designs. Awesome. Glad we could check it out!

Must see if you are in Barcelona. One of the most interesting Gaudi houses in Barcelona, a truly interesting building with an even more fascinating roof terrace you can visit throughout the day but I would recommend early evening or sunset time. You can also see it in the evening time with colourful lights.

Wow!. If it can be drawn, it must be buildable!Antoni Gaudi realized in stone and masonry what the Beatles alluded to in song, and sculptors occasionally accomplish in 3D. Think Strawberry Fields and interior journeys recommended by Aldous Huxley and Timothy Leary.What's amazing is that so many patrons were willing to indulge Gaudi's fertile imagination, commissioning and building whimsically complicated, fluid works which are sui generis.La Pedrera is one such example, a work of art that is quite unlike any other, still occupied by some of the families which have lived in this apartment building for decades.Gaudi has single-handedly made Barcelona synonymous with creative architecture, a well-deserved reputation. Many cities have Belle Époque charm, but none besides Barcelona have Gaudi. Nobody does Gaudi like Gaudi.

It was more than just a building. La Pedrera was one of Gaudi's best creations; you can visit it before or after visiting the adjacent buildings along the Block of Discord of Barcelona.The exterior of La Pedrera itself was wonderful, with the audio guide, you could learn the concepts and architectural meaning of many details of the building.The rooftop was its signature, and visiting there was a present experience. I was not lucky enough to visit there during the "Summer Nights concerts at La Pederera" period, but, I believe Jazz lovers like me would definitely be overwhelmed by the amazing view there and the live music floating above it.

The roof is the best!. After visiting the Casa Batllo, the most attractive point is the roof of La Pedrera. When stepping on the roof, there are so many fascinating objects around you and put you in a magic world. What a genius designer!
Origins Night Show. Excellent tour and light show. It provided a general background of the building, surprisingly complex light show and cava and snacks to end the evening

Worth a look. This building is very unusual and worth a look inside. Honestly not an awful lot on show, but the roof is famous and worth the visit. There was a gallery on a lower floor that had an exhibition that was well worth a look.
Another Gaudi masterpiece. La Pedrera allows you another look into Gaudi's famous works and his marvelous mind. Don't miss out on this one..
Amazing every time.... Gaudi's sombre but amazing work of art, this mansion/residence is awesome. I particularly enjoy the roof terrace with hints of the sea.

exotic ibero-european architecture. except for the hour long waiting queue for the tickets, this is fantastic... the genius of antonio gaudi reflect the timeless shapes in all of his masterpieces. when in barcelona, whoever misses out la pedrera is doomed for eternal regrets... :-)

Overwhelming. Words cannot describe this extraordinary building – you must visit it. It looks fantastic from outside but you have to get in. Walk through the building with headset with guide – free – very informative.

Freaking awesome. Such an iconic place in Barcelona, it is not enough to see it from the outside, you have to get inside and see the great architecture, every detail of it is amazing. The rooftop is a dream, genius Gaudi. It is a must if you are in BCN, We loved it!

Summer Nights concerts at La Pederera. Check out their concert line up and see if you are lucky enough to have one take place while you are in Barcelona. Our tickets were $30 euros each and included entry to the museum, a jazz concert on the roof top among Gaudi's creations, a glass of cava (additional glasses may be purchased) and a wonderful view of Barcelona. The evening was spectacular and there were no crowds as the event takes place after normal museum hours and has limited tickets! Book in advance on line to get a spot. I can't recommend this highly enough!

The strangest apartment building you'll ever see!. The exterior view of this apartment building is wonderful. But you really need to go inside to see the best of it. You can see how an apartment would have been furnished in the early 20th century. The views from and of the roof are beautiful.

What's not to like. It's Antoni Gaudi. It's Casa Mila. It's a fabulous example of Modernism.
