Art all around you. If you like Gaudi as an artist or just have pleasure to see good architecture you must see La Pedrera.
Casa Milà or La Pedrera. It is an amazig building buid by Gaudí between 1906 and 1912. You normally visit 3 stories : Roof top, Attic and also one of the apartments with the furniture

Awesome at night. I must admit I've never been a fan of modern art and when I saw pictures of this I just thought it was odd , but since I was here I felt obligated. I'm so glad I did. Now I want attest to the day tours but the origins night tour was spectacular. If you keep an open mind you can really begin to appreciate the genius behind Gaudi's work. Of course you then have to go visit La Sagrada Familia. Another master piece.

A great way to see Gaudi creation. We stumbled on to the Pedrera building by chance and decided to do a tour - well worth the E20 per person. The self-guided tour gives access to the building and surreal roof-top terrace with all sorts of Gaudi creations and Barca as a back-drop. It is really worth the hour it will take, rain or shine.

Beautiful place. Great place, glad most of the building is being lived in or used for offices! Loved the roof and even though I have an extreme case of vertigo, I felt very safe up there :) attic was great, loved the videos and models. So much information everywhere and inspiration too!The audio system was a good addition too.

Yet another of Gaudii's masterpieces.. La Pedera is just as good as Casa Battilo. B sure to head for the roof top to check out the fascinating array of unusual chimneys and wonderful views.Make sure you book tickets in advance to skip the lengthy queues.Self guided tour with commentary is free. There are free lockers to leave bags etc.

Disappointed. I toured several other highly-rated buildings by Gaudi and others during my four days in Barcelona, and loved them all, but this one was a disappointment. The attic roof vaulting was neat, and I loved the exterior, but the roof terrace and the one floor you can explore weren't worth the price of admission.
Beautiful. If you like architecture a must see. 20 euro entrance fee. Kids will be bored. This house is special.

Another Gaudi "don't miss this!". The audio tour adds to the enjoyment of visiting this unique building. The apartment houses inside and the rooftop (as well as the rooftop views of the city) are attractions worth visiting.

Visit La Pedrera before La Sagrada Familia . The roof of La Pedrera is so enjoyable to visit. The audio guide will enhance your visit. Make sure you take in a visit here prior to seeing La Sagrada Familia, as you'll get some insight into Gaudi's design process.

Beautiful and unique. If you like Gaudi, you'll love this house. Everything is in its unique style. The roof is incredible with its statues and has a great view. The museum inside is very interesting and not to long. There was a temporary photo exhibition of Toni Catani which was also nice. At night, you can go on the roof for the light show, unofortunately that is more expensive (35 euros).
Gaudi's work. It is another nice Gaudi's masterpiece who is worth visiting. It is very nice and interesting house. Nice city views from roof.

My absolute favourite building in Barcelona. In my opinion, this is Gaudi's most interesting house. This architecture is unique and you can appreciate it from outside, but it's best to be across the street to be able to view the whole house. Plan the timings of your visit as it does get packed and entrance is limited.

A beautiful, wonderful, excellent house to visit. You already know that Gaudi is an excellent architect, but here I saw his 3D projects and so, I could understand his creation.It is very interesting, too, the bourgeois apartment, to say the way of living in that times.

A visual treat. The sound and light experience was quite impressive, but the real delight was being able to stroll around on the rooftop terrace of la Milà, following the roof shapes and the various sculptures and other features. It's a long climb up, but there is also a lift available. The English commentary was ok, but occasionally difficult to hear clearly. The cava and meringues at the end were a pleasant finish to the night. La Pedrera is easy to find, close to a Metro, a pleasant walk from Plaça Catalunya. A must-do for Gaudì enthusiasts.
Unique Architecture. This modernist building designed by Gaudi is worth visiting to anyone interested in architecture. It really stands out from the other buildings in the street.
What a house!. The facade is quite amazing and the roof even more. If you don't want to spend the money on a visit inside (and on the roof) at least take a look outside.

Another look at Apartment Living. If you thought that all apartments were basically of the same, La Pedera will give you a whole new vision, this tour is amazing as you learn about Gaudi, his background, his philosophy and his execution of his vision. His detail in the early 1900 hundreds reflects much of the detail that is highly regarded today. Although his style is not for everyone, a visit merits an appreciation for his accomplishments and the sustainability of his works- highly recommend La Pedrera!
A quick lunch-time visit. A lovely "Gaudi" atmospheric lunchtime visit to the café. Good service and very pleasant food and ambience

The best of Gaudi other than Sagrada Familia.. Incredible apartment building and incredible tour. This was worth every penny and more. The building itself can be viewed for 1/2 hour from the outside without boredom.Inside, the beauty and extravagance of the architecture continues unabated. From the undulations of the walls, the exquisite wood and tile work - this is something not to be a missed, especially by lovers of architecture. The tour of the building included the fabulous roof with it's famous chimneys, a great museum exhibit, a visit to the attic and a thorough apartment visit, furnished exactly as it would have been at the time it was build.We spent close to 3 hours here and it could easily have been more. An attraction in Barcelona not to be missed.

A nice Architectural design. It is very interesting architectural design by Spanish Architect Antoni Gaudi. its façade to an open quarry, was constructed between 1906 and 1912. It is worth of visiting if you travel to Barcelona.
excellant attraction. Very interesting architecture and audio guide very informative. Upper terrace was facinating and gave good views to all areas.can get very busy

Magical. Gaudi's La Pedrera, a magical place. You get to see the roof terrace ( a rather disorienting experience ), the attic and one of the apartments.
At around the 20 Euro mark for an adult ticket you may think that this is a little pricey, but imo it is well worth it. This place is unique and absolutely fascinating.

Amazing house. When you are interested in architecture, the inside and the roof are a must see! Very beautiful and worth the money.The roof is amazing. You have a spectacular view over Barcelona! The only thing that wasn't that funny was the amount of people. And we went in march, not a public holiday. So when you go in top season, I would keep that in mind ;-)
BMW M Tour. Very cool building designed by Gaudi. Amazing views of the city from the roof. The history behind this building is amazing. A must see if visiting Barcelona
Great Gaudi Building. This whole apartment building was fascinating, especially the roof with the "Star War" structures. After the Sagrada Familia, this is the next most fascinating Gaudi structure.

Stunning architecture. Yet another fantastic Gaudi creation which can be viewed on your way to the Church that is his masterpiece. The flowing lines of this corner house are wonderful to look at. We didn't venture inside due to lack of time, but the outside alone is well worth 30 minutes of your stay to see
Very nice. Interesting but not as great as Casa Batllo. The roof is wonderful, however. The chimney covers were the inspiration for the Star Wars Dorm troopers.

A wonderful Gaudi's world of "architecture for the people", deeply influenced by Nature. Great to know that the income generated by visitors help a Foundation to do a lot of work on social welfare, culture and environmental heritage protection, support for education, etc
Amazing Building/Museum. Me and my family had a great time today visiting this Gaudí building. Is a must if you visit Barcelona. The ticket prices are a little expensive (20 euros) but worth it.

Amazing Building....didn't enjoy the evening light show. We visited La Pedrera in the evening for the Light Show Experience. It included a glass of cava and sweets at the end. Although the tour was nice, the music and light show was not worth the extra money, 35Euro Adult and 17Euro for a child. I think I would visit during the day instead if I were to do it again. The building is amazing and the rooftop offers great views, you do not get to see any of the interior space.
Gaudi. Need I say more?. He's a genius; stop and see why! I've never been inside but here that's worth it too. Love looking at it and thinking about Gaudi's genius.

If you like unusual architecture, you'll like this!. I will confess that I didn't know much about Gaudi and Catalonian Modernist architecture before visiting Barcelona. A tour round 'La Pedrera' helped correct this. Do make sure that you use the audio guide, you learn so much about an architect who was way ahead of his time and cared desperately about his creations.Only down sides are that there a lots of steps up to the top of the house and it does get very busy. Might be an idea to go out of season?

Good for a selfie on the go. I am not doubting the architectural worth (I am not an expert). It is just that it is only a building that looks different, much more to see in Barcelona and especially on the same street
Exquisite. This building was extraordinary, and the staff was lovely. The exhibition inside was precious and the audioguide was really useful. Highly recommended

Wonderful Gaudi building. This building is worth visiting, but be aware that the audio guide is hard to follow, which I found annoying. The numbers for the guide were not easily visible at the appropriate locations. Loved in particular the roof and the attic. Don't expect the apartment to be inspiring, although it is nice.

Simply Gaudi. The best thing to see to understand Gaudi and his very modern view on how architecture and nature should unite. The museum tour is very informative. Even my son of 6 thought it was great.

Probably my favorite of the Gaudi buildings. An unforgettable building -- cross between Alice and Wonderland and the Flintstones. Lots of fun to visit. We were with an art historian/guide who made it even more interesting. Go!
If you are into art its worth the visit. Unless you are an artist lover I don't think its worth for you to pay 30 euros per person. You can still admire the architecture from the outside..

So modern..... La Pedrera gives you an idea of how forward-looking Gaudi was. In his architecture everything is studied: function, aesthetics, symbology. This is an example. Even the garage is a work of art. beautiful. If you have little time in Barcelona, I suggest going to the Sagrada Familia instead, but la Pedrera takes less time.
wonderful. do not miss this if you are a fan of exterior/interior design. it is just breathtaking. and the views from the terraced roof are amazing.

An Excellent Example of an Amazing Architect. If I had the money, this would be the building I would choose to live in. Gaudi was an architectural genius and this was one of the highlights of his career.The outside look is arresting and the quirkiness of the interior is astounding. And, from a tourist's veiwpoint, the views from the rooftop terrace are impressive. It is interesting to note that there are several tenants currently living in this outstanding piece of architecture. I would love to be one of them (apart from the hundreds of tourists invading the place daily - although they are kept well away from current residences). Recommended even if you are only mildly interested in architecture.
Interesting. Arrived early in the day, so no queues. Really beautiful and interesting building. Well worth a visit.
A very plesant visit. It is one of the must-see one should see in Barcelona. I was very impressed with the design of this house. Highly recommended
Stunning architecture . This has to be my favourite building in the world! A visit to the rooftop is like taking a step into a scene from Alice and Wonderland! I highly recommend a visit!

Very cool Gaudi original construction. This place was an original construction, not a remodel, and was built to be modified for the owners needs/interests. The tour takes you throughout the building and up to the roof. Right up there with Casa Ballot, a must see in Barcelona.
A "must" for Gaudi fans. This incredible building, considered a failure in its day, is a "must do" if you like Gaudi designs.

Interesting and delightful.. Amazing views from the rooftops would recommend booking this as it very popular. Well managed attraction, only allowing so many people up in the lifts so it isn't too crowded up there.

Impressive out side - disappointing inside.. It is amazing how the days culture affects the architecture and life in general. The out side of La Pedrera is amazingly impressive and astonishing. Just as much, the inside is disappointingly simple and plain. I guess the idea was to impress the people who saw it from out side. Not worth the 20 Euro PP to see the inside. Save the E20 for a good bottle of wine and watch it from outside.
An amazing building. Came here a couple of days ago. What I was more fascinated with was how it looked from the outside which was amazing. The way it curves in and out was second to none
Gaudi design. Again a must to visit if you're in Barcelona.the views from the roof are spectacular and worth the admission price just to see.
Its worth to visit with a guide, amazing building and the roof its just beautiful. We had a guided visit of this house. Very educational and interesting, you can just see how amazing Gaudí was.

An very interesting building - a must!. It is amazing to think this building is actually an apartment block built round 2 or 3 courtyards, many of the apartments are currently homes, although some are offices. There is a 'show' apartment, which you can wander through and is furnish just as it was when it was built, in fact it is quite large with many rooms.The outside of the building is very ornate and this continues inside but the most interesting 'chimneys' and other structures are to be found on the roof terrace. They are amazing. The terrace is not flat but has several levels with great views over Barcelona. It is possible to visit at night when it is illuminated but I believe numbers are limited.Admission includes audio guides, which is much better than having to read descriptive notices on your way round, so you don't miss anything. It is best if you can purchase your tickets on-line before you get there, as there can be quite long queues to get in.There is strict security checks similar to airport ones and certain things may be taken from you and returned on your exit.

I spent forever in the courtyards, it was that beautiful.. I had seen pictures of the famous chimney stacks and of the outer facade before visiting; it's not as outwardly attractive or eclectic as the more famous Casa Batllo but the interior courtyards blew me away. They were a riot of colour, in complete contrast with its more stony exterior. Book online just in case, though there were hardly any queues going in but it was the shoulder season.

One of the fantastic work af Gaudy. This building is made of rocks and steel in a very unique manner which was not acceptable in the days of Gaudy, but which is considered now as a breakthrough in architectural design, its a must seen building.

Weird and wonderful - worth a visit. Another best book online attraction just to beat the queues. You can do this on your phone And they scan the codes so no need to worry about doing it and printing it.Amazing roof top, the pictures we took are amazing - scared me to death but loved it too!The inside and museum is also interesting.Well worth a visit to see more of the works and thinking of Gaudi.
Take the lift. Great fun to walk around the roof, but take the lift as the building is 8 stories high and it's exhausting walking up all the stairs. The apartment museum is well worth looking at.
Beautiful building. We only viewed from outside unfortunately, but it was stunning to look atSuch a beautiful building I did think it was expensive to go in but we didn't have much time

Nice, beautiful, Gaudi. This place is very pretty. I found, however, the audio tour was very annoying because I couldn't adjust where I was on it! It was describing some things ("now you'll see to your left...") but it wasn't in the location at which you start! I did find Gaudi's style very cool & find it crazy people live here now! Cannot imagine what they pay. There's a gallery in one section and while nice & filled with photography on people from all over the world, I found it a bit random & didn't at all see how it tied in to Gaudi or the rest of this beautiful structure. The rooftop view was pretty, sculptures up there are certainly worth viewing. In my opinion, this isn't a must do, but can be done if a true architecture/art/Gaudi lover.

It's a block of flats?. Granted, it's a little unusual, but it's just an extravert block of flats isn't it. I'm sorry - I don't get it but I would say you need to see it and judge for yourself.I don't get why people were handing over fistfuls of Euros to get inside it, but that's just me.
Very nice. La Pedrera is very nice. It is a must see. Most of it is still used by people till this very day as offices etc, therefore not all of it is open to the public.

Place of interest.. Well worth a visit and interesting to listen and follow the audio guide. The roof area was amazing with decorative pillars. People still live in these apartments and you are asked to respect this when walking down the stairs to exit.

If you tour just one Gaudi place!. It is a bit spendy, but we bought a skip-the-line ticket and it was worth it just to see the roof-top terrace! The neighborhood is so charming and full of lively restaurants, bars and shopping, that you will be glad you stopped off here, even if you aren't that big a fan of this slightly crazy architect. Gaudi was a strange man.
Amazing view. The view of the rooftop of this building is amazing. But apart for the view, I wouldn't visit as the building is only partly open for visits.
Good photos . It was great to see. It was on a main boulevard and easy to find. Just follow the crowd. Great to see once and take pictures.
great visit. Roof, nice exhibition in the attic, flat, stairs, inner courtyard, good audiogide, i enjoyed my stay there for at least 1 1/2 hours

The Origins Night Tour. I was desperate to go to this! My flight landed at 21.10 and I made it to La Pedrera at 22.02 (tour at 22.00) It was such an amazing start to my trip and so peaceful, calming and intriguing after a busy travelling day/rushing from the airport. Atmosphere was amazing...to have the whole Casa Mila to ourselves was perfect. I'm told it's a totally different experience throughout the day but still worth going! Our guide was really helpful, easy to listen to and friendly - I've tried to remember his name but I can't!! Light show on the rooftops was fab. Won't give too much away, go yourself! A treat awaits you at the end of the tour too!A particular thanks to the tickets and communications team member who helped me with all my questions via email - greatly appreciated. Adios!
Iconic!. One of Gaudi's masterpieces - needs to be on the of "must sees" if visiting Barcelona. Try to arrange pre-booking to avoid the queues.

Brilliant example of Gaudi architecture, colour, style and shapes. Wonderful building. There's a lot of stairs (lift if you can't manage!).Fantastic displays and exhibitions. Brilliant views and unique use of colour, materials, shape and form all drawn from nature's designs.Try and avoid peak times as it is always busy - you can check on the net.A definite must see if you are vaguely into architecture, design, fashion etc
Gaudi. Beautiful building, amazing rooftop, incredible details!Located a few streets above the Casa Batllo,another Gaudi's building.

Beautiful but not as Casa Batllo. Beautiful house and great terrace. Nice to see the rooms it looked like to live in that house... but I have to say that there is no comparison with Casa Batllo that leaved me breathless!!!! Anyway I suggest to visit it!

Visit the cozy cafe inside Casa Mila!. For breakfast you only pay 2.60 for excellent coffee and fresh croissants. it's incredible if for that price, you get a cozy table where you can see passeig de gracia, and enjoy the wonderful interiors of casa mila, too!
Cool building!. We didn't go inside, but this very unique building located on a corner really stands out and is cool to look at from outside!!

Worth visiting. This building definitely worths seeing!! The ticket price is a little bit high especially if you think that you can only see part of the building because most of the Appartements are occupied!! You have the opportunity to visit the terrace with the uniques chimies and also a Appartement that is open to the public and preserved exactly live it was when it was occupied by its residents!!

If you have to go anywhere go here!. After 5 days of sight-seeing for a non sight-seeing type person this was the place to visit to re-new enthusiasm. Out side you could tell the interior would be something else, and it didn't disappoint! Its worth getting the tickets before hand to jump the queue and walk straight in, if you cant print off the tickets, they will scan your smart phone. Anyway in, and pick up your audio guide; personally I don't like walking around listening to someone blabbing in my ear and having to know where I am just to press the relevant number. Up to the roof and the weirdness of your surrounds, just walk around and appreciate it. Its cool. If you want to take pictures you may have to wait until the crowd disperses from that specific shot; with the amount of steps both up and down on the roof why do people stand on a step and not move? The floor below is the apartment and have a slow walk round. You will walk slow as the slithering snake like mass of people wont allow you to go any faster, I ended up just putting my camera into each room (in between the crush of tourists) and hoped what I caught was indicative of what others saw. Maybe being a bit harsh but as I said at the start sight-seeing is not my preferred vacation. But really glad I went! Bet you do too!! Good pavement café immediately outside on the main drag to re-energise.
La pedrera . I love this place as soon as we walked in we thought wow that was incredible we love that so much I would just laughed and look at some cool on amazing things

Must visit! . It's right up there with visiting the sagrada familia especially if you visit BEFORE the cathedral. The information you get from La Pedrera will bolster your Gaudì knowledge before the grand finale of sagrada familia. I've visited the sagrada four years ago and we are going back now and especially eager since we just visited La Pedrera! Go!

Another of Gaudi's amazing buildings!. Fabulous building once again, in fact some of the apartments are occupied. Lots of steps & fantastic architecture. Spectacular views. Not for those who don't like heights or steps.

La Pedrera nice constrution of Gaudi. The facade and the roof is the most interesting parts of the building.There is an elevator to the roof, but a lot of level differences makes it not so easy to walk for older people

All things Gaudi.... We purchased a combination tour including the Sagrada Familia, Park Guell, and La Pedrera. Of the three this was the least exciting but still very important to understand the character of Gaudi and the impact he had on architecture and the city of Barcelona. Note: If it is raining, you may not be allowed on the roof which provides amazing views of the city and also showcases the detail Gaudi put into each creation. Try not to miss-
Architecture at its best. Roaming through the Gaudi building is like being in a sureal dream, where everything is floating, flying, leaning, melting...etc etc. It is definitely worth visiting

Wow. Admired this beautiful building on board the Barcelona open top bus tour. Commentary explains Gaudis idea to use old tyres for the balcony and an insight to how artistic and couture all hos pieces are. Did not stop off but three bus tour allows sufficient time for the ones like us wish to admire from near

You have to see it, but some members of the staff are rude.. Of course being on a city trip in Barca you have to visit the Casa Mila. But be aware of the "dog" ;-) I mean some members of the staff are rude and not welcoming. Notice that you are not allowed to visit the rooftop on rainy days.

A must see!. La Pedrera was my favourite thing that I did in Barcelona! It's a highlight of Gaudi's work and it's absolutely stunning. The tour comes with an audio guide and can take any where between 1-3 hours (Depending how quickly you move!). There are sections that explain other works by Gaudi, which was nice to learn about. Additionally, there is a beautiful photography exhibit that is included in the tour.
Another amazing Gaudi facade!. We visited in the exterior.It is amazing how Gaudi managed to do a so innovative and different architectural facade for his time. He is a genius!
Another Gaudi brilliance. Cant really say antyhing new about the place but If you are an architecture student or enthusiast you would want to go to Barcelona at least once.

Interesting from the Outside. Crowds flock here, and the admission looked pretty pricey. But it's free to enjoy from the sidewalk. Very different than buildings you see in any other city, so worth the pilgrimage.

Quirky Building!. This is on the strip of Paseg de Gracia so this was an unexpected sight to see! Its a very bizarre building but worth a look around inside! Unfortunately you will have to queue early (which we didn't know about) as the queue to get in was very long but I'd imagine it would not cost alot (around 20 euros) to get in! :)
Not as good as Casa Batlo. After seeing Casa Batlo, this is disappointing. Go for the tour inside, otherwise there's not much to see.. Better just take photos - five minutes and go.

Worth a visit. The main focus of the attraction is the terrace area on the roof, it is quite a walk up but there is a lift. There is also an exhibition in the attic area as well as an apartment in the building to see. Again it is worth a visit if you are interested in Gaudi but like all of the other attractions it is quite pricey.

Light show in the evening. A guide was showing us the house and told us interesting stories. After that we got to the roof to see the light show, which was amazing!! By going out they gave us a glass of sparkling wine. I didn't expect this, but it was really a positive experience
Only for Gaudi fans. We only viewd it from outside since it is part of the itinerary for group toues ~ means over crowded with so much tourist buses.

Interesting visit but very pricey. The views from the roof top are great! The guided tour given by the headphones was great as it explained the vision behind Gaudi works. It was interesting to hear where he took his inspirations from and to see the inspirations too! I thought how he came up with the building plans was very clever. It's a shame it's costs so much to get into the place! €20.50 for an adult!

Did night visit has changed a lot and feel not worth it. ... When we first did this about 4 yrs ago we had one of the most amazing experiences with a friendly approachable tour guide and amazing intimate experience. This time we brought my mother-in-law and we were one of 30 people at night tour (last time we were one of 6 people) and this time we had hard time hearing our tour guide (they should give us all audio guides in our native tongues) and we noticed a lot had changed. We started at bottom and immediately were whisked to top level and terrace and that was it. Last time we went through multiple levels and felt the experience was intimate. This time we felt like a number (and expensive at that as this wasnt cheap).If you havent done this do it but do cheaper day tour and dont pay extra for night tour as nothing special as it feels like they just want to turn over people and make $$$

Night/Dinner joint visit . Casa Mila is a fantastic building that is well worth a visit. We went for the night time tour however we were a little disappointed. I think you need to combine the day and the night tour. The night tour feels rushed and you don't really get time to experience the building. You enter the front door, watch a projector show then climb up to the attic for more of a tour then watch a light show with sound on the roof which displays on the roof sculptures. You don't have enough time to explore the exhibits in the attic which is why I feel you should get the day tickets too.We booked the joint meal/night time tour tickets. As an aside, the meal isn't worth it. They rush you through your 4 course meal literally giving you your next dish as soon as they clear your previous one. I felt like I was a force fed goose pre liver extraction. You'd be better off eating a meal elsewhere. My companion asked for the cod and it was like eating a tasteless rubber duck. The service was unfriendly too. Definitely a tourist trap experience. Casa Mila - 4 starsCafé de la Pedrera - 2 starsSo my recommendations are go for the joint day/night tour and skip the cafe meal all together.

Weird looking building. As a typical Gaudi building it was interesting to look out from the outside. At 16 euros for the entrance fee I'm glad we could admire it from a distance, again very busy area I would advise to pre book if you want to go inside.
Visual dream. The many facets of the architecture are unique. It's art outdoors and its splendor is special from all angles. A must see..

From a farytale!. If you are an architecture lover, you shouldn't miss this place, at least on foot. The price, in general, is not cheap and the only parts of the building you cannot see are the private apartments. Also, you have access to the garden and to the roof with fantastic chimneys on top.

Impressive structure but the Batllo house is better. It is a really impressive place and there is a lot to learn from the audioguides. However, the Casa Batllo offers a lot more for the money. The guides are better, there is far more to see and learn.La Pedrera is a place where people actually live, so only the attic, the roof and one apartment are open for visits.

Wonderful Architecture . Although I had seen La Pedrera during a previous visit some years ago; I felt it would be sinful not to go again and let my partner experience the wonderful architecture for herself. Located very close to the Diagonal Metro Station allowing visitors the opportunity for a nice walk back towards the Placa Catalunya afterwards.

Another Gaudi's must see. The roof is absolutely wonderful, loved it by the sunset, the attic is also great. One tip for the picture, just take the number and you can access it on the Internet, no need to buy it ;)

Spectacular roof. Interesting venue but the visit is mainly focussed on the roof and the appartments. The roof is spectacular but if you would have to choose between the casa Mila and the casa Battlo I would definitely suggest the casa Battlo!
Inside the dragon ribcage. The architecture jewel as it is and a must-visit site. The attic is a unique experience - truly as if you are inside a dragon ribcage.

Unique building. The Attic of the building is really cool. Also, the roof is supposed to be interesting but we couldn't go on the roof due to rain. This building is still in use and there is a cafe on the ground floor where you can have a snack.
Closed roof in rain . They charge the same but close the roof in the rain. So I would wait till you get a sunny day to visit. Otherwise you feel short changed as the roof is the crowning glory.
Also known as Casa Mila. It is interesting, easy to access, masterpiece of Gaudi, very close to Casa Battlo -5 minutes walk. Lucky with phone navigation to find it, though.

Go at dusk. We booked tickets 45 minutes before sunset. We went to the rooftop and watched the sun set, then walked through the apartments. The experience was wonderful. If you're smart, bring a little bottle of something (tucked inside your jacket pocket) and toast to the prettiest views on an incredibly designed rooftop.

Gaudi's gem. Anyone interested in Gaudi's work will be delighted to see this building. For me, the exterior is even more astonishing than the interior. The tickets are very expensive (over 20 euro basic) as to all Gaudi's buildings. Crowded, so best buy tickets online

Superb building. Visited here on a sunny Saturday. The views from the rooftop are great. The whole building is a revelation. We didn't have to queue as it wasn't busy so we didn't have to pay any extra. Would definitely recommend .
More amazing arhitecture. Due to rain we could not visit the famous roof. Nonetheless it was still a wonderful visit to see more of gaudi's amazing architecture and vision.

Unbeliavable. Antonio Gaudi was not only a genius, was a visionary as well, and his works goes beyond our imagination. This building is one of more impressive of his works. Make sure you visit the roof top, it is amazing.

Cool building to look at on your tour of the architecture. This is a really cool building to look at and admire. I did not go inside or on the roof, but this is the building that gave George Lucas inspiration for Tatooine (his home planet). The chimneys also gave Lucas inspiration for Vader and Stormtrooper helmets. This building is also near other famous architecture so I would recommend adding it as a stop on your walking tour of the city.
Another great Gaudi building. Along with Casa Batllo, in the same street, this was our favourite visit in Barcelona - a much more intimate Gaudi experience than the Sagrada.
Nice location, shame about the service. The cafe is in a great location, with echoes in the room of the Pedrera architecture. But sadly the service was incredibly slow.

Good overview over the work of Gaudì. The tour and museum gives you a good overview of tge work and life of Gaudì. The enterance fee is rather expensive but worth it. The audio guide leads you around the house (wonderful view from the roof top).

A wanderful place. We went at Casa Mila, ten days ago.It is an excellent place to visit: understand Gaudi, his three dimmensional models = projects and the way of living in the appartament, at the begining oh the twenty-th century.
Amazing night tour. I have visited before, but the night time tour was a revelation.....delightful tour guide.....fab light show on the roof....my favourite Barcelona building.
Must visit. It's a must seen point in barcelona. Highly recommend visitors to buy tickets in advance. If the day of visit is raining, you can ask them to stamp and go back next day

Amazing! Blew my mind away!. We were in the evening for the guided tour and the show on the roof. The guide was wonderful, told us the most interesting things and time just flew by. The show on the roof, of course, just amazed me (to say the least).The experience is unforgettable. But keep in mind that at night you don't get to see the apartments (which I saw during my last visit). There are combined tickets for day time and evening show. Don't miss out! This is one of the most creative and beautiful things you'll see.

Very cool. We bought our tickets on line and were grateful that we were allowed to enter an hour earlier than our scheduled time, because rain was threatening! Audio guide is included in the ticket price and it's quite good. You get to see the roof, with amazing city views, an exhibit about Gaudi's work generally (in the attic) which was very interesting, and then an apartment furnished as was intended. Really quite extraordinary. Highly recommend.

An architecture lovers treat!. The price is rather steep at 21 Euros for a tour, however I would suggest this over Casa Batllo which is a Euro more. Unlike Casa Batllo, Casa Mila is a complete Guadi building not just a facade. The rooftop views are stunning and the period furniture is stunning in the apartment.

La Pedrera--innovative and fascinating. You have to see this building to appreciate the innovative architecture and elaborate artistic detail, not to mention the engineering genius. It's a great prequel to the Sagrada Familia.

Had to be done for Gaudi. Found this place by accident and did not have to queue around 12 noon. Audio tape is good. Lots of detail. You go up in a lift to the roof and lots of climbing about so not great for those less able. Some good views.

Great choice!. Excellent experience, the place is well prepared to receive tourists though some of the flats are still in use. They don't rush you out, you can explore as you wish, starting from the roof and going down. A bit expensive but worth it, I really enjoyed it very much!
Fantastic experience!. We took our 9 and 11 year old girls on this tour and we all loved it. The architetecture and history of this building are facinating and beautiful. Worth every penny!

Very interesting sight. I went to La Pedra in the morning, which seemed like a good choise. There was practically no queue at all. The roof terrace was interesting. I can't understand how someone has come up the idea of making the chimneys the way they are. The audioguide, that includes in the ticket, was good. I really got more out of the visit with it. In the addict you could learn some methods of Gaudis way of working and there was also a fantastic scale model of La Pedra. The home of the Gaudi family was very well kept, a beautiful piece from the past.

Worth A Visit. To get a good appreciation of Gaudi you HAVE to pay a visit. The roof terrace is magnificent and takes your breath away. But the recreated apartment is the highlight. Just stunning and gives a real sense of what life was probably like at the time.

Fascinating Insight into Gaudi's Work and Mind.. Very well worth a visit, and not expensive. When we visited we couldn't get onto the roof because it was raining (The Barcelonians seem to think that rain is very dangerous), but even so the exhibition and the building were all most interesting. I would recommend that you do use the audio-guide, though. It is genuinely useful.

poor value, go to Casa Batlló instead.. poor poor value. we did the night tour, we did not get to see the casa!!! only the attic (part of it) and staircase were open / accessible to us. the house (apartment) is only shown on the day tour, the website does not mention this. a light show is added to justify the high cost, this is mostly irrelevant to the building. save your money and see Casa Batlló instead (a few minutes away and an excellent building & tour).

Great but could be better. The architecture is amazing.. that is worth seeing... but the cost of the tour is not worth what the tour is. The audio guide is brief and you wait a while to go up the elevator. If you are tight on budget rather visit Casa Battle but if not then Casa Mila is also a great architectural experience. Make sure to plan around 2 hours as there is a lot to see and a lot of waiting!

Stunning. The building is spectacular and majestic. It belongs to a fairy tale. There isn't enough architecture like this in the world. Hope Gaudi lived forever to create more masterpieces of this sort. We didn't go inside due to cost, but seeing it outside is more than enough.

Amazing architecture. . If you like Gaudi you need to see this. Less busy than La Sagrada but still a fantastic sight. Quite pricey to go in, but lots to see and would recommend a tourist bus as you get lots of discount vouchers.

The most amazing roof you will ever see . Like a series of soldiers in helmets, the chimneys and service towers of La Pedrera march across the roof of this spectacular building. Yet another Gaudi masterpiece, this Casa displays lots of innovative features- garage, amazing roof, innovative attics - the list goes on. The building is still in use as an office block as well as apartments, so there is entry to only 1 apartment. Beautifully decorated in Art Deco furnishings, it gives a great insight into how the Mila family, who commissioned the building, lived. Lovely shop to spend your money in, too!
Awesome. Went for the 10 pm tour and champagne toast. I would recommend this tour. It was beautiful to see the city lit at night.

Expensive but interesting to see. We purchased online tickets in advance and were able to walk straight in without queuing (which is always a bonus!). I don't really like heights and because there is only a relatively low wall around some parts of the rooftop, I personally felt a bit uneasy up there! But the views are great and the entrance fee also includes access to one of the apartments which is still furnished authentically. I'm glad I went but I must admit I found Casa Batllo, Gaudi's other famous project, even more fascinating.
Flowing Gaudi. We didn't go inside, but our hotel was close so we walked by numerous times. Always a treat to find another quirky aspect to enjoy.

Art Nouveau a' la Catalunya. The expression I hear most about the architecture and style of Art Nouveau's golden era is that it is organic. I think the great Calatrava and others of his ilk were most inspired by Gaudi's' eartheral force. This building shows how a style can generate this kind of reverence.

Worth the visit. . My friend and I visited on our first trip to Barcelona. We chose to visit la pedrera since it is one of the homes designed by Gaudi that features rooms and furnishings similar to how it would have been when Gaudi first designed it. The whole experience was great. We booked our ticket online before hand (no need to print tickets. They accept mobile tickets). I highly recommend purchasing tickets beforehand as the line up when we got there was at least 30 mins long. Inside you are given a handset that offers further explanations of the features of the home. You basically guide yourself around the building. It took us about 2 hours for the tour and we did not rush ourselves. The building is used for offices so the museum part is on the top floor. You are taken by elevator up to the roof first. And then you take stairs down to the museum (attic level) and then further down to the living quarters. Then all the way down to the ground floor. Total of about 6 flights of stairs down. But not strenuous by any means. The view from the roof was fantastic. It was a bit crowded. And had lots of art students sitting around doing sketches. Which prevented us from walking around the whole thing. It would be nice if they were told to move after a certain amount of time to allow everyone a chance to explore. Overall though it was a good experience. The handset tour was very educational and did a good job pointing out the various features of the building. The furnished home was also very interesting and you really do get a sense of how the building would have functioned back then. The area la pedrera is in is also very nice and worth a walk around to just look at all the various architecture.

Try going at night. We decided to visit at night. This is relatively expensive at 34 euros (with no student price) but you get guided toor in small numbers. You spend time in the lobby, the attic exhibition and on the roof where there is a light show to music projected against the stair turret depicting Gaudies inspirations. In all honesty it is a little Disney but it is well done and my team age companion enjoyed it emencly and it was great to see the roof in such a small group. Note that on this toor you do not get to see inside the apartment but you can pay an additional 5 euros to come back during the day to do thisA word of caution - there are warnings all over Barcelona about the proliferation of pick pockets and it was while I was here during the day that I had my purse stolen so take extra care and be ware of people constantly blocking your way and bumping into you on the narrow steps on the roof
Another fine Gaudi. Very interesting exterior, but due to lineups was unable -unwilling to wait to see the interior. Very modern feel combined with baroque elements.

Beautiful La Pedrera at night.. We joined the excursion called La Pedrera at night. We had a really good guide telling us about the house, the history and about Gaudi. The light show at the roof was unbelievable beautiful. What a masterpiece! Loved every second.

The only bad thing about it.... It was beautiful there, from the roof to the interior and back! Truly, the design of it all, the thought that has been put into everything in that building is just magnificent, the only bad thing about it is that it was over so soon!

Worth the visit. Jump the q though... We went to the premium q line. €5 extra per person. This meant that you went straight in, and got the lift to the roof, then walked back down yourself. Take as long as you like. You have headphones and a handset. All very easy to use. A lot to see, take your time, it is busy with tourists and selfie sticks! Wander through the rooms and enjoy. Nice souvenir shop on the bottom floor.

Aboslute must when visiting Barcelona - incredible Gaudi piece!. Spectacular architecture! Another one of Gaudi's master pieces. The rooftop is incredible; also get access to the apartment and the small museum.It's really worth it.Book in adance, and skip the potential long line.

magnificent architecture!. the architecture of the roof and of the attic are marvelous! the ticket price (though expensive) was worth it, if only for these 2 highlights! the audio guide is helpful and, at the end of our Barcelona stay, i can say this was one my favorite places!

Best visit in Barcelona. This was was number one visit in Barcelona - if you have to choose between Casa Mila and La Pedrera, choose La Pedera. There is so much more to see than at Casa Mila. You really do get a sense of what it must have been like living in an apartment there - indeed there are apartments there still lived in.
Casa Mila or La Pedrera. I love Barcelona with Gaudi or without Gaudi, but he was really great one. and Pedrera says this so much better than me
Fascinating but expensive!. I am glad I had a Barcelona Card as it saved me several euros. The architecture is awesome and unique but I did not linger as much as I wanted as the crowds were too much.

Magnificent!. We took a night excursion (don't remember exac time, nearly 21.00-23.00). It was stunning! The guide has a real tallent for telling stories. La Pedrera is a mysterious place with rich history! A city in a city so to say. The roof view is the final accord -- a must see indeed. Art nouveau and modern art lovers will appreciate, I am sure.

Fantastic in every sense. At last public access is granted to Gaudi's fantastic apartment building. The informative displays work well (especially the attic) and the commentary is just the right length & paced by the listener's visit rather than vice-versa. The temporary exhibition of Toni Catany's photography excited us, being 2 photographers unfamiliar with his work. It was well selected & hung with informative quotes & books.

Casa Mila/La Pedrera is amazing!. Another great house created by Gaudi! It's famous for it's rooftops and design. Lovely visit to tour the building. Free audio guides with the price of admission. We went during the day only but I think it would be worth the extra few dollars to go day and night if your length of stay in Barcelona allows it. That way you can see the contrast with an amazing light show of the statues on the roof. The tour also includes the attic where there's a museum, followed by a tour of a house with old furnishings of the time. There's people residing in the building so we were told not to go knock on people's doors when we were in the stairwell. I wonder how much rent is there.
Interesting, but not the best.. La Pedrera is a nice building, but it can not compete with Casa Battló. Before to visit La Pedrera, you better visit Park Güell, casa Battló and the Sagrada Familia.

Great building, amazing roof. Expensive but worth the money. The roof top is amazing and is also has a great view. The Museum and Apartment give great insights into the work of Gaudi. The Audio guide is nice and well structured and is included in the Price. Should definitely visit one of the Gaudi buildings and I would suggest this one given that this was desgined by Gaudi from ground up unlike Casa Batlo. But this is a personal choice

The roof is not to be missed. I preferred Casa Batllo for the inside but the roof at La Pedrera is spectacular for its views across the city. We had a fast pass ticket so could walk in any time. Wheelchair accessible apart from the roof but you can do part of that in a wheelchair.

Rooftop is amazing!. Buy tickets ahead of time- best option online. Allows you to join the shorter lines for entrance. We didn't buy the joint day and night visit tickets- the building looks beautiful from the outside at night- don't need to go inside.Lovely architecture typical of Mr Gaudi's work.The rooftop is the best part!!!!! LOVED taking tons of memorable photos there!

What a gem ... We were so lucky. It was mid-afternoon and there was no cue for tickets. The place wasn't too busy either though we heard the previous week it was crowded. The free audio guide was really good and the museum displays were excellent.It's hard to separate Casa Batllo from La Pedrera. They are both so different yet so Gaudi. Highly recommended.
what a house!. another master piece from Gaudi,and what a building! It's huge,amazing,beautiful and accessible. One of the wonders you must visit in Barcelona!

Wonderful attraction!. Amazing!is absolutely worth seeing if you are an art lover. The scenery, and the overall decoration, and the whole building is " an stimulant" of the senses. The cost of the ticket to enter is a little pricey for a traveler that is on a budget (about 20 euros) which for me is about 25% of my daily budget.Over all Very beautiful if you can afford to see it, if not, save your coin for fabulous food down the street at the rambla del Mar

Great Gaudi building. Well worth the visit. Shows the integrated concepts used by Gaudi. The design relates to that of the Casa Batlo which is nearby. The roof is amazing and gives good views. It's worthwhile to get tickets in advance online.

The roof is amazing. We were very happy that we visited this house. Other than the roof you do not see much of the original interior. The roof is amazing and worth seeing for sure. However, i you can only visit one we would recommend Batllo.

Worth a visit. Definately worth a visit to see the unique style of Gaudi architecture. The audio guide makes the building easy and interesting to look around. The roof is the best part of this attraction by far. You get to really see Gaudi's style here, as well as amazing views of the city. Its perfect for taking great pictures.

too expensive for what you get .... La pedrera was way to expensive ...yes its Gaudi,s but for 21 euros u get to roof terrace and an apartment. Start your Gaudi tour off here, don't finish it here like we did. If I had to pick one of La Pedrera or Casa Batlló then I would pick Casa Batlló.The price is similar and they both have book shops where u can buy all the stuff u need to take home as presents....what ever you do book it on line ..its easier and much quicker... good luck !!!!!
Must see. I encourage you to come here early in your trip to get insight into Gaudi. This is not a good place to bring handicapped people. Lots of stairs.

Well done museum of architecture and lifestyle. We enjoyed learning more of Gaudi's work in this beautiful culmination of his private property work. The explanations, exhibits, videos and audio tour were well done for visitors of all ages and languages. The tour was well laid out if just a bit pricey at the low-end price of 20.50€.

La Pedrera day and night. So cool we had to do it twice! Although it seemed expensive, we opted for the day/night package. Includes a daytime tour of the grounds, attic, quarters, and lobby. About 45 minutes or so. Pretty funky structure. At night, after dark, the second part of the experience also includes a tour, literally topped off by a light show on the roof. Lasers play off the sculptures on the roof deck, telling a story. Initially it is pretty neat, but it runs a little long. Overall, an experience I will long remember.

Go here first. If you are interested in the work of Antonio Gaudi and are going to visit several of his buildings I would recommend that you start with La Pedrera as it provides the best explanation for the development of Gaudi's works. There is a premium entrance available which allows you to skip the longer wait for standard entrance (additional €5) which we felt was worth it.

Good start for a day of Gaudi. La Pedrera is an apartment house, and you begin your visit on the roof (elevator takes you up), with it's interesting chimneys and ventilation shafts. It's an uneven roof, so wear comfortable shoes. Next is the attic, with lots of info about Gaudi--good audio tour that helps you get an understanding of Gaudi's influence and talent. Then down the stairs to a typical apartment, which is airy and open and thoroughly fascinating. And don't worry--they have a gift shop that's huge. We enjoyed seeing the different parts of this site, with all of Gaudi's quirky and brilliant contributions, from door handles to lots of light. Worth the visit. If you can only choose one (between this and Casa Battlo) choose this one.

Little expensive but very interesting!!!. An impressive piece by Gaudi once again... Every corner is moulded and round, the detail is so unusual... A sight for the eyes!!! You get to see his apartment which is just huge... definitely go.

A Good Place to Start Your Gaudi Tour. Definitely a must-see, and I would recommend to do this before seeing other Gaudi architecture. The building is still a fully functional apartment building with residents, so visitor area starts on the top floor and provides a great introduction to Gaudi's vision and work, including how Gaudi's vision of La Sagrada Familia and Park Guell.
Stunning achitecture. We didn't have time to go in but the outside architecture was stunning. Gaudi was so ahead of his time and there is little to match his genius.

Masterpiece of Antoni Gaudí. A place you can never miss when you come to Barcelona. Its a building Spanish architect designed for a couple long time ago. However, the design of the building still impress everyone who sees it even now. One of the floor is used to as a demonstration for tourist to have a look how people house look like back then. Definitely a worth going place. Don't miss!!!

Mind blowing time traveler builds an apartment building!. This building and the audio guide tour was the penultimate introduction to Gaudi in Barcelona. I liked the self-pacing, and there was plenty of meat in the tour elements, leaving you feel like if you could only do one Gaudi 'thing' this left you satisfied. Totally worth it - do it!

Gaudi mind on happy living. It is certainly not possible for me to describe these flats in any normal way - you just got to see it. But it is much to seldom to watch and experience the alternative possible way of happy floating dreaming like building style. What a sight.

Mind blowing. This building is magic on all levels. Architecture, ecology, luxury, aesthetics... Considering it was completed in 1912, it is simply mind blowing. Attention to detail is ridiculous. Gaudi was way, way ahead of his time, as well as way ahead of our time. Must to see

Go on the Night Tour!. We paid extra for the night tour and it was a huge breath of relief to explore a Guadi building without hordes of people! It was a wonderfully guided tour, with great information and an animated tour guide. The lights at night truly paint the building into something magical. Upon going onto the roof, a unique light show is put on and you are able to explore the roof and enjoy the lights of Barcelona. After enjoying the tour, you are provided with some Cava to enjoy in one of the buildings courtyards.
Gaudi as his best. Great place to check out one of Gaudi's famous home designs. Worth the fee to check this out if you are in Barcelona.

Terrific Gaudí. I visited the building this easter and remember the last visit to Casa Batlló some months ago. Although the entrance tickets are not cheap, it's worth the visit of the building inside, mainly the roof and the main flat, decorated with furniture and posters from the modernist age. A wonderful way of spending a whole morning.
Special building. When you see it for the first time you immediately notice Dali artwork. Building is really special from the outside( we didnt gomin because que was huge). Must see in Barca
Stunning ! . Fantastic tour of an iconic building. The rooftop was spectacular - even our 11 yr old "teenager" loved it ! Lots of quirky gifts in the shop too !

See other Gaudi sites first.. This site was interesting, but not nearly as much as Casa Batllo or Sagrada Familia, and quite expensive and overhyped. Glad I visited, but don't make it your first stop.
Another Gaudi masterpiece!. Like being in a Flinstone's cartoon. It really is a remarkable structure inside and out. The rooftop is amazing and provides interesting views of the area.

Excellent example of the period. This building displays the pragmatic side of Gaudi's design, houses a museum describing how he used nature to inspire his ideas, and includes the best example of apartment living in the early 1900's when indoor plumbing and lighting were in use for those who could afford it. There are several cafes just outside to rest your tired feet.

Beautiful architecture ahead of its time. Even if you are not a big fan of Antoni Gaudi you should still check out this place.... Absolutely a beautiful structure both inside and out.... Be ready to for the long line or pay extra 7euro for easy fast access

Wow! Take the night tour as well. Wow! The architecture is amazing and the self-guided tour is pretty cool.
Definitely sign up for the night tour if you have the option, it's worth it. The guide was great and the experience (minus any chatty tourists) takes you to another world.
Simply awesome.

This place is a little too Gaudi for my taste!. If you are in Barcelona, you should pay your respects to La Pedrera. We hung out on the outside like a couple of hoodlums. The place is so different than any other building in the world. They have a great gift shop on the first level. Wish my town had a crazy person like Gaudi to spice things up a bit.
Great gaudi house. Love gaudi? You'll love this house... The roof top alone made the visit worthwhile, audio guide was great. Enjoyed the visit thoroughly

Stunning. When you approach the Pedrera is stands out immediately as Gaudi especially against the adjoining buildings. There will probably be a queue at the entrance but it doesn't take too long to go down so don't let that put you off.The interior of the building is amazing but the highlight has to be the roof of the building which is a now a Unesco World Heritage Site. The detail in the Chimneys is amazing to see. It also gives you a taster of what you have to look forward to in the Sagrada Familia which you can also see from the rooftop.

Great tour but too expensive.. I really wanted to visit a Rooftop terrace, while I was in Barcelona. So once the weather was great, I went to la Pedrera and took the tour. The tour is really nice, but chilling on the rooftop was easily the most amazing thing about it. Without it I wouldn't have got my money's worth.

Gaudi is surprising me everytime!. One tip-buy the tickets in advance online,you go immediately inside...we spent about 20 minutes and as the terminal didn ´t work we had luck with our cash;-) You are waiting in row with free wifi, but we didn ´t succed to buy the ticket online there:-( Never mind when you get on the roof of La Pedrera,you are in another world...the headphones guide completed the atmosphere of the visit. Gaudi was increadible creative,his inspiration was nature...I admire his feeling for funcionality combined with beaty!

Another do-not-miss in Barcelona!. Supremely interesting and beautiful Gaudi architecture for practical, everyday living. Looking at the photos my husband took, I saw the aesthetics incorporated into each small detail of the interior of the apartment that is open for a tour--I missed them while walking through. You'll never see another building like it.
Great building.. This is a must. The roof top is incredible but the visit to the apartments in unforgettable too. Don't miss it.
Gosh!. Well worth hitting a guided tour in the evening so as to get the full lights experience. Informative, humorous guide.

Fantastic architecture from Gaudi. The 'Casa Mila' building is amazing. Casa Mila/La Pedrera is another great example of the genius of Gaudi. You can go to the rooftop to see the beautiful chimneys. Defintely worth a visit. Book your tickets in advance online.
waving wooow and wooooow. gaudi gaudi gaudi! waving walls and iron balconies. soldiers as chimney. special mosaic styles. some places od this house were like a horror movie :) love it!

Worth a visit. Definitely worth a visit here. From the outside it doesn't look anything amazingly special. But worth paying to go inside to go up to the roof. Absolutely beautiful, and great views over the city
Nice spot. Beautiful view from top and a good way to experience Antoni Gaudi work. Something worth seeing if you have not seen his other buildings

Beautiful forms. La Pedrera became a visit destination due to air France strike, we felt obligated to fill our time. We walked from the Gothic quater up to Pedrera so saw an awful lot along the way. By the time we arrived at the undulating building there were queues, however we waited no more than twenty minutes and then we were through with our inclusive audio guides. La Pedrea was Gaudi's vision of urban living the house a series of apartments. The forms and textures are exquisite, the rooms dressed much as the original family might have left them. From the vaulted hall you are sent to the lift which takes you skyward to the most impressive roof affording you a breathtaking skyline. A word of warning, for those with no head for heights the roof can induce vertigo, the steps lead you to think you could plummet to earth. The chimneys are almost like chess pieces, strange figures when seen from ground level but on the roof it all makes sense, they belong there covering the functionality of the space. The attic explains in detail aspects of Gaudi's work and other projects situated around Barcelona and you can take as much time as you wish. Of course as you come down the floors to the exit there is the obligatory walk through the museum shop but here there are some interesting items. You can pay extra to visit at night when the building is lit up.

Inspired by Gaudi . What else can I say...this place is breath taking...the audio was interesting enough that my boys found it really informative (fab considering it's difficult to tear them away from their mobile phones) do not miss this place...it is simply out of this world!!
Impressive Architecture. I would have loved to go inside but due to time constraints I just passed this by long enough to take the traditional selfie and close up shots of the casa

There's no way George Lucas didn't see this roof!. I had to tour La Pedrera just to get up on the roof! I did a tapas tour that met at La Pedrera and seeing it at night made me realize that I really wanted to tour it--it was stunning! The lines of the building are beautiful--Gaudi's imagination was amazing.The ventilation system on the roof is Star War-esque and it just made me smile. The flow through the building was a little confusing, but there was staff there to let you know where to go next. You needed to really pay attention to see the numbers for the audio guide so keep your eyes open. There was a section where you learned about how Gaudi did his designs, and it was really interesting. Definitely worth a visit.
Typical Fantastic Gaudi House. The 'snake' house is truly unique in all the world. Spend time to notice all the details on the walls and railings. Step inside to see the interior too.
Great building. Audioguide tour is very good. Very interesting exhibitions and a masterpiece of architect Gaudi. A must!
A shopping avenue. For window shoppers or shoppers this is a must visit from Mont blanc, Prada, Gucci, Rolex, Hermes, Chopard, Louis Vuitton, Cartier, Escada, Chanel ... You name it and its there.

cool architecture. Gaudi architecture is always exciting to visit, great buildings and style. Situated in en area with nice coffee shops and restaurants, you can watch from a distance or from up close, whatever you prefer.
Stunningly Different. We did not go in due to time constraints but visually it is very impressive. We were able to get great view from open top bus - recommended.

a.k.a Casa Mila. La Pedrera is another genius creation of famous architect Antoni Gaudi set on Passeig de Gracia just a few blocks away from Casa Batllo. Also known as Casa Mila, the building is an actual residential construction! The entrance fee is also about 20 euros and is coupled with quite a large queue. Thus booking and buying tickets in advance is a good idea.
Unique place to live. I never liked Gaudi's buildings from photos but they are amazing in person. What a unique place to live and worth a visit.

Extraordinary house - must see. But be prepared to pay for it - extraordinary high. Headphones - one ear did not work. And it is bad. Years ago in another museum guided tours were designed to start as you move through the museum. Here you have to press the number of place you are at. Most of them I skipped cause I did not notice the number. Anyhow, it is great and should be seen. But the whole management of the thing is bad and very expensive. I don't have problem with paying for the service given. In this case the service did not match the price.

The future, from the past. This apartment building looks like a structure you would expect to find in a futuristic exhibit at Disney or a post modern design studio. It is difficult to believe that Pedrera has stood for 100 years. The layout of the apartments would make any contemporary apartment dweller jealous.Although the building is still occupied by rent paying tenants, it a tourist attraction through and through.While one may be tempted to just have the free look from the outside, you would miss most of La Pedrera's beauty.I recommend you go shortly before dusk. The roof top is lit up with projectors after dark and creates a spectacular show. Take the Audio guide, it provides information on many interesting elements you would otherwise miss.
Tough to rate. For one to appreciate this, you already need to have a natural appreciation for art, history and Gaudi. There has to be a reason this building is a big deal in Barcelona.
Over priced. Nowhere near as interesting as other properties. Signage for audio guide not always obvious. One member of staff in the gift shop was extremely rude

Another great Gaudi experience. My least favourite Gaudi creation, but still a must see. Loved the wrought iron decoration on the exterior of the building and particularly the roof. Agree with a previous reviewer that the price is too much. If on a budget stick to Batilo and Sagrada.

Another Great Example!. La Pedrera is another great example of Gaudi's genius. There's so much to see in the detail in all his work & this is no exception. You can get out onto the rooftop here too & La Pedrera is definitely worth a visit.
Beautiful!. If you're in Barcelona t's worth to stand in line to get your entrance ticket see this building. You get the chance to see a panoramic view of the city when you reach the top.

Must-see architecture. Definitely worth a visit if you are planning to spend some time in Barcelona! The building showcases some of the best of Gaudi's architectural style. Booking tickets online ahead of time is recommended.

Gaudi Gaudi!. The tour of this building was part of our Runner Bean Tour. It gets very crowded even with the "skip the line tour". Try and go during an off time to avoid the crowds, The roof is the best part. Don't miss it. Its said that that's where George Lucas got the inspiration for the storm troopers in Star Wars.
You must see. This is the most beautiful Gaudi home I've seen. It should be a must see on your trip to Barcelona. Visit casa Batllo as well, they are close in distance.
Beautiful, but expensive!. The price to visit is astronomical! It was 120€ for a family of 5!!! It is beautiful, and the roof & attic are magnificent....but geez that's pricey....

Didn't think I'd like it as much....... ....but I did. Lacks some of the colour that I love so much, but the central tiled "bit", the roof scape and the way you can see how the building is/was lived in - simply great.

A very interesting tour. Really interesting & informative. Loved the roof top & the apartments, would recommend. Try & stay together if you're in a group as you'll have no chance of finding anyone! Also really difficult to find the way out (through the shop) as no signs & big groups of school kids everywhere!
Couldn't find it. We didn't actually get to visit as couldn't find it. There are no signs so could not find it. Very disappointed.

Nice show, bit overpriced. This wasn't a planed visit, in truth I'd never heard of La Pedrera before. I was walking past when I noticed a queue outside. I looked at the board outside which advertised an English guided tour in about ten minutes. With nothing else to do I headed over to the "box office" to buy a ticket.I went to the box office and handed over 34, yes that's 34, euros for a ticket and joined the back of the waiting queue.You go into an inner open air courtyard and the guide gives a talk about the history of the building and you see a short film.You then have a choice of either stairs or a lift to take you up to the attic. After climbing up about a million stairs you get into the attic.In the attic you can really see Gaudi's design and the architecture is very impressive. There are also models and some Gaudi designed chairs. The guide gives a detailed talk.You then go up onto the roof where the real magic happens. The guide excused herself and said that a colleague would be up later to show us the way down. You are then treated to a fairly impressive light and sound show that is beamed onto the tops of the stairwells. To me this was the highlight of the tour and I am glad I seen it, even if it did cost 34 euros.After the show finished, there was no one to show you the way down and we sort of wondered around aimlessly until we found a staircase.At the bottom you exit the stairwell into a second courtyard where you are served refreshments and given time to reflect on the tour.Overall I enjoyed the tour but thought it was a bit expensive at 34 euros and should be a maximum of 20.

Enjoyed the. I recommend the premium tickets. You walk right in and bypass the line ups. It was very interesting to see the apartment and attic and the views from the roof of Sagrada Familia are well worth it.
The least of Gaudi's work. Located at the Gracia avenue worth stopping by but not neccessarily a visit since others of Gaudi's houses are more enjoyable.

Extraordinary design. La Pedrera was the last great civil work with Gaudí performed before dedicating all his time to the construction of the Sagrada Família. Gaudí planned a fantastic house with undulating, living forms.
Gaudi at his best. Make sure to visit La Pedrera. Book first time in the morning with audio guide to avoid crowds and learn more about this innovative talent of the early 20th century.
Gaudi master of neo gothic architecture . Definitely a place to check out you will be amazed by this creation that has been mantained trhoughout the years its a piece of art that will leave you amaze
Wonderful Gaudi. Easy to get to from Catalunya Plasa, just a short walk. The roof is the best. The apartment is wonderful just to know how the people lived at that time.
Nice but thats all. Well... its a nice place but nothing that I would spend so much to visit. The roof is interesting but thats all

Extraordinary design. This is an amazing building. It intrigues from the outside and amazes once you're inside. Beware though, if heights really worry you, check with staff about the rooftop experience. If you can though, don't miss the rooftop, it's incredibly unique. The museum in the attic is where you will spend the bulk of your time though. Very informative and well presented. Very worthwhile to visit this unique site.

Amazing Gaudi apartment building. Absolutely worth going to see. It is so modern despite being built in 1912. A beautiful highlight. The gift shop is lovely and worth a look. I did not try the restaurant.
Great. This is a great place to visit me and my family loved it you seeing 1 place where you can walk around and see how the residents use to live. It's very fascinating.
Worth a visit in the evening. We visited at about 7pm and had a look around for about an hour. The roof is spectacular against the night sky and definitely worth a look.
Beautiful walk around. I went early morning and it wasn't too crowded. Love every part of it! Beautiful scenery everywhere, every spot your eyes can catch.
Exciting and homey. Unlike , Frank Lloyd Wright. Gaudi apartment has a warm and livable quality . Stunning details are coupes with functionality and convenience .

Nice experience at night. The nightly visit of the Casa Mila was a good experience. The staff was welcomed. The show on the roof top is amazing. Nevertheless we'd like to have more time to visit the house itself. The guided visit in the attic is short. A nice - too short - experience, at an expensive price.
if you like modernismo. Did not think it was worth going to see it. But it is on the Passeig de Gracia, so if you are in the neighborhood you might as well go.

Another great masterpiece from A . Gaudi . Gaudi was truly a genius architect. Loving the design. Rooftops was brilliant. If you appreciate design , I suggest you pay this place a visit. A must when in Barcelona

INCREDIBLE. I have never seen anything like the masterpieces created by Gaudi. I loved every single one of his homes/apartment buildings. This is a must do when visiting Barcelona. I'll be back again!

One of Gaudi's Masterpieces. Visiting La Pedrera was more proof for us that Gaudi was an architectual genius. The rooftop was the first part of the tour and it did not disappoint. The visit to the attic and the apartment made it the visit all worthwhile. You should definitely put in on your list to visit while your in Barcelona.
Gorgeous roof. The roof is the best thing of this building. It is the Gaudí's building I liked less but I still think it's worth the visit.
Just go and see it. if you appreciate architecture and design you MUST go. If not don't waste your time and money. I loved it.
Skip Fincher. Take your time everywhere. The roof will blow you away and it only gets better from there. Right down to the basement parking in a building built in 1912?

Brilliant architecture. A wonderful building with brilliant architecture. Everything is so smooth and designed with such attention to detail, I loved the curved and wavy surfaces, the patterns, the mixture of shapes and materials, this building is just amazing.
Genius. fascinating. you need to visit. Gaudi's genius. Against ... ticket prices are a little high 42eu for a couple.

Fascinating. We were walking and again when you see a building that looks like this (even in a city where there are so many unique buildings) you have to stop and admire the architect. It wasn't until we returned to our apartment that i found what we had been looking at.

The Genius of Gaudi. The only Gaudi attraction we saw that was more amazing then Casa Mila (the original name for La Pedrera) was Sagrada Familia.There are 2 options when touring Casa Mila: La Pedrera by Day or The Origins (a night tour). We did both and I definitely suggest both. During the day you can stroll and your leisure and really look at everything (the best parts being The Attic and the rooftop). The evening tour is an actual tour which we were happily surprised by. You get to find out a lot of interesting things about Casa Mila this way and it ends with a light show on the roof.

More interesting than breathtaking but with a visit!. La Pedrera does not blow you away like Casa Batllo - although the roof is definitely the piece de resistance of this Gaudi house! But it's still well worth visiting because of the extensive exhibition on Gaudi & his architectural style in the attic, and the rooms below high are decorated & furnished as they were originally in the early 20th century - from the children's room with their 1900s style toys, to the kitchen equipped exactly as it would have been and the study with a very, very old original typewriter & the original phonogram in the sitting room!

Amazing Architecture. You have to at least drive by and see this building. Its hard to imagine it was built over 100 years ago. We did not take the "tour" because we thought it was a little pricey at 20 Euros to basically access the roof and see one apartment that was furnished as it would have been when this building was first built.

definetely worth it. This visit is amazing. Not only for getting to know how a rich family of the last century lived, but also thinking about how Gaudi thought of every detail of this building when designing it.Also, people still live there to this day! Incredible!
The roof!. The apartment tour is fine. But the roof is unbelievable. The many chimneys and levels are magnificent.

Quick visit to La Pedrera (Casa Mila). If you just watch La Pedrera from the outside, you are missing the best. The entrance price is about 20 Euros, which includes an earphone guide to the building, really helpful to understand how it was designed and built. It is really worth the visit. I´m very happy I decided it.

Gaudi's apartment block. The vision of Gaudi is best demonstrated in this wonder apartment block, even the furniture and door handles were designed by this genius. You start at roof level and work your way down to the apartment that has been kept as originally designed complete with very modern bathroom and kitchen facilities, considering the period in which the building was erected. Definitely worth a visit and disabled access friendly for the most part.

On the elegant Passeig de Gràcia, the next wonder of Gaudí's La Pedrera, or Casa Mila.. It was commissioned by a wealthy Catalan couples to affirm their status in Barcelona society. Gaudí has done for them this strange undulating structure. His bizarre chimneys, arched windows and wrought iron balconies are beautiful and well worth the visit.
