The self-guided tour includes exhibits and slide presentations in La Pedrera's attic as well as a "secret" to his design genius. Not to be missed is the Roof Terrace with its unique structures, each one a self-contained work of art. If one has only time to visit one Gaudi work in Barcelona, Casa Mila, La Pedrera in the Eixample district would be my choice of preference where one encounters Gaudi's foremost creative genius and where form becomes function. Don't miss it!

Amazing. Book online it saves queuing time. I did the day and evening tour, the day tour is with a headset and the evening with a tour guide, so some information is slightly repeated (not much) but I do recommend going back for the evening tour as the night show on the roof is amazing with the projections and the music, loved it. There's also a glass of fizzy wine and a nibble at the end, which wasn't bad

Buy your ticket on line. The best part is the view from the top. Book your ticket on line, the only way to save time. Go early morning to be able to enjoy the terrasse on the top. It should be also very nice in the evening. The apartment visit is nice to do

extraordinary. It is hard to write something that someone already did not say about it.If it is spectacular to me and wife, and if the kids find it interesting for more then hour and half, then it must be somehow special.Gaudy was genius, it is not new to say, it is really extraordinary and again and again I find the ambient, the roof, the shop, the picture of it worth a next visit.

Gaudi as always. One of the most famous buildings of Gaudi. It is beautiful in the inside but also in the outside. The terrace is famous for the chimneys. The entrance fee is 25euro. A bit expensive for 10-15 minutes that the visit lasts but Barcelona takes good advantage of Gaudi's work

Jaw droppingly amazine!. One could spend hours studying the colors, angles, materials, doorways, windows, etc. of this fascinating building. If you're not familiar with Gaudi and his work, you must not miss this unusual building.

Outside is good but the roof top is just Amazing!. Well worth the visit, its very easy to find and only takes a few minutes to walk to. The museum is not cheap but very interesting along with lots of exhibits and information But the bets bit for me was most definitly the roof, with the chimneys and the great vies over the city is not to be missed!

Whimsical and wonderful. Me and my friend use the self guide audio, easy to use and very informative. If you like architecture it's a must go place. The gift shop offered very nice items from post cards, books to fashion.

Stunning example of Gaudi's genius. Book ahead. we were lucky to only wait 40 mins. Well organised tour of an incredible piece of architecture. wonderful example of Gaudi's forward thinking genius. Rooftop exceptional

Essential Gaudi. Ticket provides access to 3 areas of the house: the rooftop, the attic and an apartment suite. All 3 areas are excellent and the provided audioguide does a great job of explaining the architecture. This was our first Gaudi stop and the exhibits in the attic did a great job of educating us and getting us excited to visit more of the Gaudi sites. The rooftop closes during inclement weather, so be sure to go on a good weather day. Also would recommend buying tickets online in advance to avoid the lines.

Amazing building. This was our first Gaudi "attraction". Thankfully, there wasn´t many people in line (buying the ticket). There is another express line for people who purchesed through the web.The audioguide was included. but mine stopped working as soon as the tour started.It's an amazing building. I'm not a fan of architecture, but this place is really something else. Unlike anything I had seen, specially if you know some families still live there.The best part was the terrace, with all those bizzare statues and monuments). You get to enter one of the apartments and it is untouched, just like it used to be.

La Pedrera at night!. I highly recommend their night tour and light show ! It's beautiful and magical! Reasonable size groups and knowledgable guides (good English too !) Gaudi's apartment is fascinating as well. The tour ends with some small tapas and champagne , lovely!

Architectural genius at work. La Pedrera was our first stop during our visit to Barcelona. We were astounded at the interior of this work of art. Our visit allowed us to better understand the genius of Antoni Gaudi. His ability to design architecture that mirrored nature on such a large scale was astonishing. This is a must for any Barcelona visitors.

Must go!. Try to book online and go early morning or late afternoon if u like to take good pictures. Audio guide is important. It was one of the best experiences i had learning how he did the building. Salute him!

Amazing!. Very nice place to visit. Booking online can help you get in first but buying the ticket directly on site is also good. The line during my visit was not that long (November) but i guess during summer more people comes in to see. The audio guide is ok but the signs (numbers you need to press to start the audio) should be made a little bigger for easy spotting of the tourist.Don't miss this out when you're in Barcelona... Tip: if you're traveling alone (like me) get a monopad (selfie stick), very easy to take pictures...
Thinking outside the box. Beautiful master piece, makes you appreciate Gaudi's genius and creative mind. Love the detail and skill that produced this work of art.

Amazing blend of nature and art. I only had a few hours left and wanted to see inside. It was worth it. The views from the roof were amazing and the attic was extremely interesting. I was very glad I stopped by on my way out of town. The metro stop nearby makes it very accessible.

Nice. It was interesting and nice, especially the view on top. But for the price we pay (20€) they could atleast improve the directions or the signs-numbers for the auto-guide. ( only small red signs) !!

Pleasantly surprised. Myself and my partner visited la pedrera as my partner wanted to see it. I wasn't too bothered but thoroughly enjoyed it. The tour was well organised and thought out, we particularly enjoyed relaxing on the rooftop terrace. The attic museum and apartment were also very interesting to us, gaining an insight into which aspects of nature inspired Gaudi's work.
A Masterpiece. Gaudi's masterpiece. Well worth the time to visit to better understand his design princliples. The building is awesome, unlike anything you could experience anywhere else in the world.

Simply amazing. Gaudi is where the artistic beauty and practical design of nature meet architecture. He proves that aspects of buildings can be practical, easy to use and works of art. This is an apartment block like no other in the world.The lower floors are accessible to wheelchair users, but whilst you can get out onto the roof, you can’t go far. The roof and the views from it are magnificent – so don’t go on a rainy day. But if you are I wheelchair user, make the most of the portholes in the attic – not as good as going round the roof, but you do get some close-ups of what you missed. In the main tourist season, booking tickets in advance is strongly recommended, but when we visited in October, the main queue was only 5 or 10 minutes long. You can easily spend a couple of hours inside and are likely to take absolutely loads of photos. Their website is well worth a looking at, either before or after your visit and probably both. Try the virtual tour – though it is a bit sensitive to the mouse. Casa Batllo is a short walk away, which we also visited, but a couple of days later. Too much Gaudi in one day might blow your mind.

Just opposite to Casa Batlló, you do not have to go in, outside is impressive enough. We did not go in, our time not permitting. La Pedrera is located just opposite to Casa Batlló, so passing by and looking at the outside will give you quite enough to experience this Gaudi's masterpiece.

Truly quirky!,. We visited this after being to Park Guell, we only saw this building from the outside, it certainly has the wow factor, easily accessed via metro system, this is a lovely area, with some lovely designer shops.

Day/Night Tour. I got a ticket for Day/Night... The day self tour was alright but preferred the night tour bc I didn't care so much about the inside of the apartment remakes. The roof of the building was my favorite, they had a very cool light show against the giant mosaic sculptures. After doing a Gaudi walking tour though it was great to see the insides of his creations.

Great way to learn more about Gaudi. I loved visiting both of Gaudi's houses. Although the tickets are expensive, it is well worth the price. I suggest booking online to avoid the long lines. The audio guide is excellent and you can take as much time as you want to explore the house.
A wonderful building. If you like architecture you can't go through life without visiting this building. No two lines are identical and the almost liquid flow of the architecture is a joy to view

Just an average building, not good for rainy days.... I was expecting a lot more when I visited "La Pedrera" it is a nice piece of architecture and you learn a bit about Gaudi, however the rooftop was inaccessible due to the rain yet they charged us the same amout for the visit, all the rest of the rooms where really just ok, I could have gone by my life without visiting it.
Don't miss this!. My husband and I toured La Pedrera today and loved spending 3 hours looking, admiring, and learning about A. Gaudie. The experience was amazing!

Iconic rooftop, great apartment tour. If you like Gaudi's work, then you'll want to see all his Barcelona buildings, and this one can be no exception. Definitely get your tickets online, in advance; the "Premium" ticket option is, in my opinion, worth the extra 7 euros... it allows you to simply show up at any time you like (during normal hours) to begin your visit -- you don't wait in a ticket line, or in an admission line, and you don't have to rush there to arrive at an appointed entry time, like other attractions. (I didn't try the night-time roof tour; in my opinion, Your tour includes an audio guide device, which is quite useful. On the premium ticket, you enter directly through the original motor court, then take an elevator nearly to the attic. (A flight of steps gets you there.) The attic is a marvel in itself, with the many, many catenary arches made of brick, undulating throughout the space. Terrific exhibits are set up there, explaining the building, Gaudi's style and innovations, his furnishings, his ergonomic thinking, etc. Very educational, if you've not read much about Gaudi before this.From the attic, you take steps up to the rooftop -- a large, hilly terrace (following the undulating form of the attic below). The chimney stacks and ventilation shafts are the draw here (as is the wonderful view of Barcelona in all directions.) The famous "Storm Trooper" (almost evoking the look of the Star Wars character) chimneys are here, along with the big, fat, swirling tiled or stuccoed chimneys. If you're into photography, you could easily spend more than hour on the roof alone -- I certainly did.From the roof you start your descent, to visit a reconstructed apartment, outfitted with period furnishings, to show how an apartment might have appeared for a well-to-do upper-middle class family, back in the day. (Each floor originally had 4 apartments for rent -- the building's owners occupied an apartment spanning the entire 1st floor above street level -- now an exhibit space.)Eventually you'll pass through the exhibit space (which during my visit, had mounted a great exhibit on Modernisme, covering architecture, art, textiles, decorative arts, furnishings, jewelry, etc.) Finally you reach ground level again and exit.The building also has a cafe -- offering the rare experience of dining in a Gaudi-designed space. (You do not need to buy a tour ticket, to enter the cafe.)

Can't Believe. This is a beautiful building. It is hard to believe how wonderfully the design worked and that there are still companies that occupy the facility. The attention to detail is like non other.
Great. Very nice building to visit, but be cautious not to go on a rainy day, as the terrace won't be available !

Night tour. It was disappointing. Spend your 34 euro elsewhere. Not the best of Gaudi sites. If you see Casa Battlo and Sagrada before this tour, you would learn and see little new of Gaudi. The guide was uninspiring.

Interesting, but not for the price. This was a recommended place to visit by our hotel concierge in Barcelona. We waited in line and bought the tickets, which I thought was a little high compared to other places that we visited. The tour included a voice guided commentary at specific parts of the tour. The tour started at the roof of the building, which showed many of the architectural designs of Gaudi. They were different and interesting. It then provided history of the building and some the traditional room décor of residents in the past. This tour was interesting, but, in my opinion, not for the price.

My favourite place in Barcelona. The outside doesn't look much but believe me, a visit inside is well worth the 20 euros entrance fee. The audio guide is excellent. The apartments and rooftop are just amazing. Very easy to find close to 'Diagonal' metro station. Do not miss this on your visit to Barcelona.

Beautiful. Excellent and interesting commentary as you move from room to room. The building is beautiful and you learn a lot about Gaudi's life and creativity. The roof is amazing and a real highlight. Well worth the entrance fee.

So so compared to other gaudi buildings. The nicest part is the roof only. The indoors are nothing compared the casa batllo's. I would recommend visiting this if you have already visited the other gaudi stuff ( for me it's my second time visiting so I ran out of places to see).
Gaudi's Masterpiece. If you see one thing in Barcelona this has to be it. The walk through is coherently arranged to give you a great appreciation of Gaudi's influence inside and out,
Very interesting house and exhibit.. While I'm not really a Gaudi fan, I felt like this house did a good job of showcasing his work. Can't say it's gorgeous or anything, but certainly interesting.
Night tour. The light show was great and you learn a lot about Gaudi's ways and inspirations. The staff is really friendly and you get complementary drinks at the end!
Another Gaudi's piece of Art. this is a different kind of art from what is expected from Gaudi. Inspired by the Mediterranean and the waves this house is a must visit
Fun and interesting. Beside the Sagrada. this was well worth seeing. I bought tickets on-line ahead to avoid the lines and loved the roof-top.
Take your camera. went passed this wonderful building everyday and every time we went by we took more photos.. such a beautiful place

Get an advance ticket. I spent an extra 7 euros per ticket to go anytime we wanted. We were two couples and doing so worked well and added flexibility to pour plans. That said it as busy when we went there. The cyclone fencing on the roof top is very un-Gaudi making seem more of an unfortunate maze than the experience he intended. The rest of the tour was also crowded. What is amazing though is the detail he paid to everything. Try to visit when it may not be busy but I don't know when that would be.

Another Gaudi masterpeice.. Just a few blocks north of Casa Battlo, this is another of Gaudi's creations that just can't be missed.Tickets are expensive (20€) and lines were very long, so buy them in advance. The rooftop is whimsical…even if I’m not fully convinced it’s worth the price of entry.If you’re not really into paying that much, the building is still a feast for the eyes from the outside.

Informative. I visited La Pedrera on my way to tour Gaudi's basilica. It gave me a good understanding of Gaudi's style, but it was a little contrived and staged. The audio tour was informative, but I would rather have had a guided tour. The roof top is splendid and it makes the ticket price worth it. One only needs about an hour to tour the building.
Cool place. It was a 2 hour visit , since the house is huge. It's a nice place to visit and enjoy the city character.

Cool Buildings in Barcelona. If and when you come to Barcelona, just get out and walk. There is cool stuff everywhere. You don't need a tour company to tell you what is fun. Just go and get lost. They have a nice metro so if you get tired. Find the closest one to zip back to your new fav bar or hotel. We were shopping and just looked up. NICE!

Unique. Beautiful. A look inside the Belle Epoque Art Nouveau Style.. This place, built as an upper middle class apartment house, is one of Gaudi's masterpieces. Beautiful, different, awe inspiring, what ingenuity in architectural design especially the interior rooms and the roof. Great city views. The self guided tours with recorders just perfect. Admission a bit on the high side (20 euros or approx. $24 per person) but well worth it. Glad we visited this marvel.

Amazing building but €20 euro to visit the room top a bit to expansive. I just admire the otside of Casa Mila , I found the price for the ticket to be overpriced €20 and change to visit the roof top and a few rooms inside .

First site visited in Barcelona. Goudi's La Pedrera or Casa Mila was the first site we visited after the long flight from the US and checking into our hotel. Conveniently, it was a 5 minute walk from our hotel, and a Starbucks was located across the street!We thought the visit would be a quick in and out, however 2 hours later we found ourselves exiting through the gift shop. The self-guided audio tour is very well done, providing not only insights into the amazing structure, but also into Goudi's life and techniques at the time. The tour starts with an elevator ride to the top floor and visit to the roof, which was amazing for its curious design and panoramic view of the city. After the roof, you wander through the attic, where you learn much about the history and Goudi. Last stop before descending an artful staircase is a tour of a top floor apartment.I highly recommend premium admission which allows you to skip to the front of the long line. The additional 7 euro entrance fee saved us a lot of time.
Unique Perspective. It is really evident that Guadi used his knowledge of nature to design this structure. Unusual details unlike any other building.

Distinctive. Quite a surprise to see this building amongst the others. So much detail to look at on the outside of the building and a good foretaste of the other Gaudi buildings in the city. Did not go inside but many people were visiting.

I was skeptical at first but the visit won me over. I thought this was expensive for getting a view from the roof top. After all we had already been to La Sagruda Familia and we saw the Block of Discordance. You can view the outside of La Pedrera for free and look at pictures of the top and insides. But I was wrong. We spent over two hours at the site and enjoyed everything--the roof view, the museum in the "attic" and the walk through of the apartment. Through this visit you get to see another side of Gaudi. A not to be missed site.
GreatTapas. Enjoyed a variety of tapas in a good enviroment , with friendly staff. Interesting Place with lots of history.

Impressive!. Saw La Pedrera from the open roof bus, and our hotel happened to be nearby, so we took the time to see La Pedrera. I regret not going inside, but was amazed by the beautiful architecture, again reflecting Gaudi's magic mind. Would have loved to make it all the way to the roof top, but, I'll be back!
A Masterpiece!. If one died and went to heaven, it would look like this! Another Gaudi masterpiece. Along with Sagrada Familia, this will leave you breathless!

Worth visiting. Though this is not as great as Casa batllo, it's still worth visiting. Audioguides are free, the commentary of the audioguides are really good (at least the English commentary). Ticket price is really big, but it is worth it.
Wonderful.. Beautiful building, as you would expect from Gaudi. Simpler than the rest but no less interesting. Views from the roof are wonderful.

Stunning!. We didn't plan to visit La Pedrera, but the hotel receptionist advised us to. We are so glad we did! It gave a greater appreciation of Gaudí's art but also his genius as an engineer and architect. The view from the roof is superb, but also the attics are fascinating - no rooms but the construction is clearly seen and explained.
Roof top amazing. Information in attic helps you understand gaudi design inspiration ..rooftop a treasure .. Do visit.. gift shop a must visit even if you don't visit the apartment casa mila
La Pedrera. Great building to visit, the concepts Gaudi used are fascinating.and ahead of the times, even today they are not used to such an extent.
Gaudi building. Breathtaking. Really worth to visit even if you don't go inside :) You must see Gaudi buildings if you are in Barcelona, They are really unique.

Very unusual building - well worth the visit.. Gaudi showing his most fantastic architectural style. The roof is fabulous and like no other. Internally years ahead of his time. hardly a sharp straight line anywhere. A definite if you visit Barcelona

Amazing architecture!. Gaudi's architecture is uniqe and amazing! The whole building is designed as a whole. The roof is spectacular, for the view and as only for itself. Great historic building. Reccommend seeing if in Barcelona.
La Pedrera. Popular attraction. Good example of Spanish architecture. Spatial promenade to view the outside. A must see.
Worth a visit. This was enjoyed by all the family. It was a beautiful day so spent quite a lot of the time on the roof just taking in the views and atmosphere. Very informative and good for all ages.

Gaudi's last project. What an interesting tour through Gaudi's final project.The ventilation stacks on the roof are especially captivating. It is too bad that his benefactor grew tired of financing the project before fencing the roof with blue steel. I am sure Gaudi had something fabulous in mind for the fencing (more organic for sure).

a wonderful glimpse into a Gaudi building. This is a glimpse into the apratment buildings that Gaudi and his colleagues did. It's a bit expensive but you get a real sense of the master at work. The rooftop is amazing in design and in its views. Late in the afternoon, it is less crowded and the light is beautiful from the roof.

A must-see for those on the Modernista Circuit. Book ahead to avoid the awful queue at the ticket office. Plan on the inside being a slow-moving sea of tourists. Those annoyances aside, for Gaudi fans this is a fascinating site and worth the visit and admission fee. The audio tour was useful (though we kept missing the visual number cues), whimsical roof is a highlight with great views, and we appreciated the chance to walk through one of the flats. The museum space in the attic is worth some extra time to really get perspective on how Gaudi worked- we were glad we went here first, because the models, films, and dioramas gave us some good context for his other works we planned to see later. I'm an architecture nut, and I was thrilled. My parents had no idea what to expect and have no background in architecture, and they really enjoyed this house tour, too. Only major drawback was the crowds, but what can you do?

Expensive. We paid 36 euros each to walk round a poor museum. It was great to see the roof terrace but when it comes to gaudi in Barcelona view it from the street n save your money, it is just as beautiful!!!

Good to visit Must see !. It is great to see Gaudi architect on roof top. It is worth to see. Ticket cost 20.50 euros, it is pricey. I had visited in the evenning with no queue, but you can book onlin in advance.
A great Gaudi building. After Sagrada Familia, Park Guell and La Pedrera are the 2 other "must" Gaudi sights in Barcelona. You will enjoy all 3 places.

Also see the night show!. I came here two times, during the day and for the night show. Out of all the Gaudi's design I saw in Barcelona, this is my favorite. Gaudi is just a genius, the design and techniques that he used was unreal at that many years ago. During the day visit, I can explored the building in my own pace, which was a nice experience. The night show included a simply tour of this building, but it doesn't allow you to explore the building like how we can during the day. The end night show is the reason we came back, too bad they don't have an option for just the night show itself.

Yet another must see place. With unique façade and spectacular roof top in a busy beautiful Barcelona,having to compete with other tourist attractions, it gets its fair share, so long queues are to be expected, but well worth, highly recommend it

Another Gaudi must see. This is an apartment block as opposed to a private dwelling so just a show flat to see in detail but the roof has the wow factor. There is also an interesting exhibition on the first floor so plan time for this if you can. Buy a ticket online before you go!! If you're not sure of your schedule pay the extra 5 euros and get a premium ticket, this allows you to turn up any time/day and not queue.

Must See Place. Not to be missed a beautiful building with so many unique features. The roof alone is worth a visit quite amazing with great views over BarcelonaWell worth buying VIP Ticket if queue is long

Must see if in BCN. Quirky yet purposeful architecture- signature of A. Gaudi's work. The roof top is where the magic lies. There is a cafe next door (overpriced as expected). Lines are long, buy tickets ahead of time.

Must-see Gaudi architecture in Barcelona. We did the evening tour, which includes a rooftop light show on the ornate chimneys. Hard to describe adequately, but wonderful experience. I would highly recommend. Very informative and interesting lecture on Gaudi's creation.
Must see. This building is amazing too the balconies the stairs the room with every single detail of old furniture and the roof top it was soo enjoyable

Rooftop Wonder. Once on the roof, the architecture comes alive with sculptures that look like masked people. They actually might be functional chimneys. Inside you can tour an interesting apartment of original owners. Views outside were magnificent.

Amazing Experience. First of all, if you have the opportunity, buy the ticket online to avoid the long waiting lines. It seems also a bit pricy, but it's totally worth it. You will not only see the building from the inside and appreciate the amazing rooftop, but also you will be exposed to a lot of explanations about Gaudi's work. It's an excellent way to know more about the architecture and furniture design by this great artist. It's totally worth it.

Presented in a very interesting way.. Allow a couple of hours. We did not need to book in advance. You start on the roof and work your way down. There is some really interesting information and exhibitions in the attic floor. The next floor is an apartment set out as it would have been when it was first built.

Interesting building. This is a very interesting building and a good base to first find out about the architect Gaudi. The roof top terance was lovely and gave great views over the city. Doesnt take too long to go round- about an hour and a half, we listened to the full audio tour.

Even more Gaudi beauty. So beautiful...so unique...simply amazing! We did buy the Jump the Line ticket and so had no wait. Loved our visit using the audio units and fount them most helpful. Don't miss this one!

Nice. It was a bit too crowded so I could not very well enjoy the roof top. It's so many people I barely could take any pictures and as there it's so may steps people actually feel. Well I am impressed by the ideas been put in the roof top. But I wish I had been one of the first people that day.I was expecting a bit more to see from the inside. There was only one show room. And I actually prefered Casa Bastllo than this.
Gaudi Greatness. A not to be missed site in Barcelona.. La Pedrera is worth a visit especially to see the rooftop and the amazing Gaudi sculpture..

Do the Night Tour. We loved seeing this Guadi building up close and at night. The show on the rooftop was unique and beautiful. We did feel rushed and wished we had purchased the tickets to revisit during the day for a few more euros. Chatting with the staff over a glass of Cava and finger foods was a nice way to end this tour.

Informative. Went with young children who loved the free audio guide. Lots of info.The roof is the highlight but the attic fills in the gaps. Note the chemist opposite sells bottles of water at good prices

Architecturally Compelling. It has been a while since i have been architecturally involved in design and history when I made my visit to Barcelona.It was refreshing to so the La Pedrera standing tall and grand at the corner. With all its ins and outs, the roof and atrium. My favourite part is definitely the attic, which has an awesome exhibition about Gadui's works. If you can visit La Pedrera before Casa Batllo.They are located on the same street.
An impressive architectural masterpiece. You don't have to look too hard to find it as chances are you will stumble across it as you meander up the street. Worth seeing once you get there.
Fantastic and so unique. I'm a huge fan of Gaudis work so thoroughly loved seeing this building. Definitely use the audio guide.

Absolutely fascinating!. If you go nowhere else and maybe you are a day visitor - then this is the one attraction you should see. It is amazing in itself however you learn so much about Gaudi and what he was all about. If your interested in learning all the details allow around 1 & half hours and have the audio. Most informative, exciting and different. He was way in front of his time with design from the unusual waving roof and chimneys to the solution for drying washing to even the door handles, and there are people still living in the place!!

Nice Gaudi Sight. Did the Origins night show here. Guide was excellent. It's pretty neat that you get to see Casa Mila at night in such a small group. Rooftop is so beautiful. Show was good as well. Afterwards, there was time to take pictures on the room. Cava was waiting for us when we get back down.
Amazing. Simply amazing. Must see if you're in Barcelona. Definitely recommend the night tour it's visually breathtaking

Less visited than the Batllo house and a must visit place. The house gives you this opportunity to understand the architecture of Gaudi. You can go on the roof with a great view on the Tibidabo hills, the Sagrada Familia and the Passeig de Gracia. I enjoyed visiting the apartment that is furnished as it was 100 years ago. The audio guide is very educative
Fascinating to see inside a Gaudi building. A great place to visit. We arrived just after it opened at 9am one morning, so no queues to negotiate. 20 euros each for an audio guide and plenty to see.

Lunch before our visit to the Casa Mele. We had left the city tour bus at the La Pedrera attraction but decided to have lunch beforehand.We ate outside, although when using the facilities after lunch found the restaurant inside looked really lovely.My friend and I both had the tomato, tuna and mozzarella salads served with a glass of tonic water. The salads were refreshing and very tasty,although my friend thought the portion of cheese was too generous - I ate the lot!!

La Pedrera. This building is an apartment building designed and built by the architect Antoni Gaudi . The same architect that designed the Basillica " de la Segrada Familia". A wonderful building that still is occupied by tenants. The top apartment and attics are open as a museum. You also get to tour the roof top and see the unusual chimneys dotting the rooftop. The apartments circled a central open court that gave lots of natural light. If you like archeticure do not miss this magnificent building. Lots of interesting facts about the era and how Gaudi developed this building.
Gaudi Gaudi Gaudi. "Gaudi" is the best description for "La Pedrera" bulding and its architecture.Like every Gaudi's master piece this is one of must see in Barcelona.

A fascinating piece of architecture. Stayed in hotel nearby and visited early to avoid the queues. The roof top was incredible with views over Barcelona and oozing with Gaudi design as was the attic. A bit expensive but well worth it.

Great to see Gaudis creation close up. Really enjoyed our visit to La Pedrera. The roof is bonkers, and even busy with visitors you can spend time examining the Barcelona skyline and Gaudi's designs close up. The apartment was interesting too, with curved walls and original features. Go early to avoid queues.
Well worth a visit. In Barcelona you have to visit the Gaudi buildings and this one is very interesting - buy a ticket in advance as we had to queue for over 1/2 hour
We did the night tour. The night tour was well worth it, less grounded and the show on the roof was amazing, to top it of with champagne afterwords.

A great introduction to Gaudi and his works. I love Gaudi and I chose to go into La Pedrera over the otherbuildings in The Block of Discord. This Casa is very informative for someone who is new to his works and his techniques. I spent a really long time reading all the commentary on the exhibits and walking through the rooms admiring his designs and architectural choices!

As impressive inside as out. One of Gaudi's masterpieces, and shows he was years ahead of his time. Take the tour (pricey, but worth it) and get up on the roof. You can get up close to his work and admire the views over Barcelona. Stunning.Again, either pre-book or get there early - it gets very busy

Astonishing place very elegant and beautiful house. As written before Gaudi was a genius . In this street there are two houses that he planned . This house is very different from the other but in many ways is similar. I loved it, and preferred this house from the other
Amazing, but underconstruction :(. We could not see the whole building as most of it was being renoveted. But the roof is AMAZING!!!!!!
One of the most famous Gaudi buildings in Barcelona. Situated on the Paseo de Gracia a main street in Barcelona is an outstanding example of Gaudi archictecture.
can't go wrong with this one. Gaudi is such THE celebrity in Barcelona, that you can't miss this building. However, be advised to reserve in advance or else wait on line.

Be sure to visit the roof. My husband was going to skip this one but it turned out to be our favorite of the Gaudi attractions. Noted as the one that is the most 'Gaudi' I found it very interesting and worth the time and money to see. Do not rush this one as you spend time on the roof viewing the city from all angles, the attic with a lot of history and an apartment outfitted from that time.
Gaudi at his best !. Once you take the elevator and go on the roof you step in one of the finest roofs made by Gaudi: the size, the view, and the shape is unique; be sure you have the camera ready
Incredible as it built!. Unusual building! I suggest to look at the building in the evening when the lights on the façade this building looks particularly attractive and unusual!
I just saw the outside. It did look beautiful and apparently there is statues and art on the roof but the prices were very expensive.

Creative!. The architecture of this building is so creative! The floor which is showing the residential house of the family of this house is the best! It will return you back to the old days, old equipments and house tools, old playing pieces! The only thing is the management of this attraction do not have well organization and management. We stayed in a long queue and once we reached the counter, she told us that this is a desk for a premium tickets and they do not accept credit card and if we want to pay by cards we should go to another desk! We noticed that the security man were asking the people in front of us some questions and then most of them they left to another queue. Then we found that these people were having another type of tickets and they should also join another queue! They need to improve their services and emphasizing their entrances and type of tickets.

Very interesting . The visit nicely supplemented the visit of the sagrada familia. It allows to better understand Gaudi spirit and project. The price is a little expensive but the visit is quite rich with many visuals and explanations.

One of top 10 places in Barcelona. We enjoyed our visit and I liked it but it was little bit too expansive I think. Maybe would be good any discount for example when you buy ticket to La Pedrera you will get cheaper ticket to any other Gaudi attractions like Casa batjo or any other.. But anywai it' s worth it. I really liked rooms inside with original furniture and things like that. It was amazing. My boydriend is not big fun of museums but he also liked is so much.

Superb insight into Gaudi's work. Fantastic experience. Friendly and helpful staff in such a wonderful location. The audio guide was of a superb quality and the use of videos, visuals, tactiles and breathtaking construction worked well together. We bought our tickets ahead which was great. The only time we felt crowded was through the apartment.

Loved it!. Well worth the €20.50 entry fee! Really interesting and for us, a better experience of Gaudi than Parc Guell! Free head sets are great for helping you around. You not only go inside Casa Mila but also up into La Pedrera.. truly fascinating!

Exceeded expectations. Wasn't too sure what I was in for. What an amazing man a Gaudi was - this building is testimony to that. Great tour with audio guides. Great information on all aspects of the building. Ad visible to book online to avoid a queue.

Amazing Place. Casa Míla or La Pedrera is beyond amazing. The view from the top is beautiful and the structures are amazing. I recommend you buy thickets online ahead. Long linesCasa Míla Es muy bonita. Burns vista y las estructuras son maravillosas. Nos encanto. Les recomiendo comprar Los voletos de entrada en internet antes

Stunning... But maybe a little expensive. Obviously you HAVE to see all of the Antoni Gaudi arcitecture whilst in Barcelona. All of them are absolutely stunning, with this being no exception. Fortunately we seemed to pick a good time to visit, as we barely had to wait in line for a ticket at all and managed to see all of the sculptures and rooms without any trouble. We managed to get in just before it started chucking it down with rain, so it was a good indoors activity. The audio guides are great, I'd advise taking up the offer of one of these for free as it might get a little boring if you don't understand the concept behind the work/aren't an arcitecture nut. My one tiny little issue with it is that it does seem to be overpriced, especially when compared with the other arguably more interesting Gaudi installations in the city. This was the first of them that we visited, so i was quite surprised when the others were significantly cheaper. Maybe avoid if you're on a shoestring budget, but if you've got the money spare then worth a visit.

Gaudi again. I have never seen an individual have so much positive influence on architecture in a cityThis apartment complex is Gaudi through and through and is quite incredibleDon't baulk at the entrance fee it is worth it

So much more than it looks from the outside. Our kids went a bit reluctantly but then had a great time dashing about on the roof top stairs. The apartment was gorgeous - I wish we'd left more time to look at it. Great views from the roof, and more opportunities to appreciate the genius of Gaudi.

Fascinating and well done. We really enjoyed our visit to this Gaudi house. It really pays to buy advance tickets so you can skip the entrance lines. Once inside you have to wait in line to go up in the elevator though. You start at the rooftop which is the most amazing part so take your time there. The views are tremendous as are the sculptural elements. You also get to see the attic space and an apartment. There is lots of well done audiovisual info on Gaudi's architectural designs. We spent about an hour there. Gift shop is good too.

Extraordinary. We spend a couple of hours visiting this fantastic building. You'll have to wait a while, but it's worth it. We went by elevator to the top floor, eg. the roof. It's really amazing what could be build some hundred years ago. We were guided by earphone. From the roof down to the attic, which is a beautiful construction. We also visited a flat which must have been luxurous at the time. We are happy we spend the time here.

Unique Building. I purchased the premium, anytime entry tickets and we were treated like royalty....skip the line and a separate elevator to the roof. The inner courtyard is nice but the rooftop is very interesting. We also enjoyed seeing the typical apartment that you can tour.

Stunningly modern work by Gaudi. On my last day in Barcelona I had a couple of hours to visit Barcelona. The hotel suggested La Pedrera and said if we arrived early we wouldn't need to pre-book. This was true. My two colleagues and I got straight in and did the tour. Gaudi was so far advanced in his vision - the block of flats is very impressive, especially the way he designed the roof with its various chimneys. Great views over Barcelona too. You can visit one apartment (the block is still lived in) which is furnished in period, with small Gaudi touches like beautiful floor tiles and carved brass door handles. Lots of nice things in the shop too! When we exited, there was a long queue! Definitely worth a visit but plan ahead or get there early.

It's too expensive. We stayed in the line for about 10 mins to buy a ticket, which it's not that bad, but paying more than 20€ was too much for what we were able to see...Full of tourists, La Pedrera is a little chaotic to visit even during a week day. The only thing truly worth seeing is the roof top and the building's façade (the last one you can see and admire without having to buy a ticket).It's an interesting place to visit if you're truly into architecture, if you're not, it's going to be a little disappointing...
Good Example of Gaudet's work.. I am a fan of Gaudet's work (unsure of spelling of his name--Sorry!) so I loved this example of a "non monument."
Simply beautiful. Amazing architecture and the roof top is fantastic - loved the apartment too! The audio guide is very good and is free for a change. Would recommend visiting this attraction

Surprising and mouth-dropping experience. We wanted to see the La Pedrera House in Barcelona, but had only several hours available. The long entrance cue discouraged us initially and we decided to admire only the impressing exterior of the house. But we have discovered a ”premium” ticket - a possibility to get inside quicker, paying an extra - and we took the opportunity gladly. We took the lift and went directly to the roof of the building. Getting out on the roof - we had a huge surprise discovering an ”out of this world” landscape. Amazing terrace, mouth-dropping - like a piece of another world in this world. Statues, stairs, curves, sculptures - the roof is like a story from a science-fiction book! We explored the roof, then visited the attic and the apartments - and enjoyed all the explanations and exhibits there. We have learned many things about Gaudi, his way of working and his way of thinking and applying into practice. We were very grateful for the opportunity to enjoy a detailed visit at La Pedrera. Wonderful experience and congratulation for the quality of organization of this touristic experience!

Unbelievable architectural ingenuity!. Outstanding piece of Gaudi architecture. absolutely worth visiting. we used the Priority entrance (27€ as opposed to 20€ at the main entry point. It was worth the extra to avoid queueing and waiting and you get taken right up to the top by lift - better than walking up 8 floors. The lift is also available for priority visitors to descend again when the tour is over.Everyone also gets a digital audio set (which you wear on a neck-band) with headphones. You select the number on the audio device according to the number displayed at the various locations around the building.The tour (which is self-guided - you don't get a guided tour, just the audio guide - but that is very good) starts on the roof. Sounds un-prepossessing perhaps - but it is amazing! This roof will take you some time to explore.Next comes the attic. again - sounds a bit ordinary, but the structure itself (inverted brick parabolic arches) is fantastic and there is a very detailed series of displays relating to Gaudi's work on the building. The displays run across the attic space. Very interesting.After this you descend one floor to more displays and a short documentary film, and an apartment set up much as it would have been in the early 20th century. There is also a shop there where you can buy souvenirs etc.It really is a remarkable building, and your visit to Barcelona would not be complete if you missed this work by the City's famous architect.
Highlight of the visit to Barcelona. Amazing building. Gaudi's masterpiece if you ask me. Especially the roof terrace is amazing with the chimneys and ventilation shafts.

Second only to La Segrada this is my favorite site in Barcelona. If you only have a day or two in Barcelona make this a definite stop to see. Give yourself a few hours to truly enjoy this beautiful work of art. It has so much to see. Take the elevator upstairs and view a breath taking panoramic scenery of Barcelona while literally standing on art. It is rare that architecture is considered art, but this Gaudi structure definitely fits the bill. After going to the roof, go inside and tour the attic, yes that's right the attic, which is really more of a museum than an attic, but even here the architecture is splendid, like a ships spine. Be sure to watch the short movies and read about each accomplishment, including a bio of the great yet humble man himself. There is another exhibit on the first floor of famous photographs, not Gaudi, but well worth the time to look. The gift shop is also amply stocked and will make you want to take home a memento. Note: we went in June at the height of the season and spent a few extra euros to take the fast track line. We did not purchase tickets in advance. So, if the regular ticket line is long I recommend the fast track line around the corner as it was only a few extra euros each. Also across the street and down a block were some great restaurants that also happen to make great sangria, as you will want to take a break after your adventure. I recommend Consentida Cervesaria off Passage Garcia. Also La Pedrere is a Hop on Hop off stop. Very easy to get to. I spent 3 hours in La Pedrera and worth each second.

A Building Inspired by Nature. This is another must see Gaudi creation when visiting Barcelona. From the outside the roof looks like a giant petrified wave. It is best to buy your ticket online to avoid the long lines. We waited until the late afternoon and managed to not have to wait too long. Once inside the courtyard is amazing. This links the two apartment blocks. Yes, people actually live here. There is an apartment that you can tour. There is also the amazing attic which stores a Gaudi exhibit of his work. The attic ceiling is supported by over two hundred brick arches. Be sure to tour the roof terrace. I wish we had returned at night to see it with all the lights. Gaudi was a true genius of architecture, art and engineering.

Good for a photo. My wife and I went and saw La Pedrera in Barcelona in October of 2015. Would we do it again? No. Would we recommend it to friends? Yes – only if they knew who Gaudi was. It was neat to see it. It is one of the most famous apartments in the world. If you’re a fan of Gaudi, or of Barcelona, it is a must see as it is one of those things that make Barcelona Barcelona. Don’t plan to stay too long. A quick photo and you can be on your way.If you found my review helpful, please let me know that by clicking the Helpful Button. Thanks.
What a work of art!. Words can't express it. You need to see it. Creativity to the "n"th degree. Gaudi was a true master and his use of color and design are amazing. Worth the cost of admission.

Exudes Beauty. Lovely architecture by Gaudi. Interiors are stunning and bulding models are on display. The roof top terrace with whimsical chimneys are charming. Avoid going during the midday sun as it can get very hot and it is blinding in the light to observe the details. We went early morning and enjoyed our visit. We also returned at night and had a tour of the building's interior and a light show on the terraced roof. Bring a camera or video recorder to capture the colored lights and to photograph the surrounding buildings. There were perhaps 30 people for the 8:30 pm show and we pre-purchased our tickets at our hotel.

Must see the rooftop -- go at night.. We went to see this in the day and it was fabulous, but when I heard that it is open at night, and lit with colored lights, I thought it would be nice to go in the evening also. See the rooftop all lit up, and also see the city lit up.

Architectural wonder. This is a lovely house, different built than Bathlo, yet somehow complementary to it. You cannot pick between the 2, because you get to see something different in both and is worth the visit! I also recommend the shop, it's really nice.
Exceptional. This building with its architecture is an outstanding example of Gaudi. It is unfortunate its everyday use limits the tourists a closer inspection.
Best of Gaudi. Amazing architecture from Gaudi again! Great location, book tickets & time before the visit to avoid the queues
Not another one!. Not another Gaudi creation? Yep. Still amazing though, as he was ahead of his time. Very popular with many sightseers.

Amazing!. Quite a beautiful example of Gaudi's work and creativity. The courtyard is astounding and the rooftop astonishing. Because we wandered to it and were unprepared, we paid extra to "jump the line", but I would recommend purchasing tickets online ahead of time.
yet another popular attraction. Underwhelmed by this, biggest attraction of this was the roof's design and the view. The rest I felt was overpriced.

Early Sunday Morning Trear. Being first in the building when it just opened made the visit all the more enjoyable. We had plenty of time to explore the more constrained hallways and rooms. To see what Gaudi achieved in design of his architecture without computers is remarkable. The tour does a great job of explaining this. It also shows in his other works the application of these techniques. Go early.

Brilliant visit. With the audio phone the house and its history is well described. In particular, the roof is quite amazing, where Gaudi let free his imagination. The internal walls facing the courtyard are a riot of colour. Take your time absorb Gaudi's genius

Not as good as Casa Batllo. - Facade looks interesting, interior was a little meh, structures on roof are cool/weird
- Liked Casa Batllo more
- Close to Diagonal subway stop

Go to the night light show. It's hard to compare this to Casa Batllo since you can't go inside, but we really enjoyed the light show on the roof top at night. They give you a glass of cava at the end of the tour, which is a nice touch.

Another awesome Gaudi example. I'm not a big architecture buff, but you can't help but admire Gaudi's work in Barcelona. La Pedrera is just another beautiful example of Gaudi's work. When I was planning the trip, I was definitely wondering why people were paying 20 euros to get into each of these buildings. After trusting my fellow Trip Advisor members, I can completely understand why. Loved the design of La Pedrera, especially the rooftop. You can get a cool view of Barcelona from the top and learn more about Gaudi's work and vision in the audio guide. There's a section that also gives you a sneak peak at all the other Gaudi landmarks in Barcelona.

Rooftop just blew us away. All of Gaudi's architecture is amazing and puts you in another world..............Darth Vader inspiration was definitely on the roof.Incredible feeling of creativity and the view towards his Cathedral was amazing and really made it seem the stuff of science fiction
Overcrowded. An interesting building however there appears to be no restriction on the number of visitors allowed access. It was very crowded and the real charm is the buildings exterior.

Gaudi in all his residential splendor. The building (built 1906-1912) is, of course, a visual treat and architectural eye candy. Some of the stairways and entryways of this active and occupied apartment building are stunning. The rooftop is a whimsical wonderland and the supporting attic is a structural wonder. The tour also includes a typical bourgeois era apartment which affords close-up views of not only the living quarters but also the elaborately and intricately designed balcony railings that adorn all sides of this magnificent structure.
Very Interesting!. Loved exploring the rooftop! I wish though that we had gone to Casa Bastilo instead as it looked much more colorful. But you really can never get bored of Gaudi's work!

Wonderful. If you have any interest in architecture in general or Gaudi in particular, this is definitely the place to go. Not too much of a queue to get in, and headphone guide is included in the price of admission. Loved it.

beautiful building; great tour. I'd recommend booking express tickets through your hotel concierge or online. Much easier than waiting in line. The audio tour was good, but it was easy to miss some of the numbers along the way, so we wound up backtracking.

Gaudi. One of the most beautiful house built by Gaudi, named casa Mila, with a lot of Art Nouveau decoration, a must during your stay.
Everything in this house is art (see also casa Batljo)
Must visit. Have a Gaudi experience with those parabolic edges and mind blowing engineering and architectural skills. A must see place in the town. Nevertheless, the price is a little bit high.

I love Gaudi !. This is the first Gaudi's place that i visited. Initially i was a bit hesitate to pay 21 euro for this but decided to try it out. We skip the line becsuse we got this ticket from the tour info center. The building design structure is so amazing and so informative if you listen through the explanation. Definitely worth the visit

Stunning building, worth a visit.. Visited here on a Sunday so not too busy. Paid the higher entrance fee to avoid the queues, defo worth doing this. Wonderful architecture! If you're a fan of Gaudi, its a must see!
View is nice. The view from the top of the building is very nice but the rest of the exhibition is not worth it. You can skip La Pedrera and use the money for casa batllo.

Worth a visit but avoid peak times. Very interesting property with distinctive Gaudi designs, architecture and attic exhibition gallery. Some great photo opportunities from the roof. Apartment was very busy when we visited. Allow a couple of hours to look around the whole property etc.

Wonderful place to visit. Loved marvelling at the truly spectacular balconies and the visit to the roof was amazing. You need a good head for heights up there.The visit comes with personal audio in all languages which really brings it all to life. The tour round the apartment was very interesting also
Must see. This is a must see in Barcelona. The building itself is well worth the visit the view from the rooftop is fantastic. It demonstrates the beauty, ingenuity, and genius in Gaudi's designs.

Beautiful and interesting . We came here as part of a tour so we got to skip the queues which was great. The building is fantastic and the roof top is like nothing I've seen before. The history was interesting and I recommend that you visit if your going to Barcelona!
Nothing special. If you are European there's nothing special really to see inside. The view on the top if the building is ok. The price for the ticket I think it is too expensive
Barcelona must see!. Wow! This place is fantastic. You must see this attraction. There is a walking tour included in the price of admission. This tour gives you sooo much history and information.
Well worth seeing.. La Pedrera was beautiful. The history of the building was amazing too. The roof top terrace and the attic were the highlights for me.
Not quite what I expected.. After seeing casa Batllo I was looking forward to see La Pedrera. It was not that special to me when compare to Casa Batllo.

Interesting interpretation of Gaudi's design process. This is an amazing building from the outside and the rooftop. As there are apartments in the same building that are privately owned it doesn't have the feel of a complete house like Casa Batllo. It is however well worth a visit. We had read that it was very busy during the day and so arrived spot on 9.00 a.m. and were admitted straightaway without prebooking tickets. We did actually enter quicker than the line with prebooked tickets but this may not be the case later in the day.

Great Views from the Terrace. Reservations are needed to visit La Pedrera, or you spend too much time in line. You can choose either the stairway entrance for more $$ or the side entrance. Both are dramatic plus you do get to check out the main foyer and staircase. The audio guide is helpful and is included in entrance fees. The home is lovely and very unique. The highlight is the roof or terrace. Nice views of Barcelona and interesting design elements.

Excellent audio tour of Gaudi museum. This offered our first insight in Gaudi and his work and life. It was well worth it and only took us 2 hours to see the whole museum and listen to the whole audio tour.

Amazing experience !. This was our second visit of La Pedrera in 10 years ! We have been amazed by Gaudi's architecture first time in 2005 when we visited La Pedrera and now in 2015 for the second time ! The rooftop was the highlite of pour visit with its chimney and ventilation design and the fantastic view of Sagrada Familia and the city ! We have also enjoyed a nice coffee at their coffee place at first floor ! We bought tickets there and the line-up was about 20 minutes. If you get tickets on line there is no waiting to get in.

Quite a Rooftop. Did the tour of the rooftop, attic, and apartment.The rooftop is unique and also provides quite a view of the city (including Sagrada Familia).The models and videos in the attic are worth spending some time with. Liked seeing how he suspended chains then viewed their mirror images to help design the arches in the cathedral.He apartment was OK. Seen other interiors from the early 1900's that I liked more.

Amazing buiding..... Being used as an apartment building and home to a cultural center. Designed by Antoni Gaudi. The building exterior has wrought iron balconies resembling waves. The chimneys decorated with mosaics, marble pieces and shapes. A work of art!

Well worth a guided visit. If you don't like queuing, it is best to arrange your visit for either early in the day or - slightly better, maybe - in the late afternoon. We were staying in a hotel less than a block away, so had seen how the lines rose and fell as the day went by (this was towards the end of September). The audio-guided tour, in English, was excellent. An hour from start to finish is about enough time for most people, I would guess.

La Pedrera is a revelation. This was our first Gaudi experience and it didn't disappoint. The audio tour was very helpful. A little pricey, but I'm sure helps maintain the site. Access to the roof and apartment were great. Really interesting to experience a Gaudi building in a residential neighborhood.

Worth A Trip For the Roof Alone. You might be tempted to skip La Pedrera--the Sagrada Familia is Gaudi's magnum opus, Casa Batllo gives you more access (since unlike La Pedrera it's no longer used by tenants) and Parque Guell has great outdoor views. But honestly, I loved La Pedrera. It's centrally located, easily accessed from the subway, and has great 360 degree views from the roof--which is also populated by Gaudi's amazing chimneys, which are worth the price of admission alone.However, if you, like me, hate people in your travel photos, I would suggest that you get the very first entrance of the day, skip the intro in the courtyard and run--don't walk--to the top for people-free views. Because, as I discovered first hand, the roof is swamped with people pretty much all day, which means if you want any sweeping panoramas of the roof you will have to position yourself and have a lot of patience for the patch you've chosen to clear. That said, having people in your photos is actually useful for perspective/scale in this case--not that that made me happier about them being there.

The essence of Gaudi. For us, La Pedrera was the most interesting of all of Gaudi's work in Barcelona. While his cathedral is astonishing, it is at La Pedrera that you will see up close Gaudi's attention to detail (for instance in the door knobs), the impressive engineering in the roof support structures and the artistic vision that turned chimneys into works of sculpture. An entry ticket also gets you into one of the apartments for a look at interiors of that era. By all means get your tickets on line in advance.

All about the roof. I was a little disappointed in this to be honest, perhaps my expectations were higher based on all the other attractions that Barcelona has to offer and I fell after spending time marvelling at the extraordinary roof there was a lot of 'filler' to follow.don't get me wrong, the floor beneath the roof is interesting and the Gaudi object and museum pieces are reasonably interesting it's just that I had higher expectations.Relatively speaking, I felt that the entrance fee is a little expensive - Visit Casa Batilo instead.

Great way to explore Gaudi's work.. A beautiful and well maintained masterpiece. This is a must see! The audio tour is great and useful. The whole exhibit is informative and really helps you understand Gaudi's work. Incredible experience.

Definitely worth a visit. La Pedrera offers a very cool self-guided tour with interesting information about Gaudi and the history of the building. The roof is awesome, with beautiful views of the city. They have models of apartments from the building's inception, and a nice gift shop at the end where you can get photos with a La Pedrera backdrop.

Wow. Wow, what a building!!! You can`t imagine what it is like until you are inside and seeing its wonders for yourself. I wish I had more time to explore Gaudi`s works in detail as his architecture and creativity are beyond compare. This is a must see while in Barcelona.

Interesting. Very nice and interesting. The tour doesn't include the entire house because it is still lived in. I liked more Casa Batllo but Casa Mila is also nice and different. Get the audio guide and make sure to go to the gift shop (you can enter even if you didn't booked the tour).

Another Gaudi Masterpiece. Another of Gaudi's masterpieces. This is on the high end shopping street called Passeig de Gracia and easily recognisable. The building looks stunning because of its unique balconies. We did not see it from inside but must be worth it.

My favorite Gaudi building. I liked this the best of all the sites we visited due to it's forward thinking design and features. We took the night time tour with ended with an interesting light show on the roof. Not sure what Gaudi would have thought of it, but it was enjoyable jus the same. The view of the city form the roof is also beautiful. To be able to stroll through the apartment that was over 100 years old, but so up to date and amazing.

What a great place and certainly worth a visit. Another Gaudi masterpiece worth the entry fee. We enjoyed a coupe of hours walking through this building, admiring the architecture, design and views from the amazing roof top terrace which is definitely the best part.

Nice but not great. We took an evening tour of LaPedrera. It starts out in the entryway with an introduction by somebody standing on the stairs with the worst public address system ever. It sounds like a tin can to start with and then it echoes. The tour was interesting and ends on the roof with a light show. It's kind of scary walking along the edge of the roof, but I did ok and I am afraid of heights. There was wine and snacks when we went back downstairs but the first group got there first and it was pretty much over when our group arrived.

A Gaudi house worth seeing. The facade, the inner courtyards,the roof top chimney and walk round, the videos about his work and the apartment with his style of decor all very worth seeing, especially the examples from nature that inspired his creations - skeletons,pinecones, corn on the cob etc.

Amazing Gaudi creation. Incredible to see this apartment building showcasing the brilliancy of Gaudi and his architecture. Make sure to hire a guide so you can appreciate all there is to this wonderful place.

Great architecture, skip the tour.. Fascinating Gaudi building. The exterior is worth gazing at, but the evening tour of the inside was over-priced for what it delivered. Mostly we saw the attic, and the rooftop. The rooftop is extraordinary with huge sculptural figures reminiscent of chess pieces. But there was a 20-minute light show projected onto them, supposedly evoking the spirit of the natural world that Gaudi espoused. The phrase"gilding the lily" comes to mind. The show was lame, unimaginative, added nothing, and really diminished Gaudi's great work. Worth a visit, but don't waste your money on the evening tour.

La Pedrera. Very interesting Gaudi site. We visited with a guide and this enhanced our visit immensely. Also, our guide (Sandra Benzal Vert) was able to get tickets for us on the spot and we were able to bypass the long line of people waiting for the elevator to ascend to the apartments. Allow approximately 20-30 minutes (longer if you will need to wait for the elevator)
Amazing Architecture. Not a fan of architecture but fell in love with the work of Gaudi in Barcelona and the outside and roof of this building is amazing.

Wow.... First time visit. Although busy the queue moved quite quickly - a top tip would be to purchase tickets online to enter in the fast lane. We visited on a clear sunny day and the views from the roof over the city were breathtaking. Interiors are so interesting and the exhibits about the architecture in the attic were really informative. What an amazing building - we wonder if town planners these days would allow such a build - perhaps a lesson here for far-sighted planners as La Pedrera is now deemed of international importance! Visitors shop was excellent and attached restaurant with outside seating too just right for refreshments.

Unlike anything I've seen. I wasn't wowed by the apartment, but the rooftop is unlike anything I've ever seen. I was fascinated by the juxtaposition of Gaudi's fantastical imagination and the city of Barcelona--particularly a modern-day "block of discord" across the street, including the Hugo Boss store wrapped in ribbons of steel. We really struggled with scheduling a day and time to visit in advance, because the rooftop experience would've been terrible in the rain (we went in September, and before we left the US, rain was forecast daily). But we didn't want to stand on line or risk not getting in during our visit, so to give ourselves more flexibility in case of poor weather, we bought the "anytime" tickets for an upcharge, In retrospect, it was probably unnecessary, since most days had perfect weather, but the upgrade does mean that you don't wait at all--you don't queue for tickets or audioguides, and you go up in a designated elevator. It was a bit of a bonus, since we got to the roof before the crowds arrived, but I'm not sure I'd upgrade again for a shoulder-season visit.

An architectural gem. Everything about it was so typical Catalonian.The exterior details, the wild use of different shapes and sizes, the array of colors,etc. all combined and it worked well.We purchased tickets online and walked right in. We examined the lobby area and then we took the flit to the roof.You can look down into the atrium center of the building to appreciate the architectural innovation of this incredible mixed use building with residences and offices mixed in discreetly.You can also examine the different roof lines and spheres,turrets, and other unique rendering of the roof lines. The panorama of the city is majestic from this vantage point.I intend to blow up some of the photos and frame them. This place is a gem.

Lovely but not good value. A beautiful Gaudi apartment block. The rooftop is an incredible walk through a Dr Seuss landscape. The only other accessible part of the building is one of the apartments decorated in period style. I'd give this a higher rating if not for the €20.50 ticket price. It's too high for what you get to see. Palau Guell, at €12 is more spectacular and entirely accessible.

Don't Miss Gaudy's Casa Mila. Gaudy's La Pedrea is well worth the visit. For a small extra fee you can go to the front of the line to get in. It' well worth it. Very well done historic building with good audio guides and exhibits on the top floor.

Interesting visit to another of Gaudi's works of art. Interesting to see but the ticket purchase process was extremely slow and disorganized. The apartment was well preserved - beautiful floors, wide doors with light transoms above to let the natural light shine in and one of the most interesting things was the door handle that Gaudi designed to fit the shape of a hand perfectly by grasping clay and using that as a mold.
Do not miss this - get tickets on line. Get your ticket on line -the queues are very long but don't bother with the premium. The roof and front is amazing and not to be missed - a definite must see

Gaudis Apartment Buildingsd. Actual travel 4/2013. In Exempli area, this is an apartment building in which Gaudi designed magical figures. A must see..dont miss the park or the old hospital grounds that were being renovated and other work of Antoni Gaudi is seen in the famous Sagrada Familia. .
Must see. Allow plenty of time for the visit (2-3 hours) to quietly go overr all the details of this Gaudí's masterpiece. He surely was well ahead of his time.

Another stunning Gaudi showcase!. You can't visit Barcelona without visiting at least some of Gaudi's places. This one is something he designed as a beautiful apartment building. The guy was a genius!

Not so interesting from the outside. I saw this building from the outside and it was ok, nothing more. The entrance to the roof (it looked amazing on the photos) was not free, I think the roof is the most interesting part of Casa Milà.
Impressive hotel. They told us the story of how it used to be a palace and in time they decided to convert it into a hotel. Again, awesoem architecture by the very famous artist ;)

Another of Gaudi's masterpieces. Another of Gaudi's masterpieces which is a must see. Gothic inspired, elaborate iron work on the frontage. Within walking distance of his own home which is open to the public. Also check out La Sagrada Familia and Parc Guell. We did this all by taking the Big Red bus tour. Which is a great way to see all the places of interest and you can hope on and off as many times as you like. Each bus comes every 15 minutes of course depending on traffic

La Pedrera. A World Heritage site by UNESCO in 1984 , was the last civil work by Antoni Gaudi, built between 1906-1910 for a family, this eight floor apartment block is around two circular courtyards.There is a museum in the attic space. The appartment we had access to was furnished. You also get access to the roof space, there are sculptured ducts and chimneys, in medieval, renaissance and gothic style architecture.It is wise to book your tickets on line. We paid 36.90 euro for 2 people.We very much enjoyed our visit to La Pedrera.
Gaudi highlight. We used a small group guide service to take visit various Gaudi locations. La Pedrera was a highlight. We enjoyed the rooftop views as well as the attic museum.

Fascinating and beautiful. This is a wonder to behold. It's structure is fascinating and unusual. Loved the curves and waves of the building and the mysterious chimneys and towers on the roof. We visited both during the day and again at night for a light show on the roof which was amazing; definitely worth going back for. This place is a must see after Sagrada Familia if you're in Barcelona.

Amazing. Gaudi was genius! Even though my taste do not fully appreciate "modernista" I was in awe of Gaudi's creativity in designing this building.  We were able to go to the head of the line and not wait in the long line that went around 1/2 a block or more ( Tip--like most places, either book your tickets on line before you leave your country---or at your hotel when you arrive in Barcelona) I had not been feeling well and had a little vertigo at the top of the building, once on the next level was fine and able to enjoy the rest of the exhibit. Amazing how Gaudi' mind worked with angles and spaces.  We took the bus from Sant station and had no problem getting to La Pedrera. Very easy town in which to use public transportation.

Beautiful but expensive. Fantastic Gaudi architecture, very interesting concepts, time well spent for sure. But it gets very crowded & at 21 euro/ per person regular & 27 euro to skip the long lines, it's definitely an expensive sight (hence the Average rating). If you plan to go anyway, definitely book ahead online (to skip the lines) and plan to spend a good 2-2.5 hrs. Go early to beat the crowds. Great location on Passeo de Gracia with all of the other stores. Look around for some great gothis architecture on a lot of the neighboring random buildings and the ornate street lamp posts.
Casa Mila!. Definitely get skip the line tickets.. you want to take all that extra time to look at the amazing terrace views and interiors of this architectural gem.

A glimpse into the past private lives and architecture on the nouveau riche. Well worth your time and money. Be sure and see the apartment which is furnished in the period. If it is raining they close the roof top

You Have to Be a Gaudi Fan. I'm afraid I did not share the enthusiasm that others found for this place. The tour takes you almost immediately to the roof and there you see his unique architectural style in hiss treatment of the chimneys. To be honest I enjoyed the views of the Sagrada in the distance and the beautiful rooftop terraces found on adjoining apartments. The rooms of the residence were very crowded and I passed them by. The attic displays were far more interesting and you learned a great deal about his architectural ideas and engineering strategies. sorry Gaudi fans but I could have passed this by.

Displays the Engineering Genius of Gaudi in a Quirky Bldg. One can hardly believe the genius of Gaudi as seen in this building. The outside and the roof with its sculptures to hide chimneys and ducts are quirky and fun. The construction details in the attic area are fascinating and pure genius. The apartment that one can visit is lovely, with good flow and lightness. We both loved our tour of this Modernista building.

Slight letdown after Casa Batllo. Dont get me wrong, the roof was amazing. But rest of the building was less impressive than Casa Batllo. We came here right after Casa Batllo and thought it was a let down besides the roof top.It is interesting that people still live in this building. Still an impressive piece of architecture and design. If you only have time for one, do the Batllo, else do both,

Catenary. This is another amazing building by Gaudi. Book ahead to avoid queues. The roof is unlike anything you will have seen, and the attic space (which is huge) contains lots of fascinating constructional information.

Must visit!!. A beautiful building -masterpiece of architecture! With your ticket you get a free audio guide which is really cool, cause you get all the information you need to know for Gaudi and his work.
Beautiful building. Worth a visit, even if just from the outside. The inside is cool but not super special if you don't have enough time to visit properly.
Must see. All gaudi 'a buildings are different, seeing one is not seeing all. The concept may be the same, but each are unique to discover. The roof of pedrera was amazing
Amazing Barcelona.. What a beautiful city.. You need at least to be there a week to visit all the attraction. Will definitely be back to visit ..2 days was not enough
another Gaudi masterpiece.. This is Gaudi's typical architectural, yet it's a residential condominium & retail stores complex in the middle of the city.
Gaudi brilliance. Another superb Gaudi style house with its undulating walls and balcony. We saw it from the outside as part of the bus tour. Its certainly a photo stop.

Do not miss it. La pedrera is situated on Passeig de Gracia,not very distant from Casa Batllo.The ticket costs 20.50 euros and you also get a free audio guide.I really enjoyed my visit there,it is impressive and you almost cannot find a regular surface in this house.The tour lasts about 2 hours and the best part is surely the roof.From there you can see a big part of Barcelona.The strange thing is that people still live there so when you visit it you just pass among them.Great.A must stop.

Overrated. All the leaflets tell you to visit this house.Oddly enough most of it is actually closed to tourists because it is used as offices or living spaces. The tour will take about an hour and a half if you're not in a hurry.You'll visit the roof and attic which in my opinion are the highlight of the house.You'll also visit one of the apartments. Compared to other marvels that Gaudi designed this building and its living quarters are boring and dull. The roof is interesting and can provide a lot of cool photos IF there were a lot less tourists.
Loved the Concept. We had a guide explain about La Pedrera and then left on our own to explore !!! The concept is unusual and the view from roof top a must see !!!!

Not quite as good as Batllo but still very good.. Fascinating but not quite as good as the Batllo. If I had to choose only one to would be Batllo.The building is beautiful and the concepts he developed are striking. The roof is a piece of art in itself. Overall the tour is long and interesting but perhaps because the main apartment is not in show it misses something. A large exhibition in the attic on Gaudi's buildings and style, a fair bit of which is stuff you will have seen if you have visited his other houses and the Sagrada. Expensive. We only saw 3 Gaudi buildings so hard to say of this would be worth it if we had also seen for example the palacio and park Guell.

Very enjoyable visit!. It's a good ideea to buy tickets in advance because the queues could be a bit long during high season. The ticket is 20.50 euros. You can visit some of the rooms not all because people still work and live in this building. For me the most impresive was the roof, the view from there is nice and the chimneys are incredible. You could spend around 2 hours visiting it.
