Gaudi's penultimate masterpiece.. Book online it's cheaper and you get to avoid the long queues . Well worth seeing as the inside is still furnished as it was in the early 1900's. Would recommend the night tour as the lighting effects are spectacular.

A Very Enjoyable Visit. La Pedrera's brochure advises people who did not buy tickets online in advance to go first thing in the morning or after 4 PM. This is very good advice. We arrived about 5 and found only about 6 people ahead of us.Yes, it's expensive, and there is no senior discount (I would have rated it 5 stars if the price was not so high). But we felt it was well worth it, and we were glad to be able to wander around on our own. In fact, I would say that we enjoyed it more than Sagarada Familia because you get to see Gaudi's work close up. The roof is amazing! The displays in the attic are also very interesting. This was the first of Gaudi's buildings that we visited, and it gives a very good view of his life and work (don't skip the video presentation), as well as some of the technical details of the architecture. The interior of the apartment gives a good view of how a wealthy family would have lived when the house was built. Very worthwhile.
Gaudi Must. A Gaudi must - kid friendly with only small lines. Get there early to avoid the lines or book online prior. Easy to get to with public transport. Not too $$

A Night time Show to Surprise. I chose to see La Pedrera at night as they have a night show on the roof that is incredible. The show is displayed on the amazing roof top art statues and beautifully design chimney stacks. The movie show was very organic and shared the stories and thinking of Gaudi. It was a new way of experiencing art and architecture. The night show is highly recommeded.
Most famous corner of Passeig de Gracia. Gaudi`s residential building illustrates the architect´s articulate dialogue with nature and the built form

Make the time to visit. Absolutely stunning Gaudi architecture. A must visit even though the queues might be long. The rooftop views were amazing. It's hard to believe that an apartment can be so opulent.
Another unique place. This is yet another great place to see Gaudi's works of unique architecture. Great little museum in side with unique furniture designed by Gaudi.

Stunning building with an interesting interior. It is well with booking online in advance to skip the long queues to enter this building. The exterior is beautiful and the inside is so well preserved and interesting.
See only from outside. Casa batlo better if ur interested in seeing gothi art. Overpriced ticket. No need to pay extra for VIP entry. Can be visited if there is real interest in seeing architect
Fabulous tour!. This building, right in the middle of town, is so interesting!! We went in the evening and really enjoyed everything about it!

Fantastic Gaudi Architecture. This is a must see attraction and worth every euro, even though the rooftop terrace was closed due to the inclement weather which made it slippery and too dangerous to open to the public.The rest is very well laid out and the audio guide is superb

Architecture before its time. Yes, this isn't the most gaudy Gaudi; it's not as flashy as the two residential homes Guell Palace or Casa Batllo. But what is astonishing is that this was effectively a commercial property development of a high rise apartment building. There are of course lot's of nice artistic touches and interesting materials as you would expect from Gaudi, but for me the most interesting aspects was the architectural and technical solutions Gaudi came up with for such things as lighting and drainage from the roof. There seems to be a balance between cost and art here not observable elsewhere in Gaudi's work. Of course when you get out on the roof you can still see Gaudi cut loose with the chimneys and ventilation shafts offering an amazing landscape. As with all of Gaudi's major works you probably won't be disappointed - and as always buy your tickets on-line or at a tourism office. Why is it so many Spanish attractions don't seem to have got their ticketing and entry systems quite right? But a minor quibble for a great visit.

Most beautiful pictures taken here. You can't understand Gaudi without visiting this building. It is absolutely impressive and fantastic. His genius is so apparent there. And the roof terrace will take your breath away, genuinely...
The Mila House. Located at the corner , this is another one of Gaudi's masterpieces to engulf Barcelona. Advise to seek out a map and find this on foot !
Very interesting . Really enjoyed it here. Well worth a visit. Bit of a queue to get in but not too long. Some great photo opportunities. Nice tour of typical apartment.

Evening tour is exceptional. We elected to do the evening tour of La Pedrera that starts at about 21:00. You start inside and work your way through the building. Beautiful architecture by a brilliant mind. The end of the tour is on the terraced rooftops overlooking the city of Barcelona with a light show that show cases the beautiful architecture. At the end there is a glass of cava and a tapa to finish.

Completely mesmerizing.. This is another can't miss Gaudi building. Go early and take the elevator straight up to the roof. An amazing building and hard to imagine it being built so long ago. Would love to live there. I am a forever Gaudi fan now.

Good, not great, Gaudi. If comparing to plebeian architects, this is great. If compared to Gaudi, it is surpassed by many. But not the rooftop. That is Gaudi at his best.We arrived in the afternoon and there was a twenty minute line. Inside was crowded and felt like it. The roof was crowded but did not feel so.This is an occupied apartment building so you are restricted to touring the attic, one large apartment and the rooftop. Gaudi elements are easy to pick out but they lack they wow factor of some of his others. But not the rooftop. The sense of space, the tile work, the mini spires, all classic and inspiring Gaudi. I loved the view from many angles.Highly recommended but lower priority than some of his work.

Worth the visit. Yes this entrance fee is steep but it's worth it. Definitely should purchase tickets online as there is a separate line. We did not have to que in line at all. Overall, the apartments were very interesting. The view from the rooftop was spectacular.
Must see. Lovely place, interesting stories. It's a bit overpriced but it's got to be done if you visit Barcelona.

The roof IS the view!!. Building designed and built by Gaudi at the height of his career. We spent over an hour on the roof enjoying the views and intricate design of the chimneys, one of the most iconic symbols in Barcelona. The balance of the tour takes you through an old apartment that was decorated in the time period of the early 1900s. Lines are long for tickets so check out buying online before you go.

Oooh Aahh La Padera!. One of Gaudi's many architectural gems. This was designed as an apartment store. Some retail units are located at ground floor level but the main building is preserved as a visitor centre. A must visit.

Astonishing design. Beautiful and out of the world design. The museum downstairs gave some great insight into Gaudí's inspirations and method. Apartment level was nicely furnished to present the lifestyle of that time period. Slightly crowded during the time I went. Hard to get a picture without tourists in the frame.

Night time tour with Origins show. We really liked our night tour of this Gaudi masterpiece with the light show on the roof. There were only a handful of us, it was a warm September clear night. I had no idea what the show would entail but it was really cool. Afterwards we were rewarded with champagne (cava) and pastries
Another Gaudi. This was one of Gaudi's Apartments. I would have liked to see the inside, but no time. This is one of the structures we saw as we walked down the Passeig de Gracia
A must see - Good overview of Gaudi's work. The building is interesting and the attic has several models of Gaudi's other structures. Get tickets online to avoid the line.
Not worth the price!. A museum to Gaudi. I don't care for museums. The roof top was very interesting. You can see a bit of Sagarda Familia in the distance.

The iconic roof top is not to be missed.. Another beautiful building by Gaudi. It is easily accessible via train and bus. The roof top is iconic of Barcelona with spectacular views.We spent a lot of time in the chocolate shop too!

A Gaudi Must-See!. The most unique apartment complex I've ever seen. Rounded, organic in design and the rooftop- city views and vent sculptures, didn't want to leave. Museum floor was very informative too!

Genius. Another great attraction in Barcelona. Gaudi truly had a vision way beyond anyone else. The apartment inside is surprisingly large considering the shape of the building, but once again the rooftop is where the real art is. Brilliant designs, and the audio guide explains them very well. A must see if you have a half day to spare.
REALLY REALLY INTERESTING. I loved it...and so fascinating...a residence in Gaudi style...adn the rooftop if sascinating as well...learn the genuis of the man...worth the fee for sure..

A truly extraordinary building!. An interesting overview of this beautiful building designed by Gaudi early in the 20th century. Very innovative design which even included elevators and an underground garage! The rooftop terrace which one can access on the tour was the highlight to me with its unusual ornamentation and magnificent views of the city. The other tour areas are the attic below the terrace (which illustrates the structure Gaudi employed and includes several interesting exhibits) and an apartment furnished in the decor of that time.The admission price of 20.50 euros is expensive, but, in my opinion, worth it. To avoid the long line to purchase tickets, I recommend buying online. We wanted to buy tickets for the following day, but normally one is only able to purchase tickets for that day when in person. After a lengthy process, we were finally able to buy tickets onsite for the following day, but it took much explanation as we were leaving the following afternoon and wanted to be sure we could get tickets for an acceptable time.

Amazing!. I paid $27 to avoid a line where I’d pay #20. The guys sell more expensive tix right in the entrance to this building. It was getting late so I decided to enter quicker.It is interesting to see it inside before taking an elevator to the roof. They give you an audio guide, which I liked. The rood is the best to see and take pictures. The rest is just ok. An attic had a couple of exhibits and was structurally interesting. Then you visit a flat, displaying stuff of that time, sort of a Heritage flat. There is a souvenir store on the ground floor. To admire the roof could be cheaper, but there was a line of curious people.

Roof and attic is worth the trip. The architecture of the roof and attic is great and makes it worth the visit. In the attic, you also learn about his artistic style and some of his other work which was very interesting. I was a bit underwhelmed by the apartment at the end, but was still glad we went.
Very interesting architecture. We had a tour of La Pedrera today. It is a very unusual and interesting piece of Gaudi architecture. Well worth visiting if you have the time while in Barcelona.
nice but only from outside. I didn't enter the inside of the building. But the outside of it is very nice. I am not sure whether it is worth to enter the inside and pay for it.

Gaudi created an amazing "house". When we visited this beautiful building we were not expecting the beauty of it all. From the moment we stepped inside we were amazed at the odd yet amazing beauty of it all. Once you reach the roof you will also be surprised by the towers and the view, as you can see the Sagrada Familia Basilica from there.Worth the money, but make sure you get the tickets early or you'll be on a long line waiting to get in.

Amazing Construction. Not until you walk around the roof - climbing up and down steps - do you have a full appreciation for the architecture. Gaudi's architecture is amazingly intricate in subtle way. The displays in the attic really help to understand how he worked. It is a major tourist destination, but still worth the effort.

Fabulous Building But Pricey. The exterior really is fabulous and a must-see whilst in Barcelona. Inside the building there are only a couple of the upper floors to which the public have access, the attic and the apartment. The rooftop with Gaudi's famous chimneys was fantastic to see along with the city views. Unfortunately though whilst taking in the views to one side on the rooftop I was rudely asked to move by one of their own guides so that he could stand where I was to speak to his group! Overall I think the whole experience was over priced and could have been better. There is an awful lot of music on the audio and I think there should have been more detail available.

Artistic design . The place is cool specially the roof. Other part wasn't that much interesting. The amazing part was, in some floors people are living! It should be preserved from ruining rather living there.

Must see for those interested in architure. I couldn't have imagined the innovative architectural genius of Anton Gaudi until seeing his modernists masterpiece. Well worth the 20.50 Euro online ticket price. Buy your tickets online to reserve a time and avoid the onsite lines. The roof is spectacular. The attic is fun and informative. The visit to the apartment is a nice glimpse into early 20th century Barcelona.

Nice but limited. Most of the floors are in use so tour is limited to roof, attic, and one floor. Roof is very nice and maybe more during night, but I did not do night tour. Attic has Gaudi exhibition but not as thorough as on in the Gaudi exhibition center. After visiting the Casa Battlo this was not so exciting design as that. All in all very good but not great. Still I would visit it but I am a Gaudi fan.

I love Gaudi and everything Art Nouveau, but this seems to be just ok. (A March 2014 visit actually)It's located near our hostel, Generator Hostel, so that's one good point- walking distance from a lodging house. Me and my friends didn't quite realize that this was an attraction, maybe because when we came in, there weren't any queues. If you want to avoid queues, make sure you arrive around 10-11am ish.I like the souvenir shop very much! It opens even if Casa Mila is closed already, and sells many nice books and other stuffs. I can remember this book about Steampunk but opted to not buy, afraid it'll weigh too heavy on my luggage.Overall: The insides are pretty so-so to me. The nice part is when you're on the rooftop, see the warriors' faces, see Barcelona from above, and take pictures! Teehee. The museum part houses the miniature Casa Mila (a model), lots of bronze metal sculptures and furnitures, and some history.I love Gaudi, but this place is pretty average to me. I'd rather spend money on Sagrada Familia, but by paying the entry fee, you'll be supporting this place so it won't cease :) However, if you're only staying here for one day, I don't think this should be one of your to-go destinations. If you have more time and also extra money to spend, go ahead and see this magnificent of an architecture!

The evening tour is very disappointing and not for those who are not relatively fit. We attended the evening tour and it was extremely disappointing. The only part of the property open to visitors is the entrance, which is, in fact, lovely, the attic, which is just an brick clad attic with some architectural models, and the rooftop. Twenty minutes of the tour is devoted to a "light show" with dramatic music, during which colored lights are projected onto the structures on the roof. Be warned, this tour requires the visitors climb 7 flights of stairs to the attic, and then more to the rooftop. There is a small capacity elevator, but most of the people in our tour had to walk, without regard to age or fitness. The roof has many steps of varying levels and it is not well lit, so if you are not fit and agile, this is not the tour for you. The other Gaudi monuments are far more beautiful and interesting to visit than this one.

See Gauid's Genuis. La Pedrera is one expression of Gauid's genius in architecture. No doubt this is a very unique and beautiful apartment house and worth seeing even from the outside if you want to experience something new.

Cool rooftop!. I don't think it really matters which order you see Gaudi's architecture. We saw Sagrada Familia first, then La Pedrera, then Casa Batllo. We got the audioguide at La Pedrera. There isn't much inside the building because there are now offices and residential apartments there. However, you can walk on the rooftop as long as you would like and listen the idea behind buildling such unusual rooftop. There is some more interesting stuff on display right under the roof (sort of in the attic). Of course, beautiful views of the city from the top! If I were to choose which of the two houses to visit, I'd probably choose Casa Batllo b/c I liked the virtual 3D tour over there, but it's my personal opinion.

Was a view from the outside enough? You decide.. I was shocked to see the price they were charging to visit this iconic apartment building in Barcelona ... E37.50! That's well over USD 40. Needless to say I skipped it, fully well knowing that I probably wouldn't have another chance to visit it. I figured pictures of the interiors would suffice. It's a shame. I did buy a couple of souvenirs at their gift shop ...

Night tour. We did a combined day and night visit. The day tour includes the Gaudi apartment which is interesting to see. The night tour has a light show at the end which is good. If you do a combined ticjet I woukd probably leave the middle dloor out when I do the day tour as a lot of this gets repeated with the night tour which is anguided tour. Try Pau Claris for dinner afterwards!
Gaudi Experience.. Great experience, but, make sure to get the audio tour, otherwise you won't understand what Gaudi was thinking .Beautiful and very unique...
Interesting Visit. Turned out to be a worthwhile visit. Audio tour and graphic displays about architect Gaudi and how he engineered the building

Visit here before La Sagrada Familia. Definitely take the tour of La Pedrera in Barcelona's Eixample neighborhood. And definitely visit here before proceeding to La Sagrada Familia. Both are Gaudi creations, but the apartment house La Pedrera is more manageable in scope. It is an excellent introduction to Gaudi, his methods, his proclivities, his style. Definitely spend the extra few euros for an audioguide. You will get so much more out of the experience.
Must see!. Roof top was amazing, great views of the city. Bit of a queue for the lift to the top but well worth it. Information on Gaudi's life was very interesting.

A must see in Barcelona!. We were doing a walking tour of the Eixample neighborhood and took the tour of La Pedrera. It's a great example of Gaudi's architecture and brilliance. Definitely get the audiotour - it adds quite a bit to the experience. I would recommend going here first, before Sagrada Familia, as they really go through how he came up with his ideas and plans for these beautiful buildings. In the attic area, they show how he uses nature and would hang chains to help develop the arches in his designs (you will see them in a mirror). The roof is beautiful, but don't miss any floors!

Gaudi has some incredible work to see and Casa Mila is one of them. Casa Mila and the other Gaudi works are incredible. You just wonder where his mind was when he created this place. Very bizarre and amazing place to see.
Great visit. Went through the building in the late afternoon and theire were no waiting lines. If you are into architecture or just all things Gaudi, it's certainly a place worth seeing.

One of beautiful pieces of architecture in Barcelona. La Pedrera is located in a short walking distance from the other modernist buildings in Barcelona, it is perfectly fine to visit only one of them, unless you are an architectural specialist or student. There is a cafe located inside the building, best time to visit early morning late afternoon - opened long hours.
Stunning Building. We had a brief stop here, on a private tour, so only had the opportunity to take photos from the outside, however it was still a lovely building to see in a nice part of Barcelona

Wish I lived Here!. The apartment, open to public view, makes you want to move in instantly! And the rooftop, with its futuristic chimney pots disguised as Dr Who characters, offers views to La Sagrada Familia, Parc Guell, TibiDabo, and the wonders of Passeig de Gracia. The bookshop is carefully arranged, and offers a nice selection of Gaudi inspired trinkets and books. The building itself is gorgeous. Pity there aren't more like this!

A Gaudi masterpiece. Not easy to pick one of Gaudis Barcelona masterpieces which is better than another- combined they show the diversity of his Works. Casa Mila was facinating and didn't take ages to go through either, a couple of hours is plenty. Central and lots of special details that are well explained in posters and audiotur. After Park Guell, Casa Mila and Sagrada F. it is impossible to not be a HUGE Gaudi fan!
Another Gaudi masterpiece. A beautiful example of the unique style of Gaudi's architecture, and it looks especially good at night.

Famous chimney's. You can use a discount voucher from Bus Turistica. Maybe worth visiting before you go to Casa Batllo, to see the progression. The roof and chimneys are the main attraction here. Great view of Barcelona.

Interesting and beautiful building by Gaudi. We did not enter many buildings and places on our stay in Barcelona, and we did not enter Casa Mila. But the sheer sight from the outside was enough to be awed, as was many of Gaudis buildings. Just walking around and watchning these magnificent structures is a pleasure for both people who are interested in buldings and history and people who are not.
good!. Very very nice casa! But if you want to visit casa Mila and casa Batlio, visit casa Mila first. Very nice view from the rooftop! love this place
A must-see!. This was a must-see in Barcelona and it didn't disappoint. My favorite was the curving rooftop with modern-art chimneys. I love this otherworldly rooftop! The view of

A Must. We're not much for museums, but this was special. It showed so much of Gaudi's mid-career work, it was incredible. Audio tour takes 90 minutes, if you hit all the stops.Online descriptions are better than anything I can say.

Distinctive Architecture. After a visit to Casa Mia and Park Guell - you will never forget Gaudi's distinctive style. At Casa Mia we visited the rooftop terrace, the attic and an apartment which displayed Gaudi's genius as an architect and his uniqueness - as his style is unlike any other. I definitely recommend visiting this as part of a guided tour. We had a private guide and he was able to provide valuable information and navigate us through this attraction.

Enjoying the city view from the roof. We did the day and night tour. It was more expensive than I was expecting but after the night show, I felt that it was worth it. The building is amazing as expected, and the display in the attic really showed how Gaudi worked better than the other sites we went to.

Gaudi here again !. A must see ....This will complete your Gaudi experience. Also great views over the city.Great to see how the upper class lived in those days....beautiful apartments and the roof experience is amazing.
A must see. One of his finest works. I really don't think the trip would have been the same without seeing some of the amazing architecture.

Impressive roof terrace. La Pedrera definitely has the wow factor with the roof, which you can also see at night for a premium. If you are interested in Gaudi's architecture this tour shows you not only the making of La Pedrera but also the Sagrada Familia and Park Guell and Palau Guell. More educational for his works as a whole, but not as visually stunning as Casa Batllo.

A UNESCO World Heritage site, Do not miss it!!!. When Gaudi was only 54 years of age he created this amazing wave of nature and architecture. He was at the height of his career. This is the building, you see on Passig de Gracia, one of the busy main streets in Barcelona. We highly recommend ordering your tickets OnLine to avoid the lines that begin early and go on into the night.The outside of this is no comparison to what you will see inside. The audio set was extremely helpful for us and recommended.There are NO right angles in this structure, try to imagine a building constructed with no right angles! Combining GaudiS love of Nature and of creating new and unusual structures,this is the one to see. Do not miss the rooftop of this building.When you go earlier you have a better opportunity for photographs, less bodies in the way.there is really no fair way to describe this building.Just Go See It!

A must. Not far from several similar Gaudi wonders, this is one not to miss. Completely mad house and yet scarily wonderful. I would like to live there. Look at the turrets that inspired George Lucas for the Startrooper helmets..
Must see Gaudi Building. Insane or genious architecture, but definitely something to see. Gaudi is unlike any architect you'll ever see, with his whimsical ideas.

Try Jazz on the Roof. An amazing building by Gaudi. Visited during the day and then came back at night fora jazz concert on the roof of the building. Definitely try to get tickets for the jazz concert. Building at night is so much different than during the day. Concert was great. You are just down the street from Casa Battlo so you can easily do both in an afternoon but be sure to get advance tickets.
Must see. One of Gaudi's master pieces. Very good to visit, and get to know how life was on last century. It's amazing to understand the techniques used to build these places.
different. I only saw it from the outside but it looked very interesting. They were charging alot to go inside so decided not to.

Brilliant Gaudi experience with amazing BCN views!. You can't go wrong with Gaudi really?! This is yet another example of his exceptional vision and mastery. It is a unique building but what makes it truly unique are the rooftop structures that will make you feel like Alice in Wonderland. While there is a museum on top that displays furniture and plans it is really the rooftop that shines. If you can see it while there is a rooftop concert (mostly in summer) you will really enjoy this venue even more. In general sunset hours are best views and less crowded.

Well worth a visit. Amazing. Buy your tix on line, and book to go early. The queue, even for those with tix, was already long and they only allow so many in at a time. We booked for 9am. A bit of confusion at the start as to which line was which, and where the entry actually is (entry is not marked, look for the glass doors where you can see the cash registers and audio guides inside).First stop is the roof top (lots of stairs, but there is lift access if you ask). Views are fantastic, then work your way down eventually in to one of the apartments. Just magic. Beautiful.
Gauid must see!. A Gaudi master piece not to be missed, Guided tours will take you about 1-2 hours to enjoy, lovely rooftop views.

Nicer looking outside than inside. IT looks fantastic on the outside, and the view from the roof is nice. But that's about it. You see a nice (but not so special) apartment on the inside. In retrospect not worth the wait in line or the cost of the ticket.
Too expensive to enter!. This Gaudi-home is wonderful and truly 'timeless Modernism'. But they charge a hefty EUR 320 (or so) - just to visit the house! Which I found quite ridiculous...

Just go there!. Barcelona actually can be filed in a best way through the artworks of Gaudi. This amazing architect has a brilliant mind and talent. If you want to feel Barcelona, the modernism, the reason why this city is so different and have its own spirit, you should visit some projects done by him. La Pedrera , casa Ballio are remarkable examples to understand the atmosphere in the earliest 20 in Barcelona. The rooftop should be visited, as well as the apartments – very well organized. Better take online tickets despite that the lines for tickets are not huge, but is nice to avoid them.

Fantasic. We arrived here off the Hop on Hop off bus and there was quite a queue waiting. They have signs along the queue with a QR code to connect to their website to buy tickets online, so we did that, and went straight to the head of the queue! So easy! We were given audio guides which were great as you can do them at your own pace, or press the numbers again if you want to hear it again. Gaudi never did anything ordinary, there are surprises all through the building, and especially when you get to the roof. I recommend you visit, Gaudi's buildings are fascinating.

Just stumbled upon it while walking. This is a great piece of architecture. If you have the time to visit this is highly recommended. For those running short of time, forego going in for a tour and just walk by to appreciate the building from the outside. You can get great pictures from the front of the building and across the street from it.

Amazing Barcelona ,learning from nature. One of the best works of Gaudi that's a must see in Barcelona.There you can book a night tour which begins at 8'clock pm.The rooftop with it's chimneys are amazing and the tour guide will explain about Gaudies inventions in his apartment which is very exciting plus hologram projections about the life of that time was wonderful.
Casa Mila at night. Visit during night time - a totally different feel. It adds a totally different dimension to your visit.

Amazing art work. I love the architecture by Gaudi, this is one of his finest pieces of art. The story behind the curvy construction of the front building, the inside of the apartments and the terrace, just amazing. Great architect.

Amazing light show. La pedrera is definitely worth visiting, the light show on the rooftop was great and really brought together the influence of nature on gaudi's work. The tour guide wasn't great repeated herself a lot but the house is amazing. The design and attic is great to see. Re light show lets you see over Barcelona and mount tibidabo in the distance. Would definitely recommend and finishes with a glass of cava.

Gaudi was way ahead of his time!. If your interested in old buildings or an architect this building is a must to see. Our private tour guide took us through the entire building and roof top. The unique chimneys used on this apartment are very interesting and make for some great photography shots! Plus great views of the city from the roof top exposure.
A place not to miss. Gaudi, what a legacy, this building is sensational. The rooftop is an experience in itself and the apartments are so atmospheric.

Gaudi must see, especially if evening concert. We felt the highlight of the building was the roof which is an amazing experience at night. We attended a jazz trio concert held there which made it all the better. Tickets for La Pedrera, as well as other Gaudi venues, should be purchased online ahead of time.
Gaudimiongous. Another spectacular example of Gaudis work, not as great as casa battlo but still an amazing building and worth a visit

Beautiful Modernist House by Gaudi. I had heard of Gaudi but never visited Barcelona. Visiting this house was alone worth the trip to Barcelona. The complexity of the structure is amazing. You will be able to see model showing how the house was designed to support the tremendous weight of the structure. Don't miss this house. Be sure to reserve on line well in advance.

Nice building, tickets are expensive. Tip: buy your tickets online to avoid the queues at the ticket office.They let people up in waves to manage the influx of tourists and we have found this is the norm for every attraction. I recommend plan your days before arriving to these attractions me where possible make an online booking to avoid disappointment.This is a magnificent building, the structure and architecture that has gone in to this was amazing.The roof top view is nice, unfortunately around Barcelona at the moment there are heavy construction work so at every angle you'll see a crane in the background.There is a lift that only goes up and you'll have to walk down, which brings you through the attic museum and a museum of an original flat dating back over 100 years again.The cost of one ticket is 20.50€ for per adult. Online it's 19.50€ per adult.
Gaudi at it's best!. Beautiful Gaudi home! Loved all the detail and excellent gift shop. So much to see and very well organized.
Wonderful tour. Amazing terrace, the rooms restoration is impressive. Amazing facade from the outside, but even better inside.
Family Weekend Get away.. This is beautiful just to see all of Gaudi's work. We did not go inside, but it was overall amazing.

Worth Visiting. This attraction is a great example of the work of Gaudi. The roof top is very interesting, if a bit scary for those of us a little afraid of heights. Definitely worth the price of admission.

Nice one. Must see
Unique in its own kind..
I had never seen things of that kind ever before.
Worth visiting..
😃😃😃😃😉

Make sure you go upstairs to the roof!!. Typical, incredible Gaudi architecture & design. The views from the roof - and the chimneys - are impressive. Then you go down a level to the attic, then down again to see what a wealthy family's apartment quarters would look like. All the while - there are people currently living in other parts of the building.

Overly hyped Night show not worth the money. The night show is not worth the extra money. Save yourself the money and just visit the house during the day if you must. It's not that it's not impressive - it s. The roof is amazing as any of Gaudi's buildings as is the inside courtyard. But, it's not worth what you pay to visit this house. You don't get access to the individual flats and rooms because this is a private residence.

Stunning Building of many such. We made a particular effort to see this particular fabulous building, but there are many other beautiful buildings around it in an area of conspicuous affluence containing most of the famous fashion houses.

Worth doing day or night!. We recently visited La Pedrera and as this Gaudi building happened to be close to where we were staying, we decided to visit day and night. The architecture did not disappoint. Something to see every step of the way. I felt that we saw more of the interior of the apartment with the day tour, but, "the Origins" evening tour was even better! Less crowds and a more relaxed tour where you can ask questions and see the fabulous chimneys on the rooftop lit up with accompanying soundtrack. The evening tour also ends with a glass of cava. What an terrific experience!If I had to pick only one option, I'd choose the evening tour as it was a pretty magical experience. Definitely get tickets in advance to avoid long lines. Easy, no hassle.

ONE OF GAUDI's LAST PRIVATE ASSIGNMENTS. No straight lines! That is how I can describe this lovely house that Gaudi designed for a private owner. The intricate and colorful tile work is captivating. His attention to detail.

A Gaudí masterpiece!. La Pedrera is truly amazing! The design and the thought that went in to it is so impressive and it feels like it's playing with your mind. But as the tape recording tells you, Gaudí did nothing without a reason for doing it. The tour starts on the roof which with its chimneys and undulations is like nothing I had ever seen before. Then you walk through what is effectively the loft, and once again Gaudí play tricks with you. The tour finishes in the apartment, which was also very interesting as you can see how people had made this extraordinary building their home. A recorder with head phones is included in the price and it was very interesting and most educational to listen to. If you are in a hurry or have an aversion to queuing you can pay extra, €27 instead of €20, to fast track through a different entrance.All the staff were extremely helpful and could not do enough to make sure that you enjoyed your visit.
Don't miss seeing La Pedera. Yes, it really is very nice and not to be missed. Best to buy tickets in advance because queues can be very long.
Interesting in details. One of the master pieces of Gaudi, this place offers very interesting, nice, beauty, distinctive and intelligent details to observe.
Don't go if it rains. It was interesting attraction but it was raining that day and we were not able to see the rooftop. But it is a good idea to make attraction from a private house.

Informative but a bit crowded. This is quite an expensive place to visit and it would be more enjoyable if there were less people and more exhibits. The roof top and attic are both interesting in terms of views and explanations as to how Guadi worked and the apartment is well presented. ok but I wouldt return.

Gaudi is my hero. The flowing lines are spectacular. The chimneys are dramatic. The attic space is a design wonder: ribs of 80mm wide bricks in a catenary shape which appear quite inadequate to support the roof but in fact have managed it quite adequately for the last 100 years. The interior apartments also have novel design concepts and reflections of nature in both the flowing lines and use of fauna and flora motifs in the decoration.

Unusual achitecture, modern design Gaudi's way. A must see!. Like all of Gaudi's architecture, this hits high on the unique and unusual list. A must see while in Barcelona along with Gaudi's other buildings. This time, Gaudi went modern with his Catalan Art Nouveau (the stone quarry). This building has a unique, artistic appeal and combined with it's history it has received major recognition making the UNESCO World Heritage List in 1984, You would expect no less from Gaudi and his masterpieces, all very unique, and magnificent. Highly recommend seeing this along with all of Gaudi's other buildings, and of course his park - Guell. Book tickets online. You won't be disappointed.

Great to look at even if from outside. Barcelona is full of amazing architecture that I think it's important to go see even if you don't necessarily look inside. Casa Mila was too expensive for us to go into (I think around €20), so Palau Guell won out seeing as it was a lot less money. Still lovely to look at, Gaudi really was a true original.
Gaudi modernismo - La Pedrera. The famous Gaudi building. Very unique. Need to make reservations for the yours in advance. Offers a different view between day and night.
It's a must vist but allow an hour or two and take your time.. Amazing building - you go up on the roof of the apartment building and its a wonderful experience in itself.
One of Gaudi's examples. A place not to miss in Barcelona, impressive design and architecture by Gaudi. Book tickets online to skip queuing.

It's a "must see" but does it worth the money?. I visited La Pedrera twice within three years and I must say that I still didn't figure it out if it worth the money. Don't get me wrong, is really a "must see" for Barcelona. However is nothing super special. The thing I can say is that you should go at least once but don't have higher expectation than what you should.
Nice residence. We visited in a rainy day but it didn't matter at all, we had a great experience getting to know this old residence full of many Gaudi creations and magic.

Worth also from the outside only. We chose not to pay any entrance fee and only took photos from the outside. Still a great building and showcase of Gaudi architecture. Beautiful and great for photo opp.

Good but not the best Gaudi in Barcelona. We did the evening tour. Very good experience - fantastic building. You need to pre-book online. We had a meal there as well - not brilliant, but OK. An audio guide would make the tour better that trying to hear the girl guide,

Do not miss the visit to the roof area. From Casa Mila you can see Sagrada Familia and admire the beautiful and shapely chimneys, as well as all of Gaudi's example of Modernism in Architecture represented in his design for this building. Again, though we were not supposed to be in high season, the lines were long. I suggest buying the tixts ahead of time. After Sagrada Familia and Parc Guell, this is my third favorite place to visit in Barcelona.
Beautiful . You must see all of GAUDI'S masterpieces. So beautiful inside and out. We went early no line . Professional pics offered inside.
What a VIEW! What a roof!. Another Amazing Gaudi build. For me the best part was the roof. No - the best part was the attic with all the engineering stuff.

Living history. This building was one of Gaudí's last major projects, and has survived a century or more with most of its innovative features intact. It's now a living museum, with one apartment furnished with genuine period furniture and decor much as a well-to-do city dweller of 1915 would have known it. The rest of the building is still in use as offices and apartments.The tour starts in the interior courtyard, then goes on to the rooftop, where all of the chimneys and ventilation shafts are individually designed in surreal, twisted shapes. From the roof, Gaudí's ongoing legacy building, the Sagrada Familia, is framed by a carefully-positioned arch. Continuing downstairs in the attic space, you get a great appreciation of the building process from a series of displays, and the visible brick arches that support the roof.There is an audioguide included in the admission price, 10% discount if you have a coupon from the hop on bus. Better to prepay online to avoid the queue. There is a lift to the rooftop, and down from the apartment, but quite a few stairs in between.

Informative Gaudi museum. I wouldn't have picked this location to visit, but it was part of a day tour, and it was a pleasant surprise. The museum is well laid out and informative of Gaudi's history, design approach, and intents. Information is included for the designs of several of his famous buildings, not just La Pedrera. Seeing the structure in the attic was fascinating, as well as seeing a preserved flat and the roof. Note that the roof gets slick when wet, so it may be closed when it's raining. We thought we weren't going to be able to see it, but it opened just before we were about to leave, a couple of hours after earlier storms had stopped.

Very interesting. I did an extended translation all about the Pedrera/Casa Mila, so I was keen to experience it for myself. It was very interesting to see the roof and the unique sculptures, and the views were great. There is information about Gaudi's history and how various works of his were designed and built. There is also an apartment from the Bourgeois period. Overall it was a very interesting visit and you can choose the language for the audio guide. I chose the Spanish one and it was great. To get there - get the metro to Diagonal, it's a 2-5 minute walk.
MUST SEEN. One of the beutiful places designed by antoni gaudiHeaven for who loves art and architecture.Little bit expensive for my opinion but it worth it.A great roof and view all over Barcellona

Memorable. I definitely tend toward experiencing and seeing things on vacation that are going to trigger my memory for the rest of my life. Seeing dozens of the same Gothic church design throughout Europe is not satisfying to me. That said, Gaudi's works are both uniquely beautiful and memorable, and the Casa Mila is a fantastic expression of his creativity and the attempt to draw architecture into a more natural and religious expression. The only downside - I took the night tour, which was beautiful, but incredibly overpriced at 34 Euros.

Masterpiece. Another one of Gaudi's masterpieces in Barça.And it is set in one of the most prominent parts of the city, so you can enjoy the whole area, with its marvelous shops and architecure, if in any way you do not find this particular item interesting enough. Which I think is impossible.

Fantastic!. Not a place if you don't like heights...the roof is awesome but not for the fearful. How did Gaudi do it? How did the builders build it? How on earth could anyone have the vision? It's mind-boggling. It was our last morning and we were just going to wander round the shops...but this was a much better thing to do!
CASA MILA. One of Gaudi's famous creations, you can actually access one of the units. The hop on hop off bus will get you there..

Very Interesting. Called a pile of bricks and misunderstood when built. This is a beautiful and very interesting building. Now private resdiences but worth stopping and looking at and even looking at the roof witha miriad of odd chimneys.

The best memories about Gaudi's Barcelona. It was truly one of the best attractions in Barcelona. Great interesting tour that you could book directly through internet site of this house. Awesome Audio guide, beatiful house and design, breathtakinf views and great history around it. all was great. it a real gem for Architecture lovers. Tips: very crowdy at the entrance! Book your tickets in advance to certain time of your visit through the La Pedrera site

Stunning !!!. Well this is one of Gaudi's art pieces. It's a building with no straight walls. Beautiful architecture which pleases the eyes. expect an enormous crowd. so if you want to check the wonderful inside and the roof top of the building you must spend long time waiting.

Too beautiful to miss. Casa Mila together with Casa Batllo are the emblematic sights of Barcelona. You will never see anything like it anywhere in the world. Gaudi is a master and magician. The design is amazing like a rough see and it's balconies are the algae. Must see in NO rush.

The most amazing apartment block!. You will never see an apartment block the same nor can you appreciate it just from the outside. Pre book to avoid the queues. I didn't and waited 15mins. However, staff were very efficient selling tickets considering the number of people waiting and it was 1pm. Get an audioguide as explanations are very good and helpful. You can take a lift to 8th floor or 7th floor and walk one floor, to get to the roof where he designed a water tank and skylights. Once again Gaudi's work is amazing. You visit the attic with laundry rooms, special ventilation panels and more curves and arches. Then you walk down to a floor that has been furnished as an original 1920s apartment which gives an interesting perspective to life, albeit a wealthy one, at that time. Examples of his furniture are near the bookshop. Gaudi really was ahead of his time as he included a lift and underground car park which were unheard of features. The man was a genius!

A must see. No one likes to cue, and at peak times you will have to if you want to get, but get inside you should. The roof is simply stunning and shows one man's vision of just how interesting chimneys can really be! The apartment and lobby are stunning too but for me it's all about the chimneys!

Informativev!. It was very interesting to see another example of Gaudi's work, the this home really shows it. We also enjoyed the top floor where there was an exhibit all about Gaudi's work ... what influenced him, examples of what he's done, etc. It really helped you understand his work.

Quirky and amazing!. Gaudi's La Pedrera is well worth a visit. Ironwork on the balconies is beautiful and stone on the outside is textured to look like sand. A self supporting structure that lets light into the centre of the building with lovely blue ceramic tiles. Can't see all of it as some apartments are still lived in.

Amazing design and home. We completed our day tour of Barcelona at Le Pedrera. An incredible home designed by Antoni Gaudi. The chimney tops also feature at Sagrada Familia. The walk though the attic with the explanation on how Gaudi designed was fantastic information and then to see the life style in the open apartment. I would have loved to live here.

Enchanting . My second visit , no need for online reservations because this place doesn't get as much attention as the other Gaudi sights .There is a night program that illuminates the rooftop pieces , worth a visit .

access to Gaudi's innovative Appartment design. Wonderful access to a Gaudi masterpiece. The tour with free audio guide takes you to the enigmatic chimney pots and roof terrace, the cavernous attic and the sumptuous sample apartment of this ground breaking residential development.
Interesting work of art!. Colourful different shapes. Interesting work of art. Book online in advance so you don't have to queue that long under the heat of the sun.

Understanding Gaudi. Take the premier access tour - it's only 5 more Euros and they take you on a private elevator all the way to the top, where the tour starts. The interactive tablet guide is really innovative - I have not see one this slick anywhere. It places the objects and furniture where they would be if the house were inhabited. The rooftop is really fabulous. People still live in this building which is truly amazing

A great tour!. A unique opportunity to go inside the living quarters of a Gaudi masterpiece. Get your tickets in advance to avoid lines. The architecture is unusual and memorable. The roof is especially interesting. Go!
A Gaudi Masterpiece. This is a stunning work by Guadi -- be sure to get the audio tour when you visit. The tour starts on the roof, which is one of the most unusual features of the building.

Another Gaudi`s masterpiece. When you visit Barcelona it is like you are transported back in time, historical places at every corner, fascinating buildings and crowded streets. Something vibrant and magical, fascinating places to visit. Mila House it is another milestone in Barcelona`s history.

Unique & Interesting, Must-See in Barca. Really cool. Another one of Gaudi's amazing architecture creations within the city, this house not only offers nice outside views, but also gives the history on Gaudi. This was deemed a UNESCO heritage site in 1984.

Great, interesting house, with super views of Barcelona. Another awesome Gaudi house, which is still being lived in. Beautiful & so inventive. Rooftop terrace is a real draw with great views over Barcelona & he Sagarda Familia in the distance,. Don't miss this

Check the details. It's an architectural masterpiece. I don't think I can say much more different than many reviewers, just to take the time to admire the details, the curves, the doorknobs. And, of course, the roof.
visiting gaudi s pedrera night visit. come and visit guadi s night time spectacular light show on the roof of la pedera you will be amazed and not disappointed a sight not to be missed

Jazz under the stars on Gaudi masterpiece!. Watched the jazz evening show here. Didn't manage to tour Casa Mila during the day, but the jazz show allows you to walk through the courtyard and the top floor with some exhibits. The roof was wonderful! Undulating lines, colourful tiles, a true Gaudi building! The jazz show was really good! Band was great, and there's something about watching jazz under the stars with a cool breeze blowing and a glass of cava in your hands... Caveat: there's no real seats, so everyone's on steps/floor. A rea problem if you are with older folks who can't sit on the ground/hard steps for long. Go earlier to get some time to look at the roof and get a good seat near the band. We went 15min early and the queue was already ridiculously long!

Great tourist attraction. This was an amazing building. We paid for the audio tour, which was extremely informative and a must do for this building to fully understand all the beautiful architecture surrounding you.
Gaudi by night. Amazing how this guy Gaudi just dared to do it different. If you get the chance - a visit by night is so special. !

Magic place!. Amazing place, from the entrance to the roof. It's perfect in summer, to do during the night to a jazz concert, and then you have the ticket to visit the museum too.Sometimes they have free exhibitons, another possibility to see the part of the building, but not the whole building and the roof.I have is the beset options, because right now the entrance is expensive. Unless you are a great fan of Gaudi, then pay the entrance and you really will enjoy!
A definite must. My favourite place in Barcelona. Views from the roof are amazing and the exhibition about Guadi's work was really interesting. A definite must.

An amazing place. It is well worth spending a few Euros and the time to visit La Pedrera. I do not think it necessary to pay the extra for the guided tour. The standard entry entitles you to an audio device which provides all the information necessary. There is ample information to find your own way around. The building itself is incredible and you need a good 1.5 to 2 hours to walk around and take time to watch some of the visual displays. You cannot spend time in Barcelona without learning a little more about Gaudi.

A Gaudi masterpiece. Gaudi was so ahead of his time. Its hard to imagine an apartment building like this being built today. To tour Casa Mila is well worth the money. They have elevators that take you to the roof top where you can see the playful chimneys of the building and the skyline around Barcelona. The attic has several exibits showing Gaudi's through and building process. You can also explore one unit that is open to the public. The exposure to this made me want to visit the other Gaudi sites in Barcelona even more.

Get your tickets online, then DON'T MISS La Pedrera (Casa Mila). Before heading off to any of Antoni Gaudi's beautiful creations, get your tickets online - you will be SO sorry if you don't. With that said in advance, La Pedrera is an outstanding experience and so worth seeing! Such original, creative architecture is so rarely seen anywhere in the world, and I can't think of another place where THIS type of architecture is found but Barcelona. Of course, this was where Gaudi lived and worked, and it's impossible to duplicate. It is interesting that, like so many other outstanding architectural achievements, Gaudi had his troubles with La Pedrera - cost overruns put Gaudi at odds with Señora Mila, the City of Barcelona had problems with the height of the building (they finally acquiesced), and local Barcelonans of the time couldn't believe what was going up on the Gracia. But people finally got the hang of what they were looking at and today it's one of their proudest monuments to Antoni Gaudi's beautifully original work. SO worth seeing - in fact, it's a "don't miss".
7 flights up and then one more . To be honest..the light and sound show made up for the climbing and the not so relevant attic tour..a must despite the boring parts

An interesting addition on the Gaudi tour. If you're interested in Gaudi this is worth a look. It's a whole apartment block Gaudi designed for a couple who then rented out the rest of the apartments. It has an amazing roof space and you can visit the attic space for an insightful tour about Gaudi and his work. On the fourth floor you can wander through one of the apartments, furnished to give you a sense of life at the time. But it's not a patch on Casa Batllo so if you've only got time for one go there.

Night and Day Visits. Another Gaudi see 2x. At night there is an interesting sound and light show on the roof top terrace starring the unusual Gaudi designed chimneys. During the daytime you can peek into the actual apartments Gaudi designed for the rich and famous
Nice building .... But..... An artistic building , not worth the admission fee (20 €) , nor the line waiting to get a ticket ( took only 15 minutes) but still not worth it.

Wet and no discount. The main reason to visit this place is for the roof. We arrived after a heavy downpour and were told that because it had rained they had closed the roof for the rest of the day. I asked what discount they were offering and they said none. Needless to say us and may others left without visiting.

Another Antoni Gaudí design, see from the outside. Our local friends recommended to save our money and simply appreciate the design of Antoni Gaudí from the outside. Our early morning walk took us past and we admired for a few minutes then moved on. We are told the inside is fairly familiar to most of Antoni Gaudí designs, so take a second to see and keep going!

Another must vizit in Barcelona. Nice architectural monument. Must vizit. At my vizit the exterior was under construction and not vizible. I will return to see again when finished. Also heard that night tours faboulous..

Well worth a visit. We went at 9:20 on Sunday morning and there were no queues and very few other visitors, so we were able to take our time to walk around without feeling rushed or the house too crowded. It was interesting to see the apartment made to look how it would have been in years gone by and being able to walk around the roof was great. It is well worth a visit, if you can fit it into your schedule.
Excellent. Authentic arhitecture, beautiful sightseeing on the roof, the ticket is a little bit expensive than we expected but finally we got the best photos there.

luxury residential building. this luxury residential building which was designed by Gaudi the most famous designer of Barcelona was really especial. the entrance fee is 23 euros and you start from the roof to the ground.

Night tour is also a must. We opted for the night tour. Very different feel to the whole building and architecture. Almost like a light show on Antoni Gaudi backdrop. The tour comes with Champagne. Nice!

The casa to visit if you have to choose one. Wow if you have just one casa to visit choose this one! The highlight is the roof, but the whole visit is interesting and feels less crowded than other casas.

An Evening to remember - Concert on Roof Terrace. An experience of a lifetime to listen to Louis Armstrong music with a glass of cava on the rooftop terrace of le Pedrera. We returned the following day and were so impressed with Gaudi's brilliant design and his advanced environmental ideas. An amazing building.

Only walked past . Only walked past but it looked great in such an affluent neighbourhood! Saw lots of people on top of the building and we went quite late (7pm) so perhaps booking or getting earlier to avoid crowd would be advisable.

Fascinating Gaudi. Well worth the trip to provide an insight into Gaudi's works. Lift initially to top floor for a walk on the roof with amazing views. My wife was having some difficulty in managing the steps and the staff pro-actively asked if she would like to use the lift to get to the lower floor rather than having to negotiate the spiral staircase - very impressive response.The layout of the attic was a remarkable history of Gaudi and the technology that he used and then the apartment below gave a step back in time that was interesting

Easy visit on with many other attractions near by. First stop on walking tour of the major boulevard in Barcelona. Can't help but marvel at design. Even if you don't go inside its a must see with other attractions on the same street near by.
Genius work. This piece of art is a must to visit while in Barcelona. The way Gaudi combined art with nature is phenomenal. A genius.

Skip the night show, but definitely go during the day!. Definitely go here and, as everyone says, buy the ticket in advance. I bought the joint ticket (daytime and night). My first visit was really special; I loved learning the history and seeing Gaudi's work. The night show, however, still included bits of the tour that I had just experienced on my own earlier. Because the night tour is guided, I couldn't skip ahead, I had to sit through the same information again. The light show "Origins," was okay, but nothing too incredible. My advice is - go during the day and skip the night show.

Bourgousie Urban Mansion that Awes. This was actually the first thing I did in BCN since you have to book Sagrada in advance. I found it easily by metro and saw a huge line and a little sign that said get your tix online. Turned on my cell, bot a tix in minutes and walked in. I was hesitant at 20 euro but I soon learned that most things you do in BCN cost this. And it was worth it. It was a great way to get insights into the genuis of Gaudi and the time period he lived. It doesn't take too long. I did not stay more than a few hours. I went in the morning then could go siesta. Go enjoy this little gem.
A great 1 hour tour of Gaudi's works. Great design features by the Master Gaudi. Try to book the after hours tour (9 PM) Great Audio visual display played through music/

Gaudi. Good house, but not in so original shape as Batllo. On the other side, try to visit "Experience" - night time show on the roof with light and music, which ends with cava on the ground floor. Just be prepared for 6 floors stairs
Beautiful, but.... It was cute, but not what i expected. The exhibition is only in one of the floors and the roof.vThe ticket price is too expensive. I don't think it's worth 20 euros.
A wonder to behold. This was sheer amazement and a must for any trip to Barcelona. The audio guide being free was not only a bonus but made understanding the background to the building much easier.

Tour La Pedrera 1st to learn about Gaudi. We toured La Pedrera after having been to La Sagrada Familia and Park Guell, but would recommend see La Pedrera 1st. The audio guide and the museum in La Pedrera's "attic" provide a lot of insight into Gaudi and his architecture.

Amazing Gaudí!!. Gaudí was an incredible man. No doubt!! La Pedrera which proper name is Casa Mila was for a long time not too appreciated in Barcelona. That's why people know it by the nickname of La Pedrera. This word comes from "PEDRA" which in Catalan means rock, stone. Pedrera is a place where rocks or stones are taken from. Something like a "stone mine". Really worth visiting! Buy the tickets on-line if not you will have to wait a long time to go in.If you are in Barcelona during July and August don't miss their summer concerts up on their rooftop. Amazing experience and the view is spectacular

Beauty. Another Gaudi great.. This home with its open roof is crazy.... Beautiful lines and crazy statutes oh the roof he really took his imagination to another level... See at night so you can catch the roof show

La Pedrera - one of my favourite places to visit .. Another lovely building to see, I like this better than Sagrada Familia. Lots of nice shops around too. Great location to relax and just watch people or visit the nearby shops and restaurant .

Architecture and shopping!. Walking on the street it is easy to take a look at the interesting architecture of this building. Great location to do some shopping too. From Paseo de Gracia and Rambla de Catalunya there is plenty of shopping to do. Shoes are some of the best items to buy in Barcelona.

Imagine Living Here. I think the most interesting part of La Pedrera is that people lived and still do live here. It's another one of Gaudi's masterpieces. It's a bit pricey though which is why it's getting four stars. I think it costs more than La Sagrada. The house is incredibly fascinating though so I'd recommend a visit if you have time. When we showed up they were performing opera outside. They also have a really nice gift shop to pick up some souvenirs.
Wonderful. This must be seen. An important part of the architecture that is uniquely Barcelona. They have just finished a restorationn and it frankly looks beautiful.

Wow-a!. Buy tickets ahead of time to skip lines. Normal price 20€, student discount 16.5€. Audio tour- sonar your own pace. Apartment is nice too see but the attic not wholly interesting to me but if you want run-downs of all major buildings in Barcelona then yeah, good.

The second important Gaudi building we chose - absolutely informative and interesting, great rooftop!. Chose to do this one alone, the others weren't keen - their loss! Really enjoyed it all - there are 3 components, the rooftop, the attic and the living quarters of one original family - all beautiful, informative, great videos and exhibits, I felt I really know them well by the finish, and appreciated Gaudi's vision and architecture even more. A must for all visitors.
A Must See. This is a fabulous place to visit. Lots and lots of steps to climb but worth it for the incredible views

Jazz atop La Pedrera. La Pedrera on Passeig de Gracia is one of the iconic Gaudi houses in Barcelona. We attended the weekly jazz concert held on Fridays during the summer, held on the undulating rooftop of the building. Entry half an hour before the concert ,allows you to wander about the exhibit on the top floor before ascending to the rooftop to enjoy the complimentary glass of cava and look out over Barcelona while listening to fine jazz , a heady mix indeed.

Night time tour is amazing!. We booked on the Origins tour at night time. It began with a short talk and then up many many stairs to the attic. There we heard more about Gaudi. The highlight of this tour is the 15 minute projection light and music show on the roof top. It is breathtaking. The tour finishes with a glass of cava and a tasty treat. Tip - be prepared to climb A LOT of steps. Be careful to wear good shoes. Dine at Casa Alfonso on Roger de Lluria before you go. Great food, service and cava!
Fascinating!. Touristy, but still truly fascinating. We particularly enjoyed seeing inside one of the apartments! Quite pricey for entrance though!

Brilliant Gaudi. I was told that if I pay admission to any Gaudi it should be here. So true. I don't need to go in to the others-apart from Parc guell which I did wander around without having to pay to go into a section.La pedrera show cased his best. His design and the building are wonderful. Earlier in the day has less crowds. Get ticket online so you don't queue.worth the 20€

Loved It . What a fantastic place place it's big it's grand and it's full of walking. Lifts are available but it's mainly used by the less able people. Book in advanced and spend time on the roft of the building as it's the main attraction.
Fascinating!. Fascinating, beautiful and so different. We went with a private guide on a Gaudi Tour. Highly recommend this place and going on a tour so you get the most out of your visit!
Another "Juwel" by Gaudi. This building is already fantastic from the outside but do not miss to visit the inside with its astonishing architecture and the rooftop with its amazing views.

Hard to just walk by. Another Gaudi masterpiece in architecture. I would feel a little odd living in this building with all the onlookers passing by. It's hard not to though.
What detail! What imagination!
Another must see of Gothic design when in Barcelona.

Indicative of Gaudis work. Must see site, indicative of Gaudi work but very expensive, regular ticket more than 37 euros!!! Registered under different names,"la pedrera", "Mila Villa" dont get mixed up..

A must-see in Barcelona. Antoni Gaudi designed this house for a family, but it is so much more than a gorgeous home and apartments. Gaudi used curves and forms from nature to create a one-of-a-kind building that shows the visitor what is was like to live at the turn of the 20th century.. As you walk through the various floors, there is a surprise around every corner - moldings, flooring, door knobs, furniture. Fabulous from start to finish.
stunning rooftop. my second visit in 15 years, and happy to be back. the apartment was a nice supplement, but entry is a bit too expensive...

Don't Miss this Amazing Building. It was someone's home - and Gaudi designed and built it. Unbelievable isn't it? Well its true! And just a short bus ride away from the centre of the city. To call it a house is like calling Barcelona FC a football team! Its a large building which used to house a single wealthy (hardly surprising) family in the early 20th century. It is now mostly offices and family apartments. You only get to see the roof and the loft and an apartment but it is really worth it. The roof is amazing. Its like walking into a living museum of art. Up close and personal. Strange shapes - typical of Gaudi - but all functional and with a purpose. Colouful too. Take the express at an extra cost if you don't want to queue.

Gaudi's La Pedrera at Night is Fabulous !. This apartment has a tour feature titled " Gaudi's La Pedrera at Night" I booked it last minute and walked down from my hotel and did the tour solo. What a nice experience ! A fully guided tour inside this beautiful building. The treat at the end was the rooftop music/light show projected on the structures. then everyone returns to the lobby and celebrates with a glass of Cava !
great picture. Such a cool building to see in real life and take some great pictures. A must see when seeing the sites of the city

Gaudi´s terrific work. It´s a really unexpected architecture, the kind of special architecture you just see in Barcelona. It´s a place you need to visit if you go to Barcelona. Unfortunately the lines are quite big to visit. So, if you want get in, go early.

A must see.. Another don't miss. Again buy your tickets ahead of time online and avoid long lines and wait times. This is an architectural marvel. It is well worth the visit to understand what a genius Gaudi was.
Great place to visit, highly recommend.. Really enjoyed the whole experience of this, including the rooftop architecture and the Gaudi museum inside the building. Excellent, highly recommend.
Building is great - tour not as good as Batllo. This is a great building, especially the roof. However, I did not think the tour was nearly as good as the Casa Batllo.

Gaudi.. As if La Sagrada Fam. was not enough!!. Gaudi never seizes to blow me away. Imagine would could have come up with these buildings between the late 1800's and early 1900's. Walk around the building and get a close look at the balconies.
Typical Barcelona architecture. We didn't go inside. But the building was beautiful. It is also surrounded by very nice stores. Eixample is a very nice neighborhood.
To walk look and keep walking. I'm not really a big fan of art or abstract so I looked at the building and didnt see anything that would impress me. Its a building with a different arquitecture.

Love this house. I have been here as a 10 year old and came again with my friends. It impressed me the same way as it did when I was little. Once you take the elevator upstairs you have a stunning view over the city. A beautiful building by Gaudi. Once you descend you can see how life was within the house. Strongly recommend a visit.
Not Impressive . I failed to understand what is this all.about and why is this an attraction first place.Not worth if you dont have time.

Love a good Gaudi. We did an audio tour of La Pedrera and loved every minute and nook and cranny! Gaudi's design has stood the test of time, infact it's said that George Lucas took some of his inspiration from Gaudi's roof top. Being able to walk through the building and a furnished apartment as it would have been in the 30's, was a treat! Added bonus was the "museum" in the roof cavity which gave some insights into Gaudi's methods and inspiration.

A super time. Sadly it was very crowded and the exterior was being renovated when we were there, but it was still worth it. The roof and apartment were great and the view of the surrounding building a bonus.

Gaudi's glory. La Pedrera, it looks alive with it's undulating lines. On the first floor you can sit in splendour and sip a glass of wine, eat or drink coffee and watch the shoppers and sightseers go by below you.

See This First. It is hard to believe that this building is 100 years old, it looks like it was built yesterday. Besides being outstanding, the "attic", that is the floor below the roof has a large exhibit on Gaudi's work including all his buildings and Park Guell. If you see this first, you will understand better how Gaudi developed all his other buildings. Hard to believe what Gaudi was able to accomplish without the aid of computers or CAD software, he was truly a genius.

Essential viewing. Gaudi architecture looks magnificent from the outside but this is a great opportunity to visit a building that remains occupied and functional. The roof terrace is an iconic feature that must be seen but please be careful as the steps are uneven and I nearly had an accident while foolishly attempting to take a photograph without paying proper attention. (We were warned!) The show flat is perfectly preserved and for once the two shops contain items that are really worth buying. This is right in the middle of the main shopping area and near to some other Gaudi buildings so overall a very enriching experience!
Must when in Barcelona. Visited last year with friends and thoroughly enjoyed the tour, views from the rooftop were fantastic!
Fabulous - the roof is a must!. Fabulous place, highly recommend a visit, with a MUST on paying the extra to go out onto the roof, absolutely amazing!
Cataluña with friends. Another Beautiful attractions found in the center of Barcelona.just 10 mins.by foot from cataluña.this area is close also to some shopping store and accesible by bus and tren.

Very interesting . Well worth the money. Do this trip by day when you get to visit not just the roof but also the attic, apartment and lower courtyards. Its the attic and apartment that are the most interesting. Fasinating place.

Casa Mila in all of its splendor!. It is a must-see when you're in Barcelona! It really does showcase Gaudi's talent, and if you happen to go on the tour, you will really benefit from all of the input. It's a fairly large museum and I totally appreciated walking through the different portions of it to see rooms set up as they would have been in the past and seeing the architecture and design that went into making it the grand work that it is. The museum staff is very knowledgeable. Enjoy!

Wow Wow WOW!. Having learned from our visit to the Segrada Familia we booked online and avoided the queues. This is a truly amazing place. A set of headphones plays the history of the building during your visit. My advice is to take some water. The visit will take you about 2 hours and there are a lot of steps and it gets warm, particularly up the stairs and on the roof. A must see when in Barcelona.
Amazing. Another Gaudi design, definitely a must to see as you get to see a vacant apartment. Amazing architecture.

a memorable visual and taste experience, Barcelona Style. The place inside is spectacular roof simulating waves and gives you a sense of movement."Cafe de la Pedrera" is a restaurant on the Jujol room with food chef Author. Delicious and innovative with interesting flavors

Gobsamcking!. Gaudi was a genius and his architecture makes Barcelona stand out from the crowd. La Pedrera is another amazing example. I want to live there! the roof with its chimneys and sweeping curves are frankly, breathtaking. DO NOT MISS A TRIP here and book online to walk straight in.

Lovely tour and City views from the roof. We enjoyed the tour of the house in Barcelona. The lines were long but we just purchased on our phones and walked right in. The elevator is extremely slow to get to the roof thus there was added wait time. Overall the self-guided tour was informative and easy-to-follow. They pack quite a few people through the house therefore there was congestion moving about. Overall it was worth it.
Introduction to gaudi. Good walk through about Gaudi's life and history. Construction is good, might get to view some old and rich lifestyle of Barcelona.
Another 'must do' attraction. A great attraction. Another 'must do' in my opinion. We didn't have to wait and it was peak season. The audio guide was excellent and the architecture amazing.

Gaudi's architect. Another Gaudi's job, same as all other works of his, it did not disappoint us. Only the rooftop, attic floor, top floor, ground floor is open for visit. With lots of exhibition showing Gaudi's other works inside the attic's exhibition level.

What's it gonna cost to put me in a 2-bedroom? Balcony required.. La Pedrera is a modernist marvel! We bought VIP tickets so we got to go in a special entrance but I'm not sure that was worth it. The roof is definitely the best part; buy the audio guide so you get to learn why the entire building (including the Mila apartment) is so fabulous.

Great and even better with Tour Guide. I did the English tour guide (not the audio tour) and it was great. The guide was knowledgeable and spoke English well and could answer other off topic questions. The structure is beautiful and Gaudi's genius is everywhere. If you have enough time, it is nice to see one Gaudi structure a day so you can appreciate each.

My favourite. The building is amazingly beautiful. It creates a very strong impression due to its fluid lines. Gaudi's naturalism is visible outside in the iron leaf shaped balconies. It made me think of a natural cave.Do not miss.
Worth a view!. We didn't actually go inside, there was a huge line, but it's worth a walk by at least for photo opps. Very interesting looking building.
Go up to the rooftop. Not far from a stop on one of the open top bus tours, worth a look if you like Gaudi architecture. Can visit the roof for the views.

Well Worth the Visit. Quite unlike anything else we have seen. Very unique architecture, and a well=presented self-guided tour. Hard to imagine that anyone would finance the construction of such a building.
Truly memorable. Truly stunning not good if you have fear of heights my husband was prostrate but still enjoyed it. The roof top is wonderful
Must go. Wow! impressive place! This is a "must go" corner of Barcelona. Don't try it on weekends, cause is very crowd.

"I am not sure if I handed this certifcate to a mad man or a genius.". When we arrived a little before 10am, there was only a short lineup. So if you intend to go see this, go early. IMHO, although the entrance was more expensive than Park Guell but it was definitely worth spending the time and money than the Park. The title of my review was from the audio guide's narration when the dean of the architectural school gave the certificate to Gaudi. You can see his ingenious vision in design by visualizing Sagrada Familia with the floor plan mounted on a board hung upside down with chains. Can't say anymore about this without being a spoiler for anyone else planning to visit. The roof & its chimneys showed his playful whimsical side. While his use of scrap metal showed his environmental conservation side. The apartments layouts and floor plan still felt contemporary today is a testament to his forward vision. The whole building is so beautiful, it is a privilege to be a resident there. Gaudi's designs were functional too and so inspiring that architects still pay homage by seeing them in person. We spoke with a New York architect (while in line at La Paradeta) who came all the way just to see them. Even though I am not knowledgeable on architecture, I am still glad I had seen this Unesco site.

Interesting - but not my cup of tea. First time in Barcelona, so thought we would check out the top 5 or so sites. Staying at Hotel Arts and the Club concierge recommended a few including Casa Mila.
